column3:
TL;DR: If the user.config file gets corrupted, SourceTree 1.9.6.1 will not start.

 

I tried to put details in my question https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/44095261

 

Copy/pate:

 

My PC (running Win 10 with latest updates) shut down hard from a sudden power off (human error).

I click on the SourceTree icon and it does ... nothing. No message. Just no start. I click on the icon, get the busy symbol for a moment, and nothing.

I did a complete uninstall and install with the latest SourceTree 1.9.6.1 with no change in behavior.

 

I was eventually able to solve the problem with the following (again, copy/paste):

 

I found that the file

 

\Users\<username>AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree.exe_Url_<randomstring>\1.9.6.1\user.config
was corrupted. Instead of being full of XML, most of the file was full of zeroes (0x00).

 

I copied the user.config file from the 1.9.6.0 sibling directory. I've lost some settings but SourceTree is working again.
column4: Corrupted user config file prevent SourceTree from starting

Using a basic schema for git subtree I created 2 repository on Github: "project" and "framework" and made the followings:

Clone "project" repository
Add Subtree "framework" in a folder named "framework_dir"
Navigate through "project/framework_dir" and create test.txt
In the "project" working copy add test.txt to and commit it.
Pushing "project" gives the right result on the project repo. I then try to push this change to "framework" but it loops endlessly without giving any errors.

Same manipulation seems to work on the mac app on Mac OSX

Thanks.

column3:
I use SourceTree with remote Windows network shares that come and go with regular use. Every time nearly any interaction is done on the UI, SourceTree decides to go lookup some data from the network shares. This, in my use case, always has a 30-90 second timeout that prevents any UI updates. Windows even thinks the program has crashed usually and I must select "Wait for application to finish". Once accessing the file actually times out, the UI usually becomes responsive again for a little bit until it decides to go and check missing network shares again.

This makes me think the thread that does the UI drawing also does the filesystem interaction which means if the filesystem is slow, the UI is slow.

I believe is is the inaccessible network shares that are causing this issue because I can see large pauses in Sourcetree's activity in Sysinternals' Procmon. I have felt the "slowness" that many many other users have reported before I started using network shares. This is different. The UI unresponsiveness for 30+ seconds only started after using network shares.
column4: UI Locks up when SourceTree updates repositories

column3:
When performing a complex rebase deep into a tree, the operation will occasionally fail due to "index.lock" being present, with a message about another git process in operation. If the abort-rebase also fails, the repository can be left in an inconsistent state with possible data loss.

I suspect there is a background process in Sourcetree that is using a git command that monitors for changes/etc that remains active during the rebase process, and there is a race condition where sometimes it manages to grab the lock and causes the rebase to fail. The fix is probably to suspend this process during the rebase and resume afterwards.

To reproduce, select a commit ~15 commits behind the current branch, and select "rebase children of DEADBEEF interactively". Then squash some of the commits at the bottom, or edit some messages, etc to cause everything above it to be rebased onto the changed commit.

It does not occur every time, but farther back is more likely to cause it to reproduce, so try going farther back if you can't get it to reproduce.

Strangely, the bug does not seem to occur when running a command-line interactive rebase, even if SourceTree is still open (tested once or twice but not thoroughly confirmed)
column4: Interactive-rebases fail due to index.lock w/ possible data loss

column3:
Even with "Perform submodule actions recursively" turned off, performing a Discard/Reset on a submodule edit in the main project performs a recursive call. If you have nestled dependencies, this will become a much larger operation than desired, and forces you to use the terminal or accept a "christmas tree" filestructure where several submodules are stored multiple times, which makes the repo far larger than it needs to be. In our case we have 6 submodules with interdependencies, which leads to 47 submodules when fully "expanded".

The fix should be as simple as removing the --recursive flag if it's off in options. There might be other places where this flag is ignored, so might be worth checking all usages of --recursive in your code.

I'm demonstrating the bug in the two attached screenshots.
column4: Sourcetree does a recursive call when reverting submodule edits even when recursive is turned off

column3: If you take a look at the UI and have a lot of branches there is no chance to see the actual Branch without scrolling. And at this point I always want to double check, that I'm merging to the proper place, but can't see the actual branch. It would also great to just simply assign the name of the actual branch to the question, like: 'Are you sure to want to branch XYZ into your current branch (ABC)?'

It would be nice if version 3.x.x doesn't always stores the account passwords.

If password storage could be disabled or at least only stored until end of application, it would be much more secure.

However since windows password dialg won't have the don't store password check, this isn't possible right now with the windows credential store in background.

 

Only rather time consuming workaround. Delete all credentials at end of sourcetree usage.

column3:
If user enters invalid password it is stored in passwd file:

%USERPROFILE%\AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree\passwd

 

It is never corrected if the user later enters the correct password.

Suggest purging the hash stored if login fails.

 

Note: I tried to put this as a bug but the fields don't show up when I select Issue Type bug.
column4: Credential Store

After the last update, I now have the following symptom: 

I run SourceTree and it seems to work fine.  *I minimize it, and then later go to restore it.  It does not restore.*  This is consistent and happens every time.   Instead of restoring, I hear the windows beep that you get when you click on something out of focus - maybe there is a dialog that is hidden that is blocking it? (Though I don't see any such dialog when I Alt_Tab and look at the preview, it does sort-of behave that way.) 

I try Alt+Tab, and I can tab over to Sourcetree, but it still does not open, (I just hear the beep).

If I right-click on SourceTree in the task bar, I can close it with the "X Close Window" option, and then it will open fine again.  This is the only thing I have found that helps.

This issue does not occur on my second PC, even though the setups are identical as far as I can tell.

column3:
Please create tool tips / "hints" for all the user interfaces in standalone Sourcetree for Windows.   

As it is right now, there are many things to click on and check and tweak where the meaning can only be guessed at by the end user.   This results in a lot of mistakes, frustration, and fear in new and even more experienced users, as users are left to only guess at what various tools and options actually do.

This seems like a super easy and low-risk change to make, that can vastly improve the experience for many of us.

_PS: I hope this is the right spot to make suggestions - I'm just guessing based on the links from your support site.   It sort of feels like I should not be here :)_
column4: Add tool tips "hints" for all Sourcetree user interface elements

column3:
h2. 00 Before

We have a remote branch that we need to fetch
!00 Before.PNG!

h2. 01 Fetch context menú

We use context menu to fetch

!01 Context Menu.PNG!
  
h2. 02 Fech console log

We see the console log that says
{noformat}
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false fetch origin release/v0.1.0_Ian:v0.1.0_Ian{noformat}
when it must says
{noformat}
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false fetch origin release/v0.1.0_Ian:release/v0.1.0_Ian{noformat}

column3:
In Source Tree, when there is merge conflict, I launch the external diff tool P4Merge. In the P4Merge I resolved the conflict, click save and Exit in P4Merge. It is suppose that the conflict in the source tree disappear, however it is not. The conflict file still in the 'unstaged file" window. 

When I reboot the PC, the problem solved: The conflict disappear when exit P4Merge. This problem happens repeatedly, I need to reboot the PC when this issue occur.
column4: P4Merge has problem as External diff tool in SourceTree
Merge happens many a times while checkout of another branch

column3:
When selecting "Amend latest commit" while the commit text box is empty, a message box with the following text is displayed:

"Do you want to replace the commit text above with the message form the previous commit?"

Since there is no commit text present, there should not be any message box displayed asking to replace it.
column4: "Amend latest commit" asks to replace empty commit text

column3:
git ls-files --others --exclude-from=.git/info/exclude

# Lines that start with '#' are comments.

# For a project mostly in C, the following would be a good set of

# exclude patterns (uncomment them if you want to use them):

# *.[oa]

# *~

# Cobol

 

*

 

 

!Copybook/

!Copybook/*.cob

 

#Alt-Zs

 

apolcrp1.cob

arbenr11.cob

AMATURIT.cob

termmyga.cob

runsquot.cob

arelarpt.cob

rungridr.cob

 

!Source/

!Source/*.cob

Source/apolcrp3.cob

 

!Screens/

!Screens/*.h

LPKEYS.H

 

!Screens/*.rc

stempcpy.rc

 

 

 

The above is a copy of the .gitignore file that I've converted to the exclude file. While it was in a global .gitignore file the Alt-Zs were being ignored as expected. However once I changed the logic to the exclude file SourceTree no longer is ignoring them. It's treating them as new files.

 

Please advise as to why the logic doesn't work for the exclude file and what I need to type differently to ensure that it does.

 

Thanks!
column4: Exclude File

column3:
in sourcetree, when using right click on file => git log, it will git log it for this branch only.
however it would be much more helpful, to either
a) by default git log -all, so we can see the commits of this file in all branches

OR
b) add a second option for "git log all" so user can decide what he wants.

atm git log -all is only available in terminal, but it is a feature that tremendously helps find issues/where something went wrong with the file - which is what git log is all about.
column4: git log -all option (or default behaviour change)

column3: client configuration api 1
column4: client configuration api 1

column3:
When I fetch with "Fetch all tags" unticked, sourcetree still fetches all tags.

This causes long running "Fetching older commits..." because it goes back to the oldest tag.

This is because the tag behavior is changed in git 2.12:

By default, tags that point at objects that are downloaded from the remote repository are fetched and stored locally. This option disables this automatic tag following. The default behavior for a remote may be specified with the remote.<name>.tagOpt setting.

So --no-tags should be added when "Fetch all tags" is not ticked or a checkbox should be added. (like: Do not Fetch any tags)
column4: Fetch with "Fetch all tags" unticked still fetches all tags

column3: When creating multiple branches, it is difficult to view the hierarchy as the folders do not go to the top of the list. This is really un-intuitive.
column4: Order branches with folders at the top

column3:
Can you allow text boxes that need to scroll horizontally, to do so when holding SHIFT and scrolling the mouse wheel?

On the OS X version of SourceTree, the text boxes that exceed with width of its parent container can be scrolled horizontally using the mouse/trackpad.

On Windows, there is no mouse mechanism for doing this (even the "tilt" feature on some mouse's middle buttons does not work). If SHIFT+mouse wheel functionality were added, SourceTree would behave similar to how web browsers handle too-wide-to-fit text boxes.
column4: Shift-scrollwheel for horizontal text scroll

column3:

column3:
It is easy to get GitHub pull requests as branches. This allows us to fully manage PRs, entirely in SourceTree, without you having to extend the app / UX at all.

PRs are hosted at `refs/pull/*/heads`. The default git config only fetches from `refs/head/*`. All SourceTree would have to do is add one more fetch spec to the git config, and everything else works.

See https://gist.github.com/piscisaureus/3342247 for directions. I did this myself and it gave me exactly the experience I wanted.

Not sure what you'd have to add for BitBucket (how it stores PRs), but I suspect something similar?
column4: Trivial way to support GH Pull Requests

column3:
This would be especially useful with Git Flow. If you're working on a feature branch, and want to finish the feature and merge back to develop, there's a high chance that someone has made changes to the develop branch, which means your develop branch is out of date. To be able to finish the feature, you'd have to switch to develop, pull from the origin, switch back to the feature branch, and then then finish the feature.

It would be much better if you could just make your develop branch pull the latest updates without having to switch back and forth to it. Luckily, it's very trivial to do with git. Just run a fetch command!

{noformat}
> git fetch origin develop:develop
{noformat}

This would fetch the latest changes from origin's develop into your own.

Ideally, the git flow commands should do that automatically (or better yet - present a prompt for that), but I'd love it if I had a "Fetch from origin" option in the context menu of a branch as well!
column4: Allow branch specific fetching / (pulling updates into a branch without switching to it)

column3:
Currently, the external diff can only be invoked, if one file is selected. I would like to have this changed. I use WinDiff, which supports comparing multiple file pairs at once (-I argument).

Command line help:

{noformat}
Usage:

	windiff [options] path1 [path2]

Options:

-D	Compare one directory only.
-F[flags] savefile	Save composite file to 'savefile'.  The 'flags' may consist of one or more of I (identical), L (left), R (right), F (moved leFt), G (moved riGht), S (Similar left), A (similiAr right), X (exit after saving list).
(e.g. -FLF saves list of Left or moved-leFt lines).
-I file	Reads list of files to compare, from the specified input file.  Each line can contain one or two filenames, space delimited (with quoting, if filenames contain spaces).  Use "-" as the filename to read from stdin.  If a line contains only one filename, the file is compared to itself.
-N name	NET SEND notification to 'name' at end of comparison.
-O	Outline view (no automatic expansion).
-P	Perverse comparison: breaks lines on punctuation.
-S[flags] savefile	Save list of files to 'savefile'.  The 'flags' may consist of one or more of S (same), L (left), R (right), D (different), X (exit after saving list).
(e.g. -SLD saves list of Left or Different files).
-T	Compare whole subtree.
{noformat}
So SourceTree would need to generate a temporary text file, with each line containing two versions of a file (space seperated with quotes around name), as an alternative method, it may copy the files to a temporary location and then compare the temporary and the versioned folders.

While the second one is easier to achieve it is dirty, because it potentially creates a lot of files. Most diff utilities allow the user to edit files, so that would also no longer work.

Implementing the list feature would be a great addition, when you want to compare many files in the project at once to get an overview of all changes.

The External Diff Settings window would need an additional "parameters" input field so a user can define parameters for a multi file compare
column4: Allow Diff of multiple files

column3:
When a bunch a repositories need to be cloned in the context of a project, this can easily be scripted using straight git.

Afterwards these working copies need to be added in sourcetree. Doing this manually through the GUI is a long and tedious process. It is possible to edit the "bookmarks.xml" configuration file, but this would be very fragile.

Therefor this request to make this functionality available from the command-line. As far as I can see only 2 parameters are needed to add a working copy: the location of the working copy, and the location where the repository should appear in the bookmarks list.

(I would like to use this in the context of automating as much as possible the environment setup when someone new joins a development project.)

It is related to SRCTREEWIN-1250, but this is not about launching the GUI ready to clone a repo.. it is specifically about adding existing working copies in the sourcetree bookmarks list.
column4: CLI improvement to register existing working copy in bookmarks list

column3: SourceTree is unable to authenticate using pageant as long as a private key is saved in Putty's default profile - even if it's the same (and only) key in use system-wide. I searched for three hours before finding this link: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/153759?src=search\r\nI'm only using one private key, but i tried the suggestion anyway. Once I removed my key from the default profile, that same key works just fine through pageant. This is not a problem elsewhere - I have had no problem connecting with other git gui software using pageant with the same default profile, etc. - the *only* program that choked on it is SourceTree. But it makes no sense - if the default profile was overriding SourceTree's configuration or pageant's selected key, it would be overriding it with the exact same key (not a copy stored in another location - the exact same file). SourceTree also worked just fine when I converted my key to the OpenSSH format and changed SourceTree's configuration to use that method instead of putty - again, with the exact same key pair.
column4: Unable to connect to repo using pageant for authentication

This could be provided either as a setting of within the tags popup menu if you want to keep the standard alphabetical ordering.

However, using a regex against tags to match dots and order tokens separately (with left-most priority) should be a good default sorting algorithm.

column3:
What Happens:

If a new clone of a repository is cancelled mid-way, the git.exe instances that are spawned to support that clone are not closed by SourceTree. Even upon exiting the application, the processes are still dormant in memory.

Furthermore, downloaded files are still locked by those instances of git.exe preventing their deletion!

What was expected:

Cancelling a clone operation would close all instances of git.exe. Also, all file locks would be deleted. Ideally the files from a half-cloned repo would also be cleaned as well (prompt??). 

Attachments:

Screenshot showing the spawned processes. Note that SourceTree.exe is NOT running at the time of this screen shot.
column4: Git.exe remains open after closing SourceTree

column3:
As ignored in: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-376

This is not a "bug" in msysgit, as msysgit has already addressed the correct solution for this, which is to convert the backslashes in the path to forward slashes.  It's not necessarily the most politically correct solution, but git is a Linux tool and Linux does not like paths with backslashes, so it does make a kind of sense.  If you are waiting on msysgit to address this in a different manner you will be waiting an awfully long time as they have already addressed this issue as described.

This is also something that your other Windows git tool competitors all already handle correctly because they take Windows seriously.  Git Extensions does this.  TortoiseGit does this.  Etc.  They all handle Windows UNCs silently and without complaint by simply converting the path internally by replacing backslashes with forward slashes, which git expects and handles.  SourceTree is the only major tool which does not do this.

So if you would like to match your other competitors Windows git GUI tools by supporting Windows UNCs, a vital necessity to Windows uers, then all that you have to do is internally convert the path string with a simple find-and-replace of all backslashes to forward slashes.

Otherwise your Windows git tool competitors will all continue to have a significant compelling advantage over your Windows port of SourceTree.
column4: SourceTree for Windows does not handle UNCs

*Summary*

Renaming a local repository in the main app paints the text white, the same as the input field, rendering the text unreadable.

 

*Steps to reproduce*
 # Open Sourcetree local repository list
 # Right-click an item and select "rename" from the context menu
 # Start writing a new name

 

*Expected results*

Text to be of different color than the background of the input field.

 

*Actual results*

Text is white, as is the background
column4: Unreadable text when renaming repo

column3:
I would like to select multiple discrete commits in History tab, and use context menu(right menu)'s "Reverse Commit..." to revert them all, I'd also like it to show the new commit as a single one instead of multiple commits.

Currently SourceTree shows "Reverse Commit..." when I select a single commit, but grays it out when I select multiple commits.

Git supports it, and I think it's not that hard to implement. And also, please consider adding an option box to highlight commits made by others. I need this because I work in a cooperative, and often need to cleanup our master branch from others' old commit in order to do a "Emergency Rollback" or such.
column4: Revert multiple discrete commits

column3: It would be nice if the actions of a hunk in the file changes pane, stayed at the top as you scroll. Kind of sticky positioning, as in CSS3.\r\n\r\nSometimes when you have large files with many changed hunks, you have to scroll back and forth to select lines or hunks, and it's easy to miss the actions of the hunk in which you selected the lines. Then you must search again for the start of the hunk, can be a bit frustrated at times.
column4: Sticky positioning changes pane actions

column3: It's great to see that the "Sign commit" setting is now remembered since SourceTree 2.5. However, now I'm never certain if this setting is even enabled because I'm working with a lot of repositories. So I'm still opening up "Commit Options…" to see if "Sign commit" is enabled.\r\n\r\nMy suggestion is to show an icon (e.g., padlock) next to "Commit Options…" or the commit history button if "Sign commit" is enabled. If it isn't enabled, don't show the icon.
column4: Show an icon that commit will be signed

column3:
The normal workflow is: changing files > staging them > committing them

This should be reflected in the layout of the corresponding sections in SourceTree. I.e. from top to bottom.

The "Staged files" and "Unstaged files" tabs are however switched, which makes absolutely no sense.

Btw: Major competitors ([gitup.co|http://gitup.co/], [gitkraken.com|http://gitkraken.com/], ...)  have them in the correct order.
column4: Add option to switch "Staged files" and "Unstaged files" tabs

column3: Something
column4: testing

column3: I feel it would benefit SourceTree greatly to bring the ui together rather than have the repo listings separate from the source control project.  Perhaps having a drawer down the left hand side of with which you could quickly toggle between projects.  For those who work on several screens and projects, it just makes it an additional hassle to locate where all the different screens may wind up.  I see no benefit (from a UI standpoint) in keeping them separate, and a single application window would be extremely helpful for keeping things organized.\r\n\r\nThis would eliminate the need for an additional screen for each repo, and someone could just toggle down the side which project they want to focus on.
column4: UI - Combine Repository listing with Repo UI

column3: When I'm creating a new local repository, and choose to create remote repository too, and the repository name is using special chars (in my case it was: "Etický tender"), I am not able to create the remote and I get this weird error message (see the screenshot).\r\n\r\nI am then able to return and create new repository ("eticky-tender"), and it is successfully created, but is not linked to the local.
column4: Unable to create Bitbucket Cloud remote with special characters

column3:
After adding subtree from command line i go to SourceTree and i couldn't find any listing in the nav menu for subtrees

and i notice another problem that if we remove the subtrees from the command line they are not removed from SourceTree ..
column4: SourceTree not showing Git Subtree added manually

column3:
Would love the ability to directly open an Xcode Workspace (xcworkspace) or xcodeproj
For bonus points - make those shortcuts scriptable so people can customize sourcetree to the program they use. 

The code is pretty easy to do in swift - if you have that portion of the Mac app open - I am happy to submit a pull request.
column4: Allow us to Customize the Short cut icons in the top right hand corner

column3: The "Show Repository Browser" shortcut has changed from CMD+B to CMD+O with one of the latest releases. But CMD+O is reserved by "Open...", which makes the key binding useless. Please change it back to CMD+B.
column4: The "Show Repository Browser" shortcut has changed from CMD+B to CMD+O with one of the latest releases. But CMD+O is reserved by "Open...".

column3: Luckily GitHub is supported so that I can maintain my projects on my account, but my company uses Gitlab, and from what I can see Gitlab isn't currently supported. For now, I can only use SourceTree for personal use because of this, but I would really like to use it for my company. If Gitlab becomes supported, I will be able to uninstall the other Git client I use (SmartGit) and solely use SourceTree as the Git client for both personal and company-related projects.
column4: GitLab support

column3: Please turn off the "Push Changes immediately" checkbox if there are new commits on the remote branch.  I can't pull those until I commit my local changes, and if they are pushed right away the push will fail. The flow would work better if that flag could be just a bit smarter.  After all SourceTree knows there are new commits as it numbers them in the pull icon.\r\n
column4: Make "Push Changes immediately" a bit smarter

column3:
It is reproducible every time for me. I've attached the crash log, I think it is an easy fix.
Steps to reproduce:
1) Checkout any branch, commit something with any commit message.
2) Checkout another branch
3) Click on the commit message text field so it becomes the first responder
4) Press CMD Z
column4: SourceTree crashes when user presses CMD+Z on empty commit message field

column3: Users cannot complete installing SourceTree but they get stuck in account settings. See also the attached. It happens on any version of SourceTree WIN and MAC.
column4: Cannot complete the installation but get stuck in account setting

column3:
On Mac, the "Ignore Whitespace" option is missing when diffing files.

On Windows, this seems to be already added:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-1025
column4: Add "Ignore Whitespace" option for SourceTree for Mac in internal diff

column3:
Love the new UI look for version 2.2 Mac (Build 46). But in this redesign, you removed the Gitflow button from the toolbar. To make matters worse, you removed the toolbar to even house a Gitflow button if the user customizes it.

C'mon guys. Gitflow is an essential workflow to most Git users. How can you take a button that kicks off a process that is used dozens of times a day by millions of developers, and relegate that to a submenu?  

Please do us all a favor and restore the Gitflow button back to the toolbar. Please. With sugar on top. 

Thank you.
column4: Latest update removes Gitflow button from toolbar

column3: This request is to enable us to select multiple branches/stashes in the source list in order to be able to bulk delete them.
column4: select multiple branches/stashes

column3: There was once a copy SHA to clipboard menu item in the edit menu, this is a request to bring that + key command back.  I realize that there is a copy SHA to clipboard in the contextual menu, but i largely use keyboard commands for such things.
column4: Resurrect Copy SHA command in main menu

column3: It would be nice to be able to have multiple guides when committing e.g. 50 and 80, for the title and the message of the commit.
column4: Allow multiple column guides in the commit window

column3:
I use a lot of technical terms in my commit texts.
SourceTree's textview autocorrects things in a bad bad way.

When I type "json" then two seconds later SourceTree replaces it with "son".
When I type "serialize" then it becomes "serialise".
When I type "swifty" it becomes "swift".

I have made several commits where a message that used the right terms got autocorrect just the moment that I hit commit. I write using 10 fingers, so I'm writing fast. It is really annoying to get autocorrect, when it's wrong.

Please make an option to disable autocorrect in the commit message textview.

Perhaps make a red underline, below the words that may be typed incorrect.
column4: Disable autocorrect in the commit-textview

column3: When I click on "Commit", the search field gets selected by default. I expect that I'd rather type in the commit message and hit enter to commit.
column4: Auto-focus on commit message field on commit

column3:
Typo is in the "Allgemein" (General) tab of the Applicaiton Preferences.

See attachment.

I think
"Wähle alle Dateien bei einem Comic"

should be
"Wähle alle Dateien bei einem *Commit*"
column4: Typo in German translation in Preferences Pane

column3: I regularly work with many repositories opened and it opens one window for each instead of managing them in tabs. I think having tab would be a simple solution and would be way better!
column4: Create tabs instead of windows for each repository

column3:
Seems there's a problem with the build.

Probably need to deal with symbolic links correctly.

mymac-4 /Applications $ ll SourceTree.app//Contents/Frameworks/Sparkle.framework/Versions/A/Resources/fr_CA.lproj
lrwxr-xr-x 1 me admin 110 Feb  3 10:34 SourceTree.app//Contents/Frameworks/Sparkle.framework/Versions/A/Resources/fr_CA.lproj -> /Users/andym/Development/Build Products/Release (GC dual-mode
column4: 10.5-only)/Sparkle.framework/Resources/fr.lproj

column3:
1. set german as default language
2. change push branch default value to one of the german values (nichts, passende, einfach, aktuell) 
3. restart SourceTree
4. open repository 
5. erorr

--> the german value is set in the global .gitconfig file and can't be read or translated to a working value anymore
(error message see attached screenshot) --> replace german value with an english value --> SourceTree works again.
column4: Translation Bug - Settings - Push Branches

column3:
When i compile my project i get some of the files changed and source tree is constantly suggesting me to add them to commit. I can't add them to gitignore since they are already being tracked and i can't delete them from repository since without them script won't function.

I tried clicking "Stop Tracking" on context menu of the file, but it tried to remove file from repository, which as i've mentioned not a acceptable in my case.

git has perfect function for that
- git update-index --assume-unchanged <file>
- git update-index --no-assume-unchanged <file>

and that's what really should happen on clicking "Stop Tracking"
Please implement support for assume-unchanged

Without implementing windows with list of ignored files to unignore, it should take 5 minutes to implement
column4: Implement ignoring tracked files with assume-unchanged

column3: Long branch names (90 characters for example) can overflow onto the Cancel and Commit buttons and make them unclickable. It also looks bad.
column4: long branch name bleeds over buttons in the commit window

column3:
My company uses a number of small services, all residing in different git-repos, all of which I have full-screened in different spaces on the mac (5 or so).

Since the name of the repo isn't really anywhere to be seen unless you know what the different branches are, it would be tremendously helpful if the name of the repo could be added at the top of the left menu (above File Status, Branches and Tags etc.).

Terrific product gents, I am working on C# stuff and I have mac installed mainly so I can keep using source tree as a git client.
column4: repo + branch-name when in full-screen

column3:
Most of the screens that show the "hunks" of differences have a button to also view the difference in an external tool, also accessible with command-D on OS X.  I would like that option to be available when viewing the log for a single file.

Currently it has the same interface as the normal view for changes but it is missing the view external diff feature.

Thanks.
column4: Ability to run external diff from log window

column3: I am rising the issue as Major as it is real pain in the arse.\r\nI have also seen many posts by other people about the problem.
column4: Hide Remote Branches option setting is not kept after clicking in different branch just for viewing.

column3:
I am happy with the addition of the 'Open in Finder' button, this is an action I was doing quite often.

However I feel the grouping of grey buttons in the toolbar is strange:

!sourcetree-o.png|thumbnail!

'Open in Finder', 'Git-Flow', 'Open in Terminal'. Two of these open external applications, one opens a dialog in SourceTree.

In the very least the 'Open in ...' buttons should be next to each other and the 'Git-Flow' button on a side. Ideally 'Git-Flow' wouldn't be grouped with these other buttons at all. Here is a mockup of a possible solution:

!sourcetree-edit.png|thumbnail!
This places 'Git-Flow' with other git operations and away from the external application launchers.
column4: Reorder toolbar buttons into logical groups

column3:
Please add support for BeyondCompare file compare and merge tool.

Until recently BeyondCompare was available only for Windows and Linux, but now is also available for Mac.

Here you can find instructions regarding manual configuration for BeyondCompare.

This is a request to add BeyondCompare to the list of recognized diff/merge tool.
column4: Add support for BeyondCompare

column3:
You gave us a great feature - subtrees. But it is critical needs work. As a minimum, the following things that will make this opportunity a truly magnificent:
1) to display the status of the source subtree - whether there are changes in it , that you can PULL to yourself.
2) similarly display local state subtree relative to the source - is there a change that can be PUSHED into the subtree's source
3) an optional possibility to PUSH/PULL the source along with the general PUSH/PULL of the repository
4) AND - remember the password in the keychain for the subtree's source! it is impossible to enter it each time (and I have not one but many subtrees)
column4: Subtrees push/pull

Hi!
When I right-click on the a branch on the "BRANCHES" part of the left panel, I want to be able to copy the branch name.

Thanks,
Claes
column4: Be able to copy a branch name

column3: Vim and Mac Power Users feel frustrated to arrive at Bookmarks with Cmd-B, select a project with arrow keys, and then be unable to open the project. Return renames, space does nothing (no quickview), and arrows, with or without the command key, just keep moving around. Cmd-O opens a new repository. But nothing opens the highlighted repository (short of using the mouse).\r\n\r\nCmd-Down will provide this functionality in a manner analogous to user expectations and will not break any other functionality.
column4: Keyboard shortcut to open project from Bookmarks window (Cmd-Down)

column3: Hi\r\n\r\nThis hotkey is Critical for making fast commits without using a mouse. Please add it.
column4: Provide hotkey for "Add / Remove"

column3: A really nifty feature that bazaar explorer has is the ability to auto complete the filenames in the repo that you have while typing them out in the commit message area.

column3: I have a lot of favourited repos on github and bitbucket, such that my "Hosted Repositories" screen takes way too long to navigate. Usually I'm only interested in my repos, so a simple filter to show only my own accounts would be great.\r\n\r\nSorting by owner isn't great because I'm not at the top, and I have different account names on github vs. bitbucket.
column4: Should have a filter on the Hosted Repositories screen to show only my accounts

column3: There needs to be a way to specify the cookie path that the autologin cookie will use.  This is needed in JIRA Studio in order to be able to have one autologin cookie for two apps on two different paths on the same server (the request's context path is used by default).
column4: Custom autologin cookie path

column3: The autologin cookie currently isn't encrypted, which is rather alarming considering it contains the user name and password.  Instead, it is XOR'ed with character offsets, which is insecure.  The text, if we really need to put a user name and password in there, needs to be encrypted with a real encryption algorithm.
column4: Autologin cookie should be encoded with real encryption

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Install JIRA Agile.
# Create a new project.
# Configure the Permission to have no one holds the "Create Issue" permission. E.g:
!ap.png|thumbnail!
# Go to _Agile > Getting Started_.
# Create a Scrum Board.
# Create from an existing project and choose the recently created project.

*Expected Result:*
* The board created without any problem

*Actual Result:*
* The board is created with an "An Error Occurred" message.
!aperror.PNG|thumbnail!
!full.PNG|thumbnail!

*Notes:*
* Replicated in JIRA 6.4.1 and JIRA Agile 6.6.80.

column3:
Right now, when I grab an issue on an agile board, the columns I am allowed to drag it to have dotted boxes appear. If there is more than one status allowed in a particular column, several dotted boxes with the status names appear in that column. If there is only one allowed status in a column, no name/label appears in the dotted box.

I think the status name should appear in the dotted box, anyway. This makes it extra clear what status the issue would change to. This could resolve issues that might arise where the name of the column is not a good indicator of the allowed status in that column.
column4: Not all columns on an Agile board list the actual states allowed to be dragged into

column3:
Description:
If resolving an issue with 0 remaining time set, the previously contained remaining is still retained in a different variable. This one is shown in e.g. swim lanes.

Reproduce:
1. Create a subtask on a story. Estimate 4h.
2. Put it in progress.
3. Drag it to resolved.
4. Log 1m and set remaining to 0
5. Verify that the remaining is set to 0m in the right (issue details pane).
6. Verify that the remaining time shown in the resolved lane is 3h 59m or 4h.
column4: Resolving a subtask doesn't update remaining time shown in resolved/closed lane

column3:
*Prequesites:*
An agile board where swimlanes are based on assignees.

*Reproduce:*
In work-mode (2) we can assign an issue via the keyboard-shortcut "a" (assign) and via "e" (edit). In the first case, the issue is moved to the appropriate swimlane (of the newly assigned person). In the second case (edit), the issue stays in the current swimlane (previously assigned person).

*Workaround:*
Reload the page.
column4: Issue not moved when assigning via edit

column3:
Hi there,

When we recently uploaded our new Jira licenses (including our Jira Agile and Zephyr Plugins) it has become apparent that we have not migrated our Agile Markers, as per the instructions at:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE063/Sprint+Marker+Migration

This is necessary for Jira v6.3, however we are currently using Kanban Boads and Jira v5.2.

Please could you advise if this is still required,as Ivo at PIX has noted that it has caused some loose ends and sometimes plugins do not expect something like this anymore. Please see attached screenshot, fyi

Many thanks

Kind regards
 Jo

PS This is linked to our call with PIX at: [PIX SUPPORT] (HOST-768) Jira - issue with links
column4: Re: Jira Agile - migration of markers

column3:
Customers (or a representative) raise User Stories in a Customer Project. The implementation for these User Stories are then implemented against the necessary component or components that make up the Customers Product by way of a task that addresses the User Story. Each of these components has it's own project in our Jira instance. 

Currently it is hard to see the tasks that need to be done (Sprint Backlog). A user has to open up the User Story, or use a custom filter.

We would like to see tasks linked by "addresses" appear under the User Story on the Rapid Board, much like tasks do.
column4: As a Scrum Dev Team Member I want to see all tasks that are linked to a User Story by relationship 'addresses' on the Rapid Board so that I can view and progress the tasks needed to be completed across various projects in order to satisfy the User Story.

column3:
After migrating GreenHopper from version 6.1.2 to 6.1.3.1, the backlog issues disappeared of the agile board.

All of the issues with status open and reopened doesn't appeared on agile board.
On agile board, the number of issues are shown in Tools > Configure > Columns

I upgraded the GreenHopper from version 6.1.3.1 to 6.1.3.2 to try solve this problem, but doesn't worked.

I tried solve this problem following resolution sugest in this post (https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GHKB/Empty Backlog Even Though Issue Exist), but also doesn't worked.

Error messages on jira's log:

atlassian-jira.log.1:2013-02-21 17:09:51,249 http-bio-8443-exec-5370 INFO wual 1029x1228560x7 10q0dig 10.18.121.53 /rest/api/2/issue/AMPN-7351/comment [fields.layout.field.AbstractFieldLayoutManager] Field layout contains non-orderable field with id 'customfield_10471'.
...
atlassian-jira.log.2:2013-02-21 14:41:56,728 http-bio-8443-exec-5113 WARN epaj 881x1185157x2 1i2r538 10.18.125.1 /issues/ [jira.issue.managers.DefaultCustomFieldManager] Warning: returning 1 of 2 custom fields named 'Sprint'

........

atlassian-jira.log.1:2013-02-21 17:09:50,886 http-bio-8443-exec-5370 ERROR wual 1029x1228560x7 10q0dig 10.18.121.53 /rest/api/2/issue/AMPN-7351/comment [jira.plugins.common.Utils] Gantt-specific customfield with configured name 'customfield_10471' or default name 'Greenhopper Sprint' does not exist!

customfield_10471 is:

ID: 10471
CustomFieldTypeKey: com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint	CustomFieldSearchKey: com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-sprint-searcher	
CFName:Sprint
Description: Sprint field for GreenHopper use only	
Default Value: (Null)
FieldType:(null)
Project: (null)
IssueType: (null)

Another attempt to solve the problem was uninstall/install the GreenHopper Plugin, but doesn't work.

I've created the test environment to downgraded GreenHopper Plugin to version 6.1.2, but the problem changed and bencame worse, with the message "GreenHopper is currently unavailable. This might be because an upgrade task has failed to run or has not not yet completed." and the agile board doesn't work.

column3:
In my understanding the "{{Unscheduled}}" means the Product Backlog and each created version the Release Backlog. When I drag&drop all specific issues from "{{Unscheduled}}" to "{{Release 1.0}}" version than the appropriate label will be added and the issue will disappear in the planning list. To plan a sprint i move on to the Release Backlog "{{Release 1.0}}". When i drag&drop an issue from the list to a specific sprint the label will be added but the label "{{Release 1.0}}" wont be removed. So, the issue will not disappear in the Release Backlog. 

h4.Version-Setup
# Release 1.0
## 1.0 Sprint 3
## 1.0 Sprint 2
## 1.0 Sprint 1

h4.Scenario
# I am on the "{{Planning Board}}" page with "{{Version}}" and "{{Unscheduled}}" selected
# I drag&drop issue {{ABC-123}} from "{{Unscheduled}}" to "{{Release 1.0}}"
# I change from "{{Unscheduled}}" to "{{Release 1.0}}" to see the Release Backlog
# I drag&drop issue {{ABC-123}} from "{{Release 1.0}}" to "{{1.0 Sprint 1}}"
column4: Release label won't removed when drag&drop issue to a sprint

column3:
As a Greenhopper user, I expect a keyboard shortcut for saving an inline edit to an issue card, so that I can save small edits much more quickly than is possible using the mouse.

NOTE: the only way to save an inline edit to a Greenhopper card is to move the right hand from the keyboard to the mouse, carefully move the cursor over the small tick-mark to the right of the edited field, and click on the small tick icon while avoiding the small "x" icon.

NOTE: The "Alt+s" form submission shortcut does not work, because the in-line edits do not pop up a form (unlike "Edit Issue"), and "Return" just inserts a newline.
column4: Keyboard shortcut to save an inline edit to a card

column3:
QUICK DESCRIPTION:
When GreenHopper is used in JIRA, it should be possible to make an screenshot of the end/start of sprint (iteration or version in JIRA terminology).

LONG DESCRIPTION:
Currently there is no way to know, what was the initial and final state of sprint (if I move some stories/tasks from SPRINT1 -> SPRINT2, this information can not be captured). For example, we have iteration SPRINT1 with stories S1 (tasks T11, T12), S2 (T21, T22), S3 (T13). This is initial view of the sprint. During sprint execution, S2 and S3 are DONE, but in S1 only T11 was resolved). So when iteration SPRINT2 is constructed, S1 is moved from SPRINT1 to SPRINT2 (only T12) and T13 is added. Which information is lost:
- initial state of SPRINT1 (if I look at it S1 will be missing)
- final state of SPRINT1 (I should see, that T11 was done already in SPRINT1)
- where did T13 appear (was already present in SPRINT1 or was it added in SPRINT2

I can construct all this by clicking each individual task but this is manual approach that takes alot of time.
column4: Snapshot of the start/end of sprint

column3:
h3. Issue Summary
When opening a board from a classic project, the name of the board is not being displayed on the tab title.

h3. Environment
Classic projects.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a classic project (Scrum or Kanban);
 # Go to the project's board;

h3. Expected Results
Title on the tab should be "<Board Name> - Jira"
h3. Actual Results
Title on the tab is "Agile Board - JIRA"

 !Screen Shot 2019-06-20 at 14.43.16.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
column4: Browser tab titles no longer display project board name

column3:
h3. Summary

When creating/cloning a board or editing the filter of a board the drop down list for the filters will be empty and the following error message will be displayed
{code:java}"The JIRA server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of this operation."
{code}
h3. Environment

Cloud
h3. Status (11/16 - 18:00 UTC)

A fix for this issue is present in JIRA Cloud v1000.552.3 which will be deployed to all production Cloud instances within the next 24 hours. If you're still experiencing this issue, please open a support case via support.atlassian.com including your Cloud instance URL and an acceptable time window for a brief period of downtime where the upgrade deployment can be manually applied. 
h3. Workaround

No workaround is available at this time.
column4: Filter Selection Error When Creating or Cloning a Board or Configure a Board

h3. Summary

As per [Resolving Service Desk permission error|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/resolving-jira-service-desk-permission-errors-776636380.html] it is mandatory for *Service Desk Customer - Portal Access* group to get assigned Browse Issue, Create Issue and Add Comment permission on each SD projects. This create a security concern since it is not possible limit customer access to specific project. 
h3.  
h3. Expected Results

Provide a more granular group access to allow project specific access instead using one *Service Desk Customer - Portal Access* group

 
h3.
column4: Service Desk does not allow project specific access

column3:
h3. Summary
Everytime an issue is edited (eg. assignee, issue type, etc), the *All* tab of the issue will show that organization has also been changed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit the issue
# Change the assignee
# Look at the *All* tab

h3. Expected Results
# *All* tab shows only assignee has been updated

h3. Actual Results
* *All* tab shows assignee and organization has been updated
!organization.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
You can also
# Edit the issue
# Don't change anything
# Click _Update_
# Check the *All* tab to see organization being updated

h3.Workaround
Remove the _Organization_ field from the Edit screen
* This will mean that all agents won't be able to edit organizations at all
column4: "All" tab shows Organizations is updated every time an issue is updated

column3:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4897].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

!test.png|thumbnail!

A customer saw queues taking up to 20s to load (with 35 queues in a single projects). This was because the count issues method uses jql search using {{LuceneSearchProvider}} in JIRA core to count issues for any queue. Issues for all queues are counted at page load, queue update, add issue and the polling on the queues page, to show the issue count lozenge on the left hand panel.
h3. Suggested Solution
 # store the project specific setting using the {{GlobalPropertyDao}}
 # currently issue count is done by JQL search in JIRA core
 # QueueServiceImpl accepts a bool to shouldCount for queues
 # CustomQueuesItemProvider:getqueues provides a true value for shouldCount
 # QueueAssemblerImpl:getQueues provides a shouldCount value that is passed through API call and that is false by default.

h3. New experimental settings
As of 3.4.2 there will be a new experimental admin REST api available to set whether the queue count should be included on the Queues page.

A global setting that can be set by JIRA admin is available:
{code}
PUT <contextpath>/rest/servicedeskapi/admin/queues/include-count - true/false body - 200 response (default true)
{code}

There is also a project level setting that can be set by either a JIRA or Project Admin.
{code}
PUT <contextpath>/rest/servicedeskapi/admin/queues/<projectkey>/include-count - true/false body - 200 response (default true)
{code}

NB: If the global setting is off, then queue count will not be enabled for any project, as it will take precedence.

(!) This is an experimental api and therefore as it may be moved, or replaced in the future, until it becomes public, will require opt-in with the [Experimental-API|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-servicedesk/REST/cloud/#special-headers] header


h3. Workaround
 # Reduce the amount of queues per project
 # Simplify the JQL search in each queues (avoid using SLA check when possible)
column4: Loading issue count is slow when there are many queues in single project

column3:
h3. Summary

If a Confluence space is linked as knowledge base to JIRA Service Desk, when the agents open the tickets in JSD queue, it through below error in the issue view screen under *Related knowledge base articles* section.
{quote}
We're having trouble communicating with the application. Wait a minute, then try again.
{quote} 
h3. Customer Impact
Agents are not able to check the related knowledge base article to the tickets raised through JSD portal and in JSD project directly.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Raise a ticket in one of the Jira Service Desk Projects which has knowledge base linked to one of their Confluence spaces.
# Create a ticket in the service desk project either through customer portal or directly in the JSD project.
# Open the ticket as the agent from JSD queue or full view mode.

h3. Expected Results
JSD should pull all the *Related knowledge base articles* from the linked Confluence knowledge base.

h3. Actual Results
JSD is failing to connect to Confluence space and pull the articles.
{noformat}
We're having trouble communicating with the application. Wait a minute, then try again.
{noformat}

h3. Additional info
Customer can search articles in the customer portal, but they can't access them. Clicking on a search result will just send back to the "Knowledge Base Home".

h3. Workaround

No workaround at the moment.
column4: Issues Accessing to KB article through the Service Desk

column3:
h3. Summary
When trying to raise a new request, the page is showing blank.

h3. Customer Impact
No one can raise new request from customer portals

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Set the profile language to non-English like Chinese, Russian, Japanese, etc
# Go to customer portal
# Click on any project
# Click on any request type

h3. Expected Result
A form with list of fields is showing so users can fill in the form to raise the request.
!screenshot1.jpg|thumbnail!

h3. Actual results
A blank page is showing

h3. Notes
* The pages are working when using English as the profile language.
* This also happens when trying to view the request when using non-English as the profile language.

On Browser Console:
!screenshot2.jpg|thumbnail!
{code}
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property '_attach' of undefined
    at _applyInlineAttachPresenter (cv.request.create.chunk.2ce998181e90d9714e09.js:1)
    at HTMLInputElement.<anonymous> (cv.request.create.chunk.2ce998181e90d9714e09.js:1)
    at Function.each (batch.js?locale=en-US&sd_operational=true:sourcemap:23)
    at init.each (batch.js?locale=en-US&sd_operational=true:sourcemap:16)
    at Object.inlineAttach (cv.request.create.chunk.2ce998181e90d9714e09.js:1)
    at d.onRender (cv.request.create.chunk.2ce998181e90d9714e09.js:1)
    at d.c.triggerMethod (batch.js?locale=en-US&sd_operational=true:sourcemap:3442)
    at d.render (batch.js?locale=en-US&sd_operational=true:sourcemap:3458)
    at servicedesk-customerportal.bundle.a96991316c73a630d71c.js:1
    at Function.m.each.m.forEach (servicedesk-customerportal.bundle.a96991316c73a630d71c.js:1)
{code}


h3. Workaround
Support Team confirmed non-English users (such as Chinese and Japanese) are affected.
If you are still affected, go to Profile page and change your language setting to "English" (UK or US).
https://__EXAMPLE__.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/user/profile

column3:
Today everybody can see time estimates made on an issue. It would be nice if it was possible (for example via the permission scheme) to determine who should be able see them.

An idea to the level of permissions could be:
 - Edit others time estimates
 - Add/Edit own time estimates
 - View time estimates

 # The agency wants to be able to control who can see any time estimation and tracking information, such as customers (likely not), internal project management (rather yes) etc.
 # In some circumstances, this information is sensitive and needs to be handled accordingly.
column4: Hide Time Tracking estimates from certain users (e.g. customers)

column3:
JQL does not appear to short-circuit evaluation which causes more issues to be considered than necessary. We recently noticed how impactful this is using "was" because it queries the database and not the index. Consider:

project = ABC AND status was Resolved

In our observation this seems to evaluate to all resolved issues in the entire instance, not just those in project ABC. JQL would evaluate much faster if it took the result of each clause and reduced the scope of issues that the next clause was evaluated against.
column4: Short-circuit JQL evaluation

column3:
h5. Feature Summary

When a user access the customer portal, they should see a set of request types they can select from.

If the user decides to search for a request type, JIRA Service Desk does not show any hint that the result below is the result for issue types that match the string the customer typed in or even how it performs the search.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h5. Feature Request

Can the UI be updated to show customers that the result shown under the search bar are a result of issue types which contain the string searched in either the request type name or the request type description field?
column4: Improvement to Issue Type Search in Customer Portal

column3:
h5. Issue Summary

A number of Language Packs like Polish, Dutch, Italian, Danish, Swedish, Norwegian, Finnish, Czech, Estonian, Hungarian, Slovak, Romanian, Icelandic from https://translations.atlassian.com/ are unavailable for download, showing the message:
{code}This language pack is now bundled with Atlassian products, so is no longer available to download here.To get this language pack, upgrade to the latest version of your product.{code}
See image [^downloaddisabled.png]

h5. Expected behavior
After installing the JIRA 7.4 Core, JIRA 7.4 Software or JIRA 3.6 (all latest versions), these languages are part of the bundle or are available for download from the Atlassian Marketplace.

h5. Actual behavior
After installing the JIRA 7.4 Core, JIRA 7.4 Software or JIRA 3.6 (all latest versions), these languages are not bundled, and are not available for download from the Atlassian Marketplace (see images [^jirasdbundledlanguages.png], [^jiracore740.png], [^jira74languages.png])

h5. Affected Versions
* JIRA 7.4 Core
* JIRA 7.4 Software
* JIRA SD 3.6.0

h5. Notes
* If you look in the Atlassian  Marketplace , you only get 2 language packs, Polish which is an old and unsupported version, and Arabic, which is an already existent third-party add-on (see [^sd36marketplace.png]).
column4: Language Packs not bundled in JIRA Applications

column3:
h5. Issue Summary

If a user enters a marked up text in the comment/description fields while the field is set to the *Visual* mode, JIRA should not mark up the text when it is submitted but rather treat it as a normal text.

For example, 
# If the user enters an image markup like 
{code}!something.png!{code}
JIRA should not mark this up as an image.
# If a user enters the any of the [Wiki Renderer|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/WikiRendererHelpAction.jspa?section=all] formatted text such as, enclosing a word with asterisks (*):
{code}
*this is a test*
{code}

h5. Expected Result

JIRA would show the exact text entered by the user (These examples are character escaped via Text mode):
# \!something.png\!
# \*this is a test\*

h5. Actual Result

# JIRA would attempt to markup the text and then show  an error:
{code}
Unable to render embedded object: File (something.png) not found.
{code}
# The second example:
*this is a test*

h5. Feature Request

*While in Visual mode*, _JIRA should be able to escape characters that are related to text which match the marked up parameters *automatically*_ or attempt to load the image and show the error below if the image is not present:
{code}
Unable to render embedded object: File (something.png) not found.
{code}

(i) When you use the Attach file button in the editor, the image is automatically loaded (it does not show the marked up text though)
column4: Prevent JIRA from Parsing Text in Visual Mode
User not created if present as comment author only

We should inform the user that the configuration is wrong, in the same way we do for multiple columns with same header:
- if the field can receive multiple values, say nothing (and do as expected)
- if the field cannot receive multiple values, like Summary, display a warning and add fail messages if proceed (fail because we get data loss - user thinks he imported data from column X but it was discarded)

column3: We created a group called "jira-suppliers" to assign the users who are subcontractors.\r\nBut they do not receive any email, the only users who receive are the ones who are in the jira-users group.

column3:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45840].
{panel}
*Original description:*

When creating a Project using the {{Create with shared configuration}} button on the Create Project screen, it could give the user the impression that the projects would have an ongoing connection of some kind, such as with JRA-7020.

However, the feature currently just "clones" the existing configuration. Because of this, it would be nice if the wording changed.

The button could change from {{Create with shared configuration}} to {{Clone Existing Project Configuration}} (similar to cloning plans/deployments in Bamboo).

In addition, the title of the next screen "Create with shared configuration" would read "Clone with existing project configuration".

In addition, the description of the next screen "Select the existing project that you'd like to share configurations with." would read "Select the existing project that you'd like to clone the configuration of."

In addition, the warning message "When a configuration is shared with several projects, it means that any changes made to the configuration will affect all the projects." on the next page could say "While project configuration schemes are shared between projects, it means that any changes made to the configuration will affect all the projects."

If this feature ever becomes similar to JRA-7020, this could be rolled back.

 

*Update*

Since the word "Clone" implies doing something that the functionality does not really provide, the suggestion to call it "Shared Schemes" or "Use existing Schemes" instead of "Shared configuration" makes it much clear to understand what exactly will be done.
column4: Change wording of "Shared Configuration" feature
Difficulty in getting the correct quote

column3:
After moving a parent issue of a subtask, user is unable to search the old issue key of these moved subtasks. When trying to search the old issue key, an error message will appear "

{quote}
The issue you are trying to view does not exist.
If you think this message is wrong, please contact your JIRA administrators.
Return to Search
{quote}

!subtask.png|thumbnail!

New issue key can be search. 

Resolution 
This issue does not occur in newer JIRA versions. [Upgrade JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Upgrading+JIRA] to 6.2 or later to resolve this.
[Cannot search old issue key of subtask when parent issue is moved to another project|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Cannot+search+old+issue+key+of+subtask+when+parent+issue+is+moved+to+another+project]
column4: Cannot search old issue key of subtask when parent issue is moved

column3:
h2. Steps to replicate:

Open JIRA in IE 11. Have to have at least 11 JIRA projects, so that there is a scrollbar in the Project dropdown. 
- Click on "Create" button on the top;
- Click on a right expansion arrow to open a dropdown Project listbox;
- BUG: Clicking on "UP" or "DOWN" arrows just collapses the dropdown box.
- BUG: An attempt to drag the scroll bar collapses the dropdown box.

h2. Workaround:
When using the mouse's scroll wheel, it works.
column4: Project dropdown when creating issue not working using IE 11

column3: Adding "Current Assignee" to the Browse permission for a project lets any user of the system see that project (they can't necessarily view issues or create issues, but they can see the project).

column3:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34473].
  {panel}

It appears that Axis does not provide any SOAP endpoints when JIRA is run behind https.  When one requests /rpc/soap, eg:

https://support.atlassian.com/rpc/soap/exec sp_prepexec @P1 output, N'@P1 bigint,@P2 bigint,@P3 nvarchar(4000),@P4 nvarchar(4000),@P5 nvarchar(4000),@P6 nvarchar(4000),@P7 datetime,@P8 decimal(38,0)', N'INSERT INTO jiraaction (ID, issueid, AUTHOR, actiontype, actionlevel, actionbody, CREATED, actionnum) VALUES (@P1 , @P2 , @P3 , @P4 , @P5 , @P6 , @P7 , @P8 )', 12823, 10549, N'neala', N'comment', NULL, N'The main problem is that ''smart'' quotes are really "dumb" because only MS Word knows about them.', 'Dec 31 2005 1:53:17:257PM', NULL



One gets back:

"""
And now... Some Services

    * null (wsdl)
"""

instead of the usual:

"""
And now... Some Services

    * null (wsdl)
          o getUser
          o createUser
          o getComponents
          o createGroup
          o getGroup
          o login
          o getServerInfo
          o updateGroup
"""

The WSDL is correspondingly empty.
column4: SOAP does not work over HTTPS / SSL on certain configurations

column3:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31581].
  {panel}

We have several customers that collect "common hours" such as vacations and meetings on the same issue for all employees. This means that the history of these issues grows very big (thousands of changes).

We have noticed that adding hours to these issues takes a good deal longer than adding hours to "new" issues (5-10 seconds, sometimes longer). We have tried both the standard "Log work" function and Tempo with the same results.

Experimenting a bit also shows that it looks like the "dispatchEvent" parameter to the "createWorklog" function is the key. Setting the "dispatchEvent" to false makes everything OK. This means that somebody that is listening to the ISSUE_WORKLOGGED_ID event is taking a long time processing.

Note that we disabled all plugins except the Atlassian plugins (see attached screenshot) which means that it's either JIRA itself or some of the listed Atlassian plugins that is the culprit.

Best regards,

Bjarni (Tempo plugin)

h5. Workaround

As a temporary workaround, the JIRA WebHooks Plugin can be disabled through the UPM.
column4: Adding worklogs to issues with large histories is very slow

Andre Petry
Atlassian Support

column3:
I created a mail handler of the type "Add a comment before a specified marker or separator in the email body" and I set a splitregex and saved it, but the splitregex parameter doesn't get saved to the properties table (the propertystring table)

The other properties do save, and if I click 'Edit' on the newly created mail handler, its 'Split Regex' field is blank.  

To debug this, I went into the database and added splitregex=/_____+/ to my handler params, then restarted JIRA and sent a test email and verified that it works as expected (so I don't think anything is wrong with the RegexCommentHandler class itself, just something not saving properly with the properties edit panel so the splitregex field isn't making it into the properties.
column4: RegexCommentHandler not saving splitregex property in JIRA 5.0

a) please make this configurable (Layouting manager)
OR
b) just pick a color like #f0f0f0

column3:
Removing the entire clone-prefix is NOT possible.

{noformat}
Clone prefix = 'CLONE -'   results in 'CLONE - summary'
Clone prefix = 'CLONE - '  results in 'CLONE  - summary'
Clone prefix = 'x'         results in 'x summary
Clone prefix = ''          results in ' summary'
{noformat}

(x) There is *always* a space added, even when I do not want some.

Please correct this.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25210].
  {panel}

In the initial JIRA start we don't allow users to point to a db with existing data when configuring connection.
Currently we show an error, we need to modify the error message and add a link to upgrade documentation. Something like  "The database specified is not empty. Please specify an empty database for your JIRA installation. If you want to upgrade the existing installation please follow this instructions." where 'this instructions' is a link to a documentation page.

h3. Workaround

# Stop JIRA.
# Manually alter the {{$JIRA_HOME/dbconfig.xml}} or use the [JIRA Configuration Tool|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Using+the+JIRA+Configuration+Tool] to point to the database.
(!) Please ensure to follow the appropriate documentation for [Connecting JIRA to a Database|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+a+Database].
# Start JIRA.
column4: Point users to upgrade documentation if they try to connect to db with existing jira data.

column3:
If you hide "Affects Version/s" in a Field Configuration, it disappears on the View Issue screen, but leaves an ugly gap.

This seems to be a CSS issue.  The {{#issuedetails}} element is (somewhat mysteriously in my opinion) a UL instead of a table, and the fields are placed on either side with floats.  However, the exact configuration in my screenshot causes too many right-side fields to physically appear in the HTML before *Component/s*, so the floating isn't enough to make everything "collapse" properly.

Bummer.
column4: Hiding "Affects Version/s" in Field Configuration causes an ugly gap in the View Issue screen.

column3:
In earlier versions of jira, Subtask / parents are displayed with the !http://jira.atlassian.com/images/icons/link_out_bot.gif! symbol in the filter result.
In newer Jira versions (seen in Jira 4.3) a / image is used. As you can see in the Screenshot attached, the Slash will move behind the Issue-Key of the parent issue if the table cell of the summary is too short to display the "PARENT issue key followed by 10px padding (where the background / image will be rendered in) followed by the link to the (sub) issue.
The padding wil not be rendered as defined in issue-table.css.

This might be fixed with a "display: inline-block;" for this element to prevent inline element being "stripped".
column4: Display of Subtask/sub-issues with long words in the beginning will result in wrong filter result

column3:
The documentation at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA040/Advanced+Searching?clicked=jirahelp is incorrect with respect to queries involving DATE fields. It says the following:
{quote}
Find issues that were resolved in January 2009:
resolved > "2008/12/31" and resolved < "2009/02/01"
Find issues that were resolved on 15 January 2009:
resolved > "2009/01/14" and resolved < "2009/01/16"
{quote}
However, the first query will return bugs resolved on "2008/12/31," which is not in January. The second query will return bugs resolved on January 15 *and* January 14.

It seems that {quote}resolved > "2008/12/31"{quote} means "after midnight 31 December 2008." That is, there is an implicit time component of midnight in all DATE fields when none is explicitly specified.  This should be reflected in your documentation. I would also include examples that include a time component.

Thanks.
column4: JQL documentation has errors about how dates are handled

column3: The FileService is now limited to only look at files inside the JIRA_HOME/import/mail directory.\r\nTo be able to distinguish between files related to different projects / issuetypes etc. we need the ability to be able to specify a sub-directory and a handler will only process the files inside this sub-directory. Currently all FileService(s) and handler(s) will look at the same dir and have to work themself which files they have to process.\r\n
column4: FileService doesn't allow to specify a sub-directory inside the import/mail directory

column3:
When building plugin to extend jira 4.2.2 menu I used the code below to add thumbnail (icon) in front of a menu chice a strange effect appeared. Check the attachment.


.........

<web-resource key="image_icon" name="My Plugin Downloadable Resources">
<resource type="download" name="images/" location="images/"/>
</web-resource>
...............

<web-item ..................>
.............
   <icon width="16" height="16">
   <link linkId="test_link" >/download/resources/${jira.apps.gadgets}.${jira-apps-gadgets}:image_icon/images/16_16px.gif</link>
   </icon>
.............
</web-item>

The icon showed multiple times as a background for the menu choice that was added. The CSS was not correct.
Actually I did fixed this but not sure I did it the right way. Here is what I did:

I replaced this line

#jira .aui-dd-parent .standard.aui-dropdown li a {color:#333;text-decoration:none; background-color:#fff;}

with this line

#jira .aui-dd-parent .standard.aui-dropdown li a {color:#333;text-decoration:none; background-color:#fff;background-repeat:no-repeat;background-position:5px 5px;padding-left:25px;}

in this two files 

styles\js\widget\dropdown\dropdown.css
styles\js\widget\dropdown\dropdown-min.css

and now is working ok. Thank you

PLEASE GO TO EDIT ISSUE MODE TO SEE ALL I ENTERED!

h2. Workarounds

If upgrading from *pre 4.0 to 4.2 or higher*:
You will need to find all the search requests that have something like the following in the reqcontent column (or request element in the xml backup)
{noformat}
<request><![CDATA[<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?>
<searchrequest name='filter-name'/>]]></request>
    </SearchRequest>
{noformat}
You can either delete this filter (through JIRA) or modify the contents to contain an order clause.  Create a new filter and just compy the contents to these Search requests)

*Or*
You could also upgrade to 4.0 or 4.1 then perform the fix below and then upgrade to 4.2.

Upgrading from *post 4.0 to 4.2 or higher*:
The work around is to find the offending SearchRequest and replace the contents with "ORDER BY key DESC".
One of the following SQL should identify the troublesome SearchRequests:
{code:sql}
select id from searchrequest where reqcontent is null;
select id from searchrequest where reqcintent = '';
{code}
column4: Upgrade Task for Labels can fail a Not Null assertion for SearchRequests with an empty search in Oracle

column3:
The issue service isn't doing anything use with regards to required fields when you do validateTransition.

If the field isn't present it copies the existing value from the issue.

Even if we fix that, it will be broken at least for resolutions because it ends up calling orderableField.validateParams which checks isRequired() except according to JRA-16112 the resolution can't be marked isRequired (except for on resolution when it magically is required).

This whole thing needs to be sorted out and clearly we'll need a bit of testing to hopefully ensure we get all the cases :(
column4: transitions with required fields don't work properly

column3:
If the description of a project is empty when using the Projects gadget on the dashboard you will receive an internal server error - IF you set the View to Detailed.  The Collapsed and Brief views do not have this issue.

The problem is at: com.atlassian.jira.gadgets.system.ProjectGadgetResource.getProjectDataNoPermissionCheck(ProjectGadgetResource.java:386)

if ((showStats) && (project.getDescription().trim().length() != 0)) {
      projectDescription = project.getDescription()
column4: \r\n      showDescription = true
column5:
}

The getDescription() method should be checked for null before calling the .trim() method.
column6: Projects gadged on dashboard causes "Internal Server Error" with empty project description

column3:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-22214].
  {panel}

This is a clone of JRA-18493 which was resolved as fixed. 

During an upgrade from Jira 3.13 to Jira 4.1.2 two re-indexes occur, one for Build 440 and one for Build 518.   
Please reduce this to one if at all possible.

On a system with many issues, like 200000, this double re-indexing consumes 2 hours of site down time instead of 1 hour. 
In our upgrade from Jira 3.13 to 4.1.2, we need to manually re-index a third time as we have dropped and then re-added a custom calculated field that changed due to changes in the Jira API.
column4: CLONE - Remove any re-index from the JIRA 4.1 upgrade tasks that's not needed

description:
the field RemoteConfiguration.timeTrackingHoursPerDay within the soap wsdl is of type 'int' but it is possible to enter double values like '7.5' within Global Settings/Time Tracking/Hours per day. This will lead to a NumberFormatException

to reproduce:
1. Go to Global Settings/Time Tracking and enable it
2. Change the 'Hours per day' value to '7.5' (decimal is important!)
3. click Activate
4. build a soap client and request JiraSoapService.getServerInfo(<token>)

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-22177].
  {panel}

When building project key patterns, custom patterns should be wrapped in parentheses.

See class DefaultKeyMatcher constructor.

See support issue https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-63357

In essence, subtle pattern match problems can arise, if the JIRA administrator provides a pattern which has alternates.

Assume for the moment that the administrator provides this simple key pattern: 

   ALPHA|BETA

Then, the project key regular pattern will be constructed as

   /^ALPHA|BETA$/

Which will match any of the following

   ALPHA
   ALPHA-DOG
   BETA
   5BETA
   %^&^&**()BETA

Does this make sense?

The proper pattern should be:

   /^(ALPHA|BETA)$/

Since I'm unfamiliar with the Perl5Util classes, I can only ask why the need to enclose the entire pattern in stroke characters.  From my knowledge of Perl, the stroke characters are part of the syntax used to indicate that there is a pattern, and they are not maintained as part of the pattern.
column4: Add Guarding Parentheses in DefaultKeyMatcher class
