column3:
In my case, the WEB-INF/classes/log4j.properties included has these loggers turned off, but they still seem to run.  I am including a patch that ignores the NullPointerException following the pattern of ignoring the ClassNotFoundException.


Details below taken from:  http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GHKB/NullPointerException+when+Switching+between+Projects+or+Boards

Symptoms
When switching between projects or boards using the "Agile" menu, an error like the following appears onscreen and in the logs:
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.xsrf.XsrfVulnerabilityDetectionSQLInterceptor$CallStack.isProtectedAction(XsrfVulnerabilityDetectionSQLInterceptor.java:161)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.xsrf.XsrfVulnerabilityDetectionSQLInterceptor.afterExecutionImpl(XsrfVulnerabilityDetectionSQLInterceptor.java:75)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.xsrf.XsrfVulnerabilityDetectionSQLInterceptor.afterSuccessfulExecution(XsrfVulnerabilityDetectionSQLInterceptor.java:40)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.ChainedSQLInterceptor.afterSuccessfulExecution(ChainedSQLInterceptor.java:70)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.SQLProcessor.afterExecution(SQLProcessor.java:552)



Cause
There is a known problem with JIRA and a particular logger that manifests itself when logging for the XsrfVulnerabilityDetectionSQLInterceptor is enabled. This problem manifests itself when switching from project to project or board to board using the "Agile" menu.

Resolution
By default, the logger that causes this problem is disabled. If you're experiencing this problem, please check your log4j.properties file and any additional log configuration files. Your log4j.properties file should contain lines like the following:

log4j.logger.com.atlassian.jira.security.xsrf.XsrfVulnerabilityDetectionSQLInterceptor = OFF
, xsrflog
log4j.additivity.com.atlassian.jira.security.xsrf.XsrfVulnerabilityDetectionSQLInterceptor =
 false
column4: NullPointerException when Switching between Projects or Boards

  {panel}

The word "Translate," in this case, means translate the statuses from one language to another, but that's unclear from the context, and especially unclear to first-time users, who are still trying to figure out what statuses and steps are. Furthermore, I would guess that this feature isn't used by very many users. These point toward clarifying the wording on this link.

We could do two things, I think:
1) Change "Translate statuses" to "Translate statuses to a different language"
2) Move the link to a less prominent part of the UI, and perhaps attach some country flags to the link so people understand it's referring to languages.
column4: Move "Translate statuses" to less prominent area of the user interface

column3:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-21696].
  {panel}

When a user has no issues and no projects in JIRA, they are probably a new user who is unsure about how to use the product, especially for users who are evaluating the product. The "No issues found" screen is fairly important and a chance for us to explain JIRA's functionality in more detail. Currently these screens are fairly empty. I've attached screenshots of some of the important screens.

This could be a very simple fix. For example, the screen that says 

"You have no favourite filters at the moment" 

could be rewritten to say 

"You have no favourite filters. [Learn more about filters|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Saving+Searches+('Issue+Filters')] or [create a new filter]." 

We provide the user with an opportunity to learn more about the product and use the product in a beneficial way, and introduce him/her to the documentation. Furthermore, the cost to existing users is extremely low, as the screens disappear as soon as they begin creating projects.
column4: Improve text on blank screens - "No issues found," "No projects found," etc.

column3: The Quartz scheduler implementation used by JIRA fails when removing a job from the schedule.  This is a problem in the API and has no known effects in JIRA prior to Version 4.3.  \r\n\r\nThe offending code is in the com.atlassian.scheduler package. http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SCHEDULER-5

column3:
Hello,
Today, if I configure a [Notification Scheme|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+a+Notification+Scheme] to notify the Reporter and the Project Lead when an issue is created, JIRA will send two e-mails: one with the Reporter as the recipient, and other with the Project Lead as the recipient.
Moreover, if I configure a Notification Scheme to notify a group, contained by individual users, JIRA will send 'N' e-mails, one to each group member.

It would be great if it were possible to configure JIRA to send a single e-mail, with 'N' users as recipients, and to show all the recipients in the To: list.

Please let me know if you need further explanation.

Thanks,
________________________
Felipe Kraemer
Atlassian Support
column4: Single E-mail to Multiple Users on Notification Schemes

column3:
Hello, 

 We have recently upgraded from 4.0.1 to 4.1.1. However, We surprisingly came accross that the issue screen has been changed irreversibly. As we have searched in the forums, There is no backward compatibility. Since we are using Jira enterprise-wide, major changes affect employees. Upon this, we needed to downgrade. We have run this version for about 1 to 2 hours. There have been work of employees on the new version of jira. Even though we had backups of the old version, we did not want to lose the activities since the upgrade. However, it is not possible to downgrade with the database (data) of jira 4.1.1 to Jira 4.0.1. Because there is a version check. I have checked whether there is a major database structure change, fortunately, not. I edited the propertystring table to make db and application compitable with eachother. I eventually managed to run old version of jira with new version of db (without losing the works of employees).

I want to inform Atlassian that these kind of changes should not be made instantly. Now, we are in desicion not to use 4.1.1 for such a long time since the cost of coping with complaints is much more than compared to using old version. We try to look at major changes between versions, but we usually get lost on the documentation pages. We want to get informed kindly if there is any chance to use "old version" of issue screen with new version of jira 4.1.1. One further suggession, you should use warning mechanism, in previous versions, which informs customers that there will be changes in some of features in next releases. For example, you should be warning about the issue screen change starting from version 4.0. Again, you may offer that "Please use a test environment, install new version there, use it, like it, then upgrade". However, as I mentioned above by saying "irreversibly" , at least you should leave, as one of the forum commenters said, a legacy theme and let the customer decide whether to use new theme or not.
column4: Jira 4.1.1 issue screen change

column3:
We have the following requirement:
We have a custom field named "Customer". It is not required to fill out that field.

Now if this field is filled out and someone is changing the issue field "version" to another version or is changing the remaining estimation to another value then JIRA should notify the user that there was a change.

This is important because we have internal and external requirements. If it is a external requirement of a customer and we are changing the estimation (it means: we need more time or we are faster) or if we switch the requirement to a later or earlier version then the worker at the ticket should be notified if the field "customer" is filled out. The reason is that the worker can sent the customer a quick feedback that something on his requirement has changed in estimation or version.
column4: Get user notified if changes on issue field is made

When dropdowns breakout, they are inserted into the parent dom.
When two of the same gdaget are on the same page, and you open up the same dropdown on each, a div with same id is inserted into the parent.

When the dropdown closes, it should be removed from the parent frame.

column3:
There should be a way to set up screen schemes based by users/groups. That way it would be easy to let users (i.e. customers) report bugs by filling out only summary and (optionally) description, while project lead/technician can fill in the blanks, i.e. estimated time, assignee and any other fields the customer shouldn't be touching.

It would also allow for certain fields to be easily hidden for certain users (again: customers), such as assignee (to prevent them from contacting the assignee directly), time estimates etc.

Like when I reported this, I said that one developer should do it in one day. Those fields should probably be hidden for users like me. ;-)
column4: Screen Schemes by user/group

column3:
The getNamifiedQuery() method in the JQL Upgrade Task should be more paranoid about exceptions generated by the code (specifically the generation of the SearchContext).

If any Exceptions are encountered, simply return the pre-namified Query. After all, namifying is a nicety!

(This came up due to an issue when upgrading QA-SAC data, but the environment was not entirely complete/defined.)
column4: Make JQL Upgrade Task namifying more exception paranoid

column3:
JIRA exposes a dialog web resource:
<web-resource key="dialog" i18n-name-key="admin.web.resources.plugin.atlassian-dialog.name"
                  name="dialog" state='enabled'>

This clashes with the dialog.css provided by AUI, which is a bundled plugin of JIRA and can cause issues like: JRA-18841.

I suggest to remove the dialog webresource to avoid problems like JRA-18841. We probably should check if we still use somewhere the old dialog web resource.

column3:
We have a problem that we have dropdowns in iframes, different versions & other controls that all need to be hidden when clicking on the document. This does not happen in all cases for the following reasons.

- If you have a dropdown open then click a trigger to open another control, that event stops the propogation of the event. This means that the document never receives the "click" event and the active control is not hidden.  We have 3 *layer* controls in JIRA. They need to talk to each other.

- Iframes have a document element of their own. Clicking on the parent document or vice versa will not hide them.
column4: Add layer manager to ensure dropdowns & other controls are hidden when clicking away in all cases.

Steps:.
1. Login to JIRA.
2. Suppose user has a saved query like project =x and affectedversion =7.
3. User select the filter from manage filter and click edit, the query get open in simple navigator as that was the last selected choice.
4. User select project = y and click "View". User has ignored the "blue refresh" link unknowingly.

Result:
1. The user is now in advanced view with the query and 0 matching result.
2. If he/she tries to go to simple view, gets message query is too complex to display in simple view as there is no affectedversion =7 for project =y.
 

Expected:
1.Taken to advanced view on clicking view is confusing to user, we should handle it in simple view itself and give error message.
2. User is expecting some result when he/she clicks on view and not sifting of dialog.

  {panel}

    *  The list is very long, its hard to find the columns you are after (it took me a while just to find the issue key column), perhaps you could add a few key ones at the top of the list as well (e.g Key and Name).
    * There is no horizontal ordering available, it only does it alphabetically, so there is no way to achieve "the default plus one extra column". This could be helped by just ensuring that if they select the issue key, it will get put on the leftmost column no matter what.
    * Gadget width was an interesting hurdle. I added a bunch of columns and they just got hidden off the side in such a way that i didn't even realise that there was more to see. Maybe a scroll bar or something to provide a visual indication that there is more data off to the side.
    * Is there somewhere where you can change your personal gadget defaults - set columns, horizontal ordering and sorting?? Something like this would be cool, it would mean I didn't have to pick all the columns every time I created a gadget (and would overcome most of my previous points).

https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/QA/Brydie%27s+Findings

column3:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-17463].
  {panel}

(See linked issues for failing use cases.)

All of our indexing goes through the EnglishAnalyzer which passes the stream through several filters: lowercase, stop word removal, apostrophe removal, tokenizing on underscore and dash, and stemming. This works pretty well when you do a natural language kind of query but has numerous cases where it fails to return results that user experiences. What we need is some kind of secondary "exact text" index and use that to boost results.

One way would be to create a new "exact query" field in the SummaryIndexer, EnvironmentIndexer, and DescriptionIndexer and a PerFieldAnalyzerWrapper to use a "dumber" Analyzer that uses the WhitespaceTokenizer instead of the StandardTokenizer. Then we'd need to fix querying to understand that this new field exists. We could either overload the tilda operator and make it smart enough to search across both fields and combine the results in a smart way. Or we could make the equals operator handle text (right now it throws an exception). We'd also want some kind of UI configuration to enable/disable this since it changes behaviour and not everyone is going to want the new behaviour. This would likely break the existing unit tests and func tests for indexing and JQL so we'd need to fix those. We'd probably want to writer new Analyzers for German, French, and Spanish as well instead of just limiting this new behaviour to our English users. Possibly Chinese/Japanese/Korean as well. We'd want better func test coverage on searching in non-English languages to try to make sure this change doesn't have adverse effects for non-English users.

We'd also need to figure out how to handle text custom fields in all of this.

Another approach would be something more along the lines of the SynonymAnalyzer described in "Lucene in Action": have a single Analyzer emit multiple tokens with the same virtual position. Under the covers the Analyzer would multiplex TokenStreams from a "normal" Analyzer and a "dumb" Analyzer. I'm not sure if sharing the Reader between Tokenizers like that works, if not we'd might have to make changes to Lucene core. Having both kinds of tokens in the same index field seems like it OUGHT to end up giving better results for these "exact searches". But it might have adverse effects on normal search ordering. This approach would probably have less impact on JQL but has a higher risk of us running into shortcomings in Lucene APIs.
column4: Better exact-text searching

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-16683].
  {panel}

So I've got a long list of components and issue types, e.g:

* New feature
* Improvement
* Task
* New Employee Setup
* Specification
* Customer Initiative
* Blah
* Blum
* Boo

In https://jira.bepress.com/secure/project/DeleteComponent!default.jspa?cid=XXXX ,
If these issue types or components are in use, Jira makes me reassign them before deleting them.

Instead I'd like to deprecate them, so they can't be assigned to new tickets, but history is not changed.

My goal is to reduce clutter, when issue types are no longer relevant for _new_ tickets.


The same comment applies to several areas in the administrative GUI.  I want to "ghost out" old stuff, without changing history.
column4: Ability to archive (deprecate) issue types (Issue Type Scheme)
Transfer worklog

column3:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-16558].
  {panel}

Hi, I use jira to manage issues or questions towards several companies (splitted into different sequrity levels). For each company there is several jira-users. som user are "tecnical experts" other works with the business or are more "functional experts".

I see it as a nice feature to be able to add a custom short description of every user when they are created and edited.
in the permission schema it should be possible to set who has access to read/add/change this description.

When holding the mouse over a username, a lable could then pop up over the mouse containing the description (using the title attribute in HTML).

In my case, this would resulted in better controll of all the users I am contacting every day in Jira. Somtimes I will report to tecnincal resources in a company, other times to funtional workers.

By the way, thanks for an excelent product :)
column4: Add a short description of a Jira user.

column3:
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch JIRA 4.0(using bamboo build 137 Trunk)
2. Create a project having a custom permission scheme.
3. The system admin is not added in any project level permission as user/group.
4. Login as system login. User can see the newly created project in "administration" tab but not in "Browse Project" tab
5. System admin can change the permission scheme and other details for that project.
6. Try to change the "Project Lead" for that project.

Result:
1. It give error message "User doesn't have permission to browse the project".

Expected:
1. System admin should be able to edit the project lead information for that project.
2. System admin should also be able to browse the project in "Browse Project" page

ADD Info:
1. Just add the system admin explicity as user in "Browse project" permission and user can change the project lead info.
column4: System administrator is unable to modify the project lead information for a project, till it's given explicity the "Browse project" permission on that project

column3:
The Custom Assignee Resolver plugin as described on [cac|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Programmatically+determining+automatic+assignee?focusedCommentId=179445043#comment-179445043] no longer works.

The cause is that Issue Views Plugin requires the Field Manager. The Field Manager gets injected with the Assignee System Field which in turn is injected with the Assignee Resolver.

This means that if the Issue Views Plugin is loaded before the Custom Assignee Resolver plugin, the Field Manager is instantiated with the Default Assignee Resolver, and not the Custom. Issue creation uses the fields on the Field Manager to create the values, and therefore uses the Default Assignee Resolver instead of the custom.
column4: Custom Assignee Resolver Component Plugin is injected incorrectly

column3:
The web UI doesn't properly set the colors on form controls (text fields, text areas, combo boxes etc). If the system look and feel uses dark controls with light text (e.g. the Darklooks theme in Fedora), then the form components are still dark in Jira, but the text is set to black. This makes the input forms really hard to use as black text on a dark gray background isn't really easy to read.

See attached screenshots.

Proposed solution:
Wherever input form controls have their font color explicitly set (in CSS or HTML), the background color should also be set. Alternatively: Don't set the foreground color of input form controls at all (and leave it to the system look and feel),
column4: Web UI doesn't properly honor system look and feel in textfields and other controlrs
Report links on the browse project screen don't pre-populate the project

column3:
permgen.sh and setenv.sh contain bash-isms that prevent the startup script (startup.sh) from working properly on my Solaris machine. My solaris machine has a vanilla Bourne shell as /bin/sh. This means the bash-isms don't work, I get shell syntax errors when running startup.sh. When I corrected these errors the problems went away and I now have a working JIRA on solaris. Here's what I changed:

1) in permgen.sh change the double square brackets to single square brackets
2) in setenv.sh change the double equals to a single equals

Regards,

Andrew Marlow
column4: JIRA startup.sh fails on solaris due to bash-isms that don't work with the Bourne shell

column3:
We have identified various errors in relations to the Japanese translations in JIRA 3.13, and have compiled a list of the ones which we believe to be problematic, in a lot of cases these are just grammar and wording changes, while in other cases it is a mistranslation, and in rare cases, some were not translated at all. Please review this list and contact me if there are any issues in regards to the content within this list.

Note that some of the corrections listed within this table links to other issues which I have raised (JRA-15735 and JRA-15699).

The most problematic ones from what I have noticed are:
1. "with open issues due to be fixed per version" - which is not translated within the Japanese language pack
2. "A change log of the recent versions for this project " - which was caused by an error in the i18 parameter name within the com\atlassian\jira\plugins\projectpanels\changelog_ja_JP.properties file, the properties should be projectpanels.changelog.description and projectpanels.changelog.name as opposed to componentpanels.changelog.description and componentpanels.changelog.name

We are currently working on modifying the Japanese language pack as an interim fix that includes the changes detailed in this issue while we wait for the official fixes.
column4: Japanese Translation Problems in JIRA 3.13
Version operations may have invalid id (HTML attribute)

column3:
The translation for "Open Issues" is incorrect, currently it is translated as: "オープンしていない課題" which means issues which are not open. The translation should be amended as "オープン中の課題" which means "Issues which are currently open".
______________________________________

For "Resolved recently", the noun "決議" is not appropriate here. "決議" is not a generic term to be used in day to day work. (It is more for a unanimous resolution at Congress etc.)
It should rather say "最近解決されたもの" as "解決" is more ordinary and appropriate translation for "Resolution" in this case.
column4: Translation Error - Japanese - Issues

column3: There seems to be an error in the translation of one of the menus in the Administration interface, the menu for "Field Configurations" is displayed as "フィルーどの設定" in JIRA 3.13, the correct translation should be "フィールドの設定".\r\n\r\nI have attached a screenshot of the administration interface to this issue.
column4: Translation error for "Field Configurations" in Japanese language pack for JIRA 3.13

column3:
Hi,

Currently there is a documentation on jira website to modity email content :

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Adding+Custom+Fields+to+Email

However there is no way to modify email subject. 

It could be usefull if the subject could be parameterized.

In our case, we had the standard subject  :

(issue action) : (issue name) (issue summary)

but we modified MailingListCompiler.java to have :

(issue name) (issue summary): (issue action)

Users in our company prefers that way as it is more easy to sort their emails by subject and group every mail related to a specific issue. 

We just modified the file : MaillingListCompiler.java

line 323 :
< return translatedSubject + ": " + emailSubject.getSubjectTrailer();
> return emailSubject.getSubjectTrailer() + ": " + translatedSubject ;

It is an ugly hack for our need but I think it could improve the usability if this things could be modified in administration or user preferences.
column4: Allow parameterization of email subjects
UserManager cache not flushed on config import

column3:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-15362].
  {panel}

Currently to perform low level mail debugging you have to set mail.debug=true on the command line and restart JIRA.

We should be able to toggle a switch in the logging section of JIRA and have it turn on dynamically.

Ideally one should only have to set System.getProperties().setProperty*"mail.debug","true") however there is a block on this

In order to get this to work, atlassian-mail needs some surgery as decsribed here: 

http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/MAIL-38

Also in the IMAP/POP fetcher we dont use the same mechanism but instead rely on javax.mail.Session.getDefaultInstance() which is a static.  We need to call setDebug() on this object before using it.

After that we should be able to get dynamic mail debugging in place without a restart.
column4: Add dynamic mail.debug support to JIRA

column3:
Hi,

To improve the migration importation phase from mantis I made some modifications to the importer MantisImportBean reusing some modifications that was already made in another issue and some modifications that was existing for bugzilla importer. 

I also add the same search bugzilla portlet as for mantis.

Please find attached a zip file with the following new file :

- mantis.vm
- mantissearch.jsp
- corner_mantisfinder.gif
- mantisfinder.gif
- mantis*.properties (for i18n)

And one file that was patched : 
- system-portlets-plugin.xml

Those files are placed in the same directory as in my development installation, it provides a fast search portlet to find an issue given its mantis id.

There is also the file : MantisImportBean.java 

To add this file, I use the http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+Standalone+quick+source+modifications 

The importer was modified to do the following : 

- create specific custom fields : internal priority and reproducibility. Those fields exist in mantis but they wasn't imported in JIRA with the original importer.
- the importer could now made incremental import
- create links type : duplicate, related to, child of 
- recreate Links between issue (only if the two issues exist. In case of partial import, the link will be created when all issues are present)
- import watchers

I will link to the issue that helps me to modify the importer.


I hope it could be helpful if it is integrated in the core.

Regards,
column4: Improve mantis migration and integration (patch attached)

column3: In edit templates the entire table row (including the field name/label) is generated for the edit view using the controlHeader and controlFooter calls.  This allows for the entire row to customized.  I use this in a custom field plugin for fields that can only be seen by users with certain permissions (similar to how comments are handled).\r\n\r\nIn the view template, however, only the field's value is rendered.  This requires Jira source to be modified to achieve the same effect of hiding the entire row.  I think it would be a fairly simple change to allow the view template to render the label as well.  This would allow for plugins to create "field level permissions" more effectively and allow for say, HTML acronym tags to be embedded in the label.
column4: Use same method for rendering fields in view templates as in edit templates

column3:
The login portlet is not displayed when the default dashboard has no portlets. Under 3.12.x it actually gives the user the link to add a portlet. Under 3.13 it actually displays nothing (check the attached screeshots). This is a large problem under 3.12.x because the login link in the header goes to the dashboard. Under 3.13 I believe the login link takes you directly to the static jsp.

Also, the width of the login portlet seems to depend upon the layout of the system dashboard. If the system dashboard has 1 column, then the portlet will take up the whole screen. When it has two columns, the login portlet only takes up half the screen (check screenshots).
column4: Login 'portlet' not being displayed.

column3:
When you are a non-sys admin and want to send a support request you will see the following message.

The message is "You do not have permission to access Trusted Application info. Contact your System Administrator."

This is a bit uninformative, perhaps we should show a warning that the trusted app info will not be shown but showing an error is a bit alarming.
column4: When sending a support request as a non system admin there is a message about not being able to see trusted app information

column3:
Road map now contains a green-red progress bar indicating unresolved and resolved amount of work for a particular release. It can be also useful to see which part of planned issues is "in progress", i.e. these issues are "expected to be done soon" (important mainly for testers and project manages). This can be seen now only on per-issue basis, and might be incorporated also in progress bar indicator.

Yes, it is only an adornment, but it can
# do a reasonable amout of information very quickly, 
# be easy to implement as far as it requires to modify only a pretty local part of code and all necessary information are (likely) already available in runtime, _and_
# provide a nice screenshot fragment for release notes and it always makes marketing happy. :-)
column4: Add yellow part for in progress issues into progress bar of roadmap.

column3: bq. When you go to this page: https://jira.xxxxxxx.com.au/browse/SXXXD-875 It says 'Sign up'. However, when you click that link, you get an error.\r\n\r\nI believe that we should not show users something that they are not supposed to see.

column3: When the top navigation was moved into a VM in version 3.12 of JIRA, the HTML was changed slightly and now a blank link appears beneath the banner at the top of the screen. column3:
There's a couple of issues with the ViewProfilePanel plugin point:
* The module descriptor doesn't call init(this) on the module being created which means the module itself doesn't have access to any of the plugin resources the descriptor makes available
* The webwork property tag doesn't define escape='false' 

There's also an improvement:
* The getHtml() method should pass along the user whose profile page is being viewed.  It makes sense for plugins of this type to be given this information.
column4: ViewProfilePanel plugin point is broken

column3:
You can specify a default locale for JIRA by setting the following property in the {{jira-application.properties}} file:
{noformat}jira.i18n.default.locale = MyCoolLocale{noformat}
Currently, if the value for this locale is not an available locale (or even a valid locale string), nothing happens and JIRA continues on using this locale as the default. This can cause problems for example in the date picker calendar resource, which depends on the locale information being correct to include the right resources.

What should probably happen is, when parsing the locale string in {{JiraLocaleUtils}}, if the locale string is not part of the list of available locales in the JVM, JIRA should log an error and default to the JVM's default locale. It's pretty rare that someone will set the locale string to something other than the default and at the same time set the string to something non-sensical, but it did come up in [one case|JRA-13678].
column4: JIRA should validate the default locale specified in the jira-application.properties file

{code}
2008-02-18 19:25:32,767: [ERROR] [Thread-33] - org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase.[Catalina].[localhost].[/jira].release() - ApplicationFilterConfig.doAsPrivilege
java.lang.ClassCastException: java.lang.IllegalAccessException
	at org.apache.catalina.security.SecurityUtil.execute(SecurityUtil.java:277)
	at org.apache.catalina.security.SecurityUtil.doAsPrivilege(SecurityUtil.java:217)
	at org.apache.catalina.security.SecurityUtil.doAsPrivilege(SecurityUtil.java:177)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterConfig.release(ApplicationFilterConfig.java:249)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext.filterStop(StandardContext.java:3669)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext.stop(StandardContext.java:4349)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase.removeChild(ContainerBase.java:892)
	at org.apache.catalina.startup.HostConfig.undeployApps(HostConfig.java:1164)

	at org.apache.catalina.util.LifecycleSupport.fireLifecycleEvent(LifecycleSupport.java:119)

These errors occur only after turning on log4j logging on tomcat instead of standard logging. The procedure is described here:

As we are sending error logs of tomcat to our system administrator's mail, we also had to remove all javamail related libraries from jira webapp, and put them in {{$TOMCAT_HOME/common/lib}} directory.

Remote debug of this tomcat instance shows such error as a cause of the above stack trace:

Class org.apache.catalina.security.SecurityUtil$1 can not access a member of class com.atlassian.gzipfilter.AbstractFilter with modifiers "public" 
{code}

column3:
The IssueSecurityLevelManager finds the list of Security Levels available to a user for a given Project or Issue.
The problem is that we cache the results against the project even if it was a query for an issue, and also we use the List cached against the project even if it is an issue query.

This leads to incorrect results when the Issue Level Security scheme includes permissions like "reporter" or "assignee".

Please see TestPromptUserForSecurityLevelOnMove.testMoveProject_Issue_SecurityLevelNotAvailableToUser() for a func test that was failing because of this bug.
Note, however, that this test was not written specifically or this particular issue, so it may randomly pass.

Bug exists in IssueLevelSecurities.getUsersSecurityLevels()
column4: The Project/User/Security Level Cache can be over eager and grant incorrect Security Levels to users.

column3:
When profiling is enabled and the Renderer component is successfully wrapped with the dynamic proxy (see JRA-13625), the initializeComponents() method of WikiRendererFactory throws a ClassCastException as it attempts to cast the Renderer component to a V2Renderer class. This cast succeeds when profiling is disabled because the Renderer component is actually an instance of V2Renderer, but with the dynamic proxy in place, the component is only seen as a Renderer object. This cast is necessary as the method uses the setComponents() method which is defined in V2Renderer but not the Renderer interface.

The suggested solution is to promote the setComponents() method to the Renderer interface.

Please note that this issue is also causing newly-written Selenium tests which test the Wiki Rendering functionality to break, because by default Selenium tests enable profiling.
column4: Renderer component does not work with profiling enabled

This situation has been mentioned on the Jira forum and comments in other issues.
This causes serious problems with our workflow as it destroys the reliability of hour timesheet reports

See this comment from JRA-1993:
I wanted to use post-functions of workflows. I am setting remaining time to 0 there. Unfortunately I have the following problem: if nobody has logged any work till the moment when the issue is closed (or resolved) then this post-function in fact resets original estimation to 0 (instead of resetting remaining time). Our people often close issues and then report time spent. It means disaster for us - original estimations are erased.
With the lack of support for logging work on transition screen - I cannot handle it.
column4: Setting remaining time to 0 in a post function of the workflow causes the original estimate to be set to 0 as well (only when no time was logged by the assignee)

Under Administration > Custom Fields > Configure is the screen 'Default Configuration Scheme for ...' with name ConfigureCustomField which allows you to set the Applicable Context, Default Value and Options. However, the Options actually set the values, so it would be more logical to call that field Values.

Instead of 
- Context
- Default Value
- Options

It would be more logical to relabel the field names to be
- Context 
- Default Value
- Values

This request is the result of a call from a user who was unable to find how to set the values despite finding this screen.
column4: Rename custom field 'options' to more logical 'values'

column3:
The integrity checker will crash if the PortletConfiguration data has invalid data (ironic I know)

In PortletCheck the code

{code]
    protected boolean shouldPortletBeDeleted(String entityIdStr) throws GenericEntityException
    {
        Long entityId = new Long(entityIdStr);
        GenericValue entity = ofBizDelegator.findByPrimaryKey(getPropertyEntity(), EasyMap.build("id", entityId));
        return (entity == null);
    }
{code}

blindly accepts an entity id as a string and assumes it on Long format.  If its not or "" empty string then BANG!

The customers data had empty string for a PortletConfiguration projectId.  

{code]
mysql> select * from propertyentry, propertystring where propertyentry.id = propertystring.id and property_key = 'projectId';
+-------+----------------------+-----------+--------------+--------------+-------+---------------+
| ID    | ENTITY_NAME          | ENTITY_ID | PROPERTY_KEY | propertytype | ID    | propertyvalue |
+-------+----------------------+-----------+--------------+--------------+-------+---------------+
| 11550 | PortletConfiguration |     10095 | projectid    |            5 | 11550 | 10061         | 
| 11552 | PortletConfiguration |     10096 | projectid    |            5 | 11552 | 10060         |

| 11620 | PortletConfiguration |     10133 | projectId    |            5 | 11620 |               | 
| 11617 | PortletConfiguration |     10132 | projectid    |            5 | 11617 | 10070         | 
| 11863 | PortletConfiguration |     10246 | projectid    |            5 | 11863 | 10061         | 
| 11873 | PortletConfiguration |     10248 | projectid    |            5 | 11873 | 10060         | 
| 12019 | PortletConfiguration |     10301 | projectid    |            5 | 12019 | 10073         | 
| 12120 | PortletConfiguration |     10331 | projectid    |            5 | 12120 | 10060         | 
| 12448 | PortletConfiguration |     10429 | projectid    |            5 | 12448 | 10061         | 
| 12450 | PortletConfiguration |     10430 | projectid    |            5 | 12450 | 10060         |

The integrity check  should have more integrity :)

column3:
In a scenario when a user wants to install JIRA as the service by executing service.bat and there is no JAVA_HOME, JDK or JRE installed in Windows (clean installation), the service can't start. 
 
I think, the problem is related to a value (*auto*) that in this scenario is assigned to a JVM key. It is stored in HLM\SOFTWARE\Apache Software Foundation\Procrun 2.0\JIRA<set of digits>\Parameters\Java and it should point to jvm.dll from <JIRA home path>\jre\ or from JAVA_HOME if defined. Although, in the bat file the validation of JVM is done in the following way:
{noformat}
rem Set the server jvm from JAVA_HOME
set PR_JVM=%JAVA_HOME%\jre in\server\jvm.dll
if exist "%PR_JVM%" goto foundJvm
rem Set the client jvm from JAVA_HOME
set PR_JVM=%CURRENT_DIR%\jre in\client\jvm.dll
if exist "%PR_JVM%" goto foundJvm
rem Check for JRockit JVM: Bugzilla 39674
set PR_JVM=%JAVA_HOME%\jre in\jrockit\jvm.dll
if exist "%PR_JVM%" goto foundJvm
set PR_JVM=auto
{noformat}
so we finish up with JVM the vaule auto which can't "find" any JVM.

Attached log file from a test the failed installation of the service.
column4: windows service installation script (service.bat) doesn't set the service correctly for JVM

column3: I have a filter that includes the custom field "Days since last comment" (from the Toolkit). All comments are set to security for group "Staff. When displayed on screen, in issue navigator, the value is displaying correctly. But when the staff members receive a filter subscription, the value is not displaying correctly. I think it goes back to the last comment that was visible to all users.\r\n\r\nSo, when they receive the email it shows last commented 8 weeks ago when there have been numerous comments in the past few days. It is misleading. I am logging the issue here rather than JTOOL because the problem is with the filter subscription logic, and not with the custom field itself (which displays correctly in issue navigator).
column4: Days since last comment field not displayed correctly in filter subscription e-mail

column3:
If you put a URL like http://www.example.com/xyz- into a description file or comment then the traling - is truncated from the URL link.  The actual displayed part is correct however the href part is truncated.

We should encode the URL link not truncate the invalid URL characters.  In fact - is not an invalid URL char anyway so I am not sure exactly whats going on here.

I confirmed it happens on 3.8 and 3.10.

This is described in the support request https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-14253
column4: Trailing + characters are truncuated from URLS in the Description / Environment / Comment fields.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-13169].
  {panel}

The current ViewVC intergration does not work well with ViewVC versions 1.03 and 1.04.

The URLs used lack the view=markup attribute and hence pages get servered as binary content instead of text/html

The support request JSP-14297 explaians it well.

I have done some prelim testing on ViewVC 1.0.3 and 1.0.4 and the "revision" link generated is the most "problematic"
column4: ViewVC intergration should have be in markup mode

column3:
For the browse project, browse version and browse component pages and the 2D stats report and portlet as well as the single level group-by report, the names of the following domain entities should link to the relevant issue navigator search (consistent with JIRA version 3.9):

* component
* version
* status
* assignee
* priority 

This issue was originally raised as specific to the assignee and has since been broadened to incorporate the whole scope of the set of changes to these links made as a part of the 3.10 feature _browse components and versions_.

In the browse project page, clicking on an assignee used to show all issues assigned to that person (v3.9). Now (v3.10) it shows the user profile. How often does someone in the Browse Project page want to see a user's profile? Like .0001 % of the time?

Now I see the screen has been totally revamped forcing users to click on the tiny link with the number instead of the larger link with the status, name, etc.
column4: Revert to 3.9 behaviour for stats page links for: Assignee, Version, Component, etc.

column3:
It should be nice to be able to archive very old resolved/closed issues automatically. What does it mean 'very old' should be configurable on per project basis. A very nice example is your own Jira: there are more than 11000 issues for project Jira and a lot of old/resolved/duplicated issues is returned as serach results and so on. Additionaly, there are many very old unresolved bugs, which are lost in huge amount of issues. The goal of suggested feature is to give more transparency for projec managers, developers and other users. There are some additional suggestions (maybe "usage rules") about this functionality:

# Only resolved issue can be archived.
# Archived issues are ignored in search results/filters by default.
# Issues can be archived manually.
# There is configurable "issue age treshold" for each project specifying how much time after last resolution of issue it will be archived. Maybe 2 years is a reasonable default.
column4: Archiving too old closed issues

column3:
Migrating Kaamelot to JIRA 3.10, I discovered two main things :
- JIRA Architecture is more and more mature, and your code may inspire a lot of developper
- But it appears that the philosphy of Extensibility is not followed by all JIRA developper ...

In our previous exchange (mail from Dylan, the 15 May), it was plan that I will create some listener to catch *Update* and *Delete* events on Worklog.
It was a good idea, but interesting only for *Delete* event.

For *Create* and *Update* events, I do have to extends these actions in order to be able to retrieve the entered *WorklogType* (from Portlet through DWR and in overriden JSP) and save it in JIRAWORKLOG table (now WorklogExt OFBiz Entity).

Finally, I decided to extend the 3 actions ...
||From AJAX Portlet             ||From overriden JSP      ||From Default JSP |
| ExtendedCreateWorklogForAjax  | ExtendedCreateWorklog   | CreateWorklog |
| ExtendedUpdateWorklogForAjax  | ExtendedUpdateWorklog   | UpdateWorklog |
| ExtendedDeleteWorklogForAjax  | ExtendedDeleteWorklog   | DeleteWorklog |

Although, in my answer of 15 May to Dylan (cc Tim and Jason), I mentionned some remarks concerning  :
{quote} ...
Concerning Service / Manager / Store and Worklog Action :
As you have perhaps saw in Kaamelot, I have often make extends of existing Manager or Actions, and often duplicate existing method, which have private qualifier.
Is it possible to provide Manager and Action with more protected qualifier in order to avoid such duplication ?
...{quote}
for the *Create* action, the *CreateWorklog* class delegates Worklog creation to the *WorklogService*, {color:red}but the attribut _worklog_ in *CreateWorklog* is :
- never updated after creation
- not accessible : No Accessor even protected.
{color}

In order to continue my migration, I have made a Hack (See attachment).

May you integrate my hack or provide me another way to extend this action.

Rgs
Vincent
column4: Worklog Creation not easily extensible.

column3:
When creating a new customfield, the issue type multiselect list which contains more that one value is shrink into a single row. In {{addcontext.jsp}}, I found that the {{size}} param is not passed.
{code}
<ui:select label="text('admin.menu.issuesettings.issue.types')" name="'issuetypes'" template="selectmultiple.jsp"
           list="/allIssueTypes" listKey="'id'" listValue="'nameTranslation'">
    <ui:param name="'headerrow'"><webwork:text name="'admin.schemecontext.anyissuetype'"/></ui:param>
    <ui:param name="'headervalue'">-1</ui:param>
    <ui:param name="'optionIcon'">iconUrl</ui:param>
    <ui:param name="'optionTitle'">descTranslation</ui:param>
    <ui:param name="'description'"><webwork:text name="'admin.schemecontext.applyforall'"/></ui:param>
</ui:select>
{code}

Adding this line {{<ui:param name="'size'">*any number*</ui:param>}} should fix the problem.
column4: Certain multiple select list not having size parameter being specified, causing usability problem to certain browsers (e.g. Opera)

column3: As the previous *LogWork* action have been split into 3 actions (CreatedWorklog, UpdateWorklog and  DeleteWorklog), all extending *AbstractWorklogAction*, only default property file *LogWork.properties* has been renamed *AbstractWorklogAction.properties* .\r\n\r\n{*}{color:red} All other LogWork_xx_XX.properties files always exists, but never accessed. !! {color}{*}
column4: misnamed I18n properties for Worklog

column3:
Extending the *SearchRequestPortlet* for Kaamelot Portlet, I use *WorklogService.hasPermissionToCreate(JiraServiceContext jiraServiceContext, Issue issue)*  .
As *SearchRequestPortlet* provides through its *SearchProvider* a list of Issue based on class DocumentIssueImpl, the *hasPermissionToCreate()* fails with follow stacktrace.
{code}
2007-07-11 11:28:24,944 http-8080-Processor24 ERROR [com.atlassian.velocity.DefaultVelocityManager] MethodInvocationException occurred getting message body from Velocity: java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException: This code or velocity template expects a GenericValue, but received an Issue.  We need to recode

	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor149.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:585)
	at com.atlassian.util.profiling.object.ObjectProfiler.profiledInvoke(ObjectProfiler.java:71)
	at com.atlassian.jira.config.component.SwitchingInvocationHandler.invoke(SwitchingInvocationHandler.java:28)

	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.issue.worklog.DefaultWorklogService.isIssueInEditableWorkflowState(DefaultWorklogService.java:514)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.issue.worklog.DefaultWorklogService.hasPermissionToCreate(DefaultWorklogService.java:342)
{code}

*DocumentIssueImpl* throws _*UnsupportedOperationException*_ on *getString()* call done by *SimpleWorkflowManager.isEditable(Issue issue)*.

In *SimpleWorkflowManager.isEditable(Issue issue)*, the retrieve of StatusId ..
{code:java}final String status = issue.getString("status");{code}
should be done as follow :
{code:java}final String status = issue.getStatusObject().getId();{code}
column4: UnsupportedOperationException with hasPermissionToCreate when called with DocumentIssueImpl

column3:
A support customer is getting OutOfMemoryErrors when accessing the following JIRA admin pages:
- Menus Administration ->Global Settings -> Events
- Issue Settings -> Statuses

The customer is getting this with up to 1 Gig of memory allocated to the JVM.

The customer is getting the error in version 3.6.1. I can reproduce the error on my machine in version 3.6.1 and in version 3.10.

I can reproduce the OutOfMemory error every time for the Events page, when I have 256 MBytes of memory allocated to the JVM. Once I increase to 512 MByes, I do not get the error.

I have not been able to reproduce the error for the Issue Statuses page, however the operation does take a long time to complete - around 1 minute.

The customer has a reasonably large number of workflows - 46 - and a lot of issue statuses - 208. The errors are possibly related to the number of issue statuses and having to loop through them as part of determining whether or not an event is active.

Cheers,
Ian
column4: OutOfMemoryError in Events and Issue Status admin pages when lots of issue types and workflows

column3: JIRA's Administration -> System Info page should print *all* system properties available. Some tasks (like [connecting to SSL services|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+to+SSL+services]) requires setting system properties, and it would be useful to be able to see if a property has been properly set.
column4: System Info should include all system properties

column3:
JIRA really needs to be logging critical system operations like reindexes. We get problem reports with logs like:

2007-07-05 00:00:34,723 ERROR [jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager] Lock attempt timed out - waited 30000 milliseconds
..... lots of random stuff ......
2007-07-05 23:00:18,359 ERROR [jira.issue.statistics.ComponentStatisticsMapper] Indexes may be corrupt - unable to retrieve component with id '13072'.

We cannot tell if there was a reindex between the original lock problem and (apparent) symptom.
column4: Log critical system operations like reindexes

column3: If I have create a Two Dimensional Filter Statistics portlet and show a custom user field as the Y-axis, the actual values are hyperlinked but the 'None' isn't.  See screenshot for details.
column4: Two Dimensional Filter statistics portlet doesn't have hyperlink for "None"
Auto-adjust parent issue on sub-task status

column3:
There was a problem reported by Steve when moving a portlet up on the dashboard (from the bottom position):
{noformat}
 java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException: Index: 4, Size: 4
	at java.util.ArrayList.RangeCheck(I)V(ArrayList.java:506)
	at java.util.ArrayList.get(I)Ljava/lang/Object;(Optimized Method)
{noformat}

Re-shuffling the portlets a bit (moving the one above to the bottom) fixed the problem.  It's still unclear how JIRA got into this state however.  We need to investigate the portlet move code to see if it's possible to end up with an invalid position index.
column4: Moving portlet up reults in IndexOutOfBoundsException

column3: Is it possible to make the comment field mandatory? I have certain transitions that has no fields required to enter except for comments, but I understand that is is optional by default.
column4: Allow comment fields to be mandatory (required)
Sorting by work-ratio breaks if no issues have an original estimate
Issue Age Field

column3: The "log work" time tracking interface should allow fractional durations, e.g. 1.5d, to be entered in the "Time Spent" and "Set estimated time remaining" fields.\r\n\r\nThis is especially aggravating since the interface outputs fractional times, but doesn't allow them to be entered.
column4: Log work interface should accept fractional durations

column3:
On the "Share Current Filter" page (/secure/ShareFilter!default.jspa):

!sharefilter.png!

If a group is selected from the "Share with group" drop-down, one would expect the "Share with group" radio list button to be selected automatically. It isn't, and so the group you've selected isn't used.
column4: UI bug: Choosing "Share with group" select list option does not auto-select the radio button

column3:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-12920].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 13 Jan 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days; however there are no immediate plans to put this suggestion on our near term roadmap.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Daniel Franz
dfranz@atlassian.com
Principal Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}
  

I am thinking of having a field that serves as an time estimator field. That means, that the assignee can specify in days or weeks estimate of period they need to complete an assignment. 

Unfortunately I don't find one in the JIRA custom fields section. 

Any ideas for this? Or is there any alternative to this?
column4: Convert Date Picker to A Time Tracker

column3:
Stylesheet is broken for RSS view. This is because the {{jirarss2html.xsl}} is outdated, i.e. there's no template for the different tags:

* description
* author
* etc..

Perhaps we should use new /different stylesheets for searchrequest-rss-header.vm.
column4: XSL Stylesheet broken for RSS view

column3:
When I click on the 'Assign this issue' link I get a javascript error:

 Null value
http://jira.atlassian.com/s/234/1/1.0/_/download/resources/jira.webresources:issueoperations/issueoperations.js : Line 101

Line 101 is:

var url = addParameterToUrl(anchor.getAttribute("href") + "", "decorator=basic");
column4: Javascript error assigning issue on Safari 3 beta

column3:
This issue only started when we upgraded from 3.1 to 3.7.4

Issues commented throught the CVS Log Handler are not sending notification emails any users. If the issue is commented by hand (through JIRA) users do get a notification (so there is no problem with notification or email setup).

It looks therefore that this feature was broken sometime between 3.1 and 3.7.4
column4: CVS Log Handler no longer generates Issue Commented notifications
Customfield User Picker "corrupted" after a user is deleted

column3:
There are a number of malformed properties in the default locale JiraWebActionSupport.properties and corresponding problems in the files for other locales.

We need to do a systematic search and fix for the following circumstances:

* no equals sign between property key and value
* incorrect line continuations: the backslash "" at the end of the line should accompany a value continued on the next line, not a new key=value pair.
* incomplete/half written keys with no value
* <webwork:property> tags in values! e.g. {{admin.workflows.delete.confirmation}}
* duplicate keys
column4: Malformed Ressource Bundle properties files

column3: As you can see in the attached screenshot, even on the most recent version of JIRA, when the Issue links link is clicked and you are on the manage links page, the linked issue does not display with strikethrough even though the issue is resolved. This would seem to be inconsistent with JIRA's philosophy of showing resolved issues in strikethrough font.
column4: Resolved issue not showing with strikethrough on Manage links page

column3: It'd be nice in the email to have a link to Manage the subscription at the bottom of the email. Maybe a link to cancel the subscription would be nice too.
column4: Add a link to manage subscription in the subscription email

column3:
If we are importing Bugzilla bugs into JIRA, and some bugs have a summary over 255 characters:

{noformat}
mysql> select count(*) from bugs where length(short_desc) > 255;
+----------+
| count(*) |
+----------+
|        8 | 
+----------+
1 row in set (0.02 sec)
{noformat}

Then the importer will break with a long stacktrace, ending with:

{noformat}
(ERROR: value too long for type character varying(255) )) at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDAO.singleInsert(GenericDAO.java:123) at 
org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDAO.insert(GenericDAO.java:88) at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericHelperDAO.create(GenericHelperDAO.java:63) at 
org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDelegator.create(GenericDelegator.java:480) at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDelegator.create(GenericDelegator.java:460) at 
org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericValue.create(GenericValue.java:77) at com.atlassian.core.ofbiz.util.EntityUtils.createValue(EntityUtils.java:61) at 
com.atlassian.jira.issue.IssueImpl.store(IssueImpl.java:871) ... 79 more
{noformat}
column4: Bugzilla importer breaks when summary contains over 255 characters

column3:
The following integrity checks have an apostrophe before 's' after the  'FilterSubscription' word:

Check FilterSubscription's for references to non-existent QuartzTriggers.
Check FilterSubscription's for references to non-existent SearchRequests.

I think the 's' meant to make FilterSubscription plural, so we need to remove the apostrophe.
column4: Subscription integrity checks are misnamed

column3:
Documentation for "Edit Issue Security Levels States:

'Edit Issue Security Levels
On this page you can create and edit the issue security levels for the "StandardTaskSecurityScheme" issue security scheme. '

Expected Behaviour: To be able to create and edit the issue security levels
Observed Behaviour: You can Add, and Delete, but not edit

Suggested Action: One of 
  o Changing documentation to note that you can create and delete issue security levels 
  o Changing the behaviour so you can Create and Edit the issue security levels.
column4: "Edit Issue Security Level" behaviour does not match documentation.

column3:
A customer made the following [support request|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-12734]. I will resolve that request and let the customer know to track it here instead.

Kind regards,
Ian

Jira currently cannot print information from separate custom-made tabs on an issue. The only way to print all the data is to click on each tab and print each one separately, which makes it a very tedious process.

The problem is greater if we need to print out all issues from the Issue Navigator by clicking on "Full Content". It only displays data from the first tab. This is causing the printing out of multiple issues for our weekly meetings very difficult.

The tabs are a great tool in separating out different kinds of data, and it would be great if the information can be printed out easily all in one go. Therefore, please kindly consider addressing the issue in a near-future release. Thanks for your help.
column4: Cannot print data on separate tabs in one go

column3:
I tried deleting and re-adding the Project Table portlet, but I still get the following error:


Error rendering /portlets/dashboard/projecttables.jsp: /portlets/dashboard/projecttables.jsp:39: code too large for try statement } catch (java.lang.Throwable _jsp_e) { ^ /opt/j2ee/domains/atlassian.com/jira/resin/webapps/ROOT/WEB-INF/work/_jsp/_portlets/_dashboard/_projecttables__jsp.java:270: code too large for try statement try { ^ /opt/j2ee/domains/atlassian.com/jira/resin/webapps/ROOT/WEB-INF/work/_jsp/_portlets/_dashboard/_projecttables__jsp.java:23: code too large _jspService(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, ^ 3 errors.
Removing and recreating this portlet may solve the problem.
If not please ask your JIRA adminstrator to send a support request
column4: Compiling the 'Project Table' portlet with resin using JDK 1.6 does not work

column3:
When a comment is edited, the HTML email lists 'Author' and 'Edited by' details, eg:

Author: Bob
Created on: 29/May/07 02:15 PM
Edited by: Test User
Edited on: 29/May/07 02:31 PM

The 'Edited by' is incorrect. It will be set to the original commenter, not the person who edited the comment.

Additionally, 'Author' is redundant and should be removed (once 'Edited by' shows the right person).
column4: Edit Comment email notification mixes up updater with original commenter

column3:
When a comment is edited in JIRA, an email notification goes out. For the HTML mail, this email includes useful details like:

Author: Fred
Created on: 25/May/07 13:11
Edited by: Joe
Edited on: 25/May/07 14:15"

The equivalent text template (issuecommentedited.vm) doesn't contain these details.
column4: Edit Comment text email notification does not list 'Edited on' and 'Edited by' details

column3:
Users can create filter subscriptions, can click "run now" and the last sent and next send are shown - even if there is no mail server configured in the system.

Additionally, the mail queue gets an email in it which will never be sent until a mail sever is added.

The user should not be able to edit or run filter subscriptions (and they should not attempt to run or enqueue emails). The user should not be given the impression that email will be or has been sent.
column4: filter subscriptions pretend to work happily even when there is no configured mail server

column3: A username that includes a single quote break JavaScript on the user picker HTML. See screenshot attached.
column4: User Picker does not handle single quote (') correctly
Update create issue development documentation

column3:
The excel export (Issue Navigator) is currently not able to escape certain arithmetic operators such as =, -, +, etc. If the cell data is starting with these operators, excel will treat it as a formula and it will not allow a formula that consists more than 1024 characters with the error message "Cell data too large".

h4. Workaround
Can be found in [this comment|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-12759?focusedCommentId=80176&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-80176]
column4: Excel export should escape the certain arithmetic operators

column3:
The following line of HTML code is malformed. The tag shouldn't have a '/' character at the end. This markup is usually for tags like
and . I found this specifically because the apache module mod_proxy_html interperates this tag as a single tag and breaks the HTML (where browsers would normally ignore this error). This line of code only appears when viewing an issue. The offending code: Watchers: 0  (View) The fix: Watchers: 0  (View)
column4: HTML error with watchers link when viewing a bug

column3:
I think we need some improvement on the IIS instructions in the CAC's and JIRA documentation. There seems to be a little bit of inconsistency such as, we are asking the users to check the "Execute (Such as ISAPI application of CGI)" for the virtual directory in the CAC's documentation, but in the JIRA's one, this is missing.

I have set up IIS v5.1 and its integration with JIRA by following the JIRA documentation. I found that setting the ISAPI filter is one of the requirements in order for the proxy/redirection to function properly, but the documentation says that it's for IIS v6. 

These are the documentation I'm referring to.

* http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/iisintegration.html
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+IIS+with+Tomcat

The Confluence's IIS integration guide is working and can be a reference anyway:

* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Setting+up+Confluence+with+IIS
column4: Improvement on Integration with IIS document

column3: Currently, we only respect the External user management flag in the bugzilla import bean, to warn the user that new users will have to be created in their external user management system (i.e. LDAP).  This should be extended to also support the external password management flag.

column3: _emphasized text_Similar to JRA-12410 - deleting a custom field does not adequately clean up after itself. Specifically, affected issues are not reindexed so the updated security and permission aspects are not reflected in search results which is a security hole. Note that a naive fix may produce performance problems since there may be a large number of affected issues which must be reindexed. Consider the index lock granularity in fixing this - it may be better to reindex the issues one at a time so the fine grained lock does not cause latency problems for concurrent users.\r\n\r\nAlso - has this always been the case? Surely no! - bug fixer should investigate this - has this bug been introduced in the last, say, 12 months?
column4: Deleting a custom field which has an issue security scheme or permission scheme on it does not update the index and issue navigator is out of date

column3:
When creating a project from CSV wizard the project key is not validated agains the regexp defined in jira.projectkey.pattern in jira-application.properties.

Once you have a project with an invalid key all sorts of things go wrong (such as being unable to browse issues in the project).

The CSV ConfigureCsvMapping needs to validate the project key to stop this from happening.
column4: When creating a project from CSV wizard the project key is not validated agains the regexp defined in jira.projectkey.pattern in jira-application.properties

When using russian indexing JIRA not search for numbers in text fields with numbers (Text search module in Navigator) and custom fields with Free Text Searcher.

In "other" language and English - search for numbers fine, but with wrong Russian search.

I.e. search for code in information or in custom field for card number (i.e. search for "4013*" returns 0 records even if exist record with value "40135083")

* Go to General Configuration and set the indexing language to "Other"

column3:
Currently importing data with attachments fails against the Bugzilla 2.22.2 database due to a schema change in that version.

From [the forums|http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?forumID=46&threadID=16538]:

{panel}

I am trying to use Bugzilla importer provided by Jira to import all the bugs in Bugzilla 2.22 (and 2.22.2) into Jira 3.7.4. However, I have found out that the attachments will not be migrated into Jira and I have gotten the following errors:

[21:09:36] Importing Issue: "test with attachment"
[21:09:37] Error on importing attachments for bug 8. Error:Column 'thedata' not found.

After searching a little bit more, I have found that the database schema of Bugzilla has been changed since 2.21.1. In Bugzilla 2.21.1, a new table named attach_data was introduced to handle big attachment. However, the Bugzilla importer for Jira 3.7.4 (even 3.8) is still using the schema for Bugzilla 1.8.

Here comes my question:

Is there anybody who has a fix for this? If so, could you please share your fix(es) with me?
{panel}
column4: JIRA BugzillaImporter needs to be made compatible with Bugzilla 2.22.2

column3:
The {{getActionIdByName()}} method in the class {{com.atlassian.jira.jelly.tag.issue.TransitionWorkflow}} doesn't validate the status of an issue before returning the action back to the calling function.

For instance, in JIRA default workflow, an issue in the status of "Resolved" (step '4'), its "Close Issue" action is having the id '701'. Specifying "Close Issue" in the {{workflowAction}} attribute will return this error message:

{noformat}org.apache.commons.jelly.JellyTagException: null:2:0:  The following problems were found: Action 2 is invalid{noformat}

This is reproducible by using the Jelly script below:

{code:xml}<JiraJelly xmlns:jira="jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.JiraTagLib">
  <jira:TransitionWorkflow key="TPJ-2" user="admin" workflowAction="Close Issue" />
</JiraJelly>{code}

We can get around this by specifying id instead of the action name.
column4: Jelly's TransitionWorkflow getActionIdByName() to be aware of issue's status

column4: Remove MailSender (no longer used)

column3:
Currently, {{getOptionForValue}} in {{OptionsImpl}} uses case-insensitive checking, e.g. {{option.getValue().equalsIgnoreCase(value)}}. I am not too sure about the possible harm of it, however, say if you are inserting a value into a customfield via Jelly upon creation, e.g.

{code:xml}
<JiraJelly xmlns:jira="jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.enterprise.JiraTagLib">
<jira:CreateIssue project-key="TPJ" summary="Issue Summary" reporter="yclian" assignee="yclian" issueKeyVar="issuekey" issueIdVar="issueid">
<jira:AddCustomFieldValue id="customfield_10000" value="feature"/>
</jira:CreateIssue>
</JiraJelly>
{code}

Given that *"Feature"* is one of the options defined in {{customfield_10000}}, the validation will pass and the value *"feature"* will be applied. One of the consequences, when someone tries to edit that issue, the <select/> field will not preselect the right value as it uses case sensitive comparison, i.e.

{noformat}#if ($value && $value == $option.value)selected#end{noformat}

What matters is the value being set in the database is simply not the right one.
column4: Options's getOptionForValue being case insensitive may lead to consistency problem?

column3: The edit of a project roles group membership should be guarded by the Browse Users global permission just like the user picker is for editing user project role membership. This issue is related to JRA-11884. To have the same behavior as the user picker we will need to change the UI to be like the User picker, with a Group chooser popup and the text input field that accepts comma delimited group names. We can then make it such that the picker does not show up when the user does not have the permission.
column4: Guard project role group membership edits by the global permission Browse Users

column3: In JIRA 3.7.x we added a schema check to JIRA's startup. The schema check iterates over all the tables/columns in the database to see if the schema conforms to what we expect. This seems to take a long time on Oracle and can possibly take a long time in databases where there are a lot of tables present.
column4: JIRA startup for 3.7.x is slow against some databases

column3: MailFetcherService does not delete mail message if it is unable to forward the mail because of an exception. We have seen on support.atlassian.com that a mail was being forwarded and the mail was larger than the mail service was willing to accept. This caused an exception to be generated but the mail was left in the box so it was processed over and over. \r\n\r\nA further problem with this is that if the mail is being fetched is fetched via pop then you can still run into JRA-11046.
column4: MailFetcherService does not delete mail message if it is unable to forward the mail because of an exception

column3: {{IssueActionComparator}} class gets dates from two actions calling {{getTimePerformed()}} method. This method returns {{Date}} object, however not all implementations of {{IssueAction}} return an instance of {{java.util.Date}} class, some return {{java.sql.Timestamp}}. If Timestamp is returned it throws a {{ClassCastException}} when compared with Date as per its [javadoc|http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4.2/docs/api/java/sql/Timestamp.html#compareTo(java.lang.Object)]\r\n\r\nThe comparison needs to be modified in order to avoid this scenario.
column4: IssueActionComparator causes a ClassCastException

column3:
I have reported this to support (Michelle De Guzman) and was told to report it as a bug.

When JIRA server is setup with a scheduled backup (to XML) and there is some problem with the contents of a field in the database, the backup may fail leaving behing a partial ZIP file, giving the impression that the backup completed without problems.  This happend to me where one of the date fields in the database contained the value 0000-00-00, the backup job would dump the tables up to the point where it read this record and then fail.  However, the backup job created a ZIP file anyway giving the impression that the backup was complete.  

I was able to track down the problem by doing a manual database export using the GUI.  It generated an error message and by looking at the xml file, I was able to track down the problem to the table and record.

I think that the scheduled backup should produce some warning when the job fails and most importantly should NOT create a resulting output file giving the impression that the job completed.

Thanks.
column4: Automated JIRA backup failes without proper warning

column3:
The Workload Report  looks kinda shonky at the moment, and can be improved with some minor fixes.

# Add some padding - Headings / inner boxes should have 2px - 5px space between the edges
# Use user full names rather than usernames
# The Issue Type heading seems to have disappeared (there's just a : before the summed up times)
# Widths for Key, Type and Priority should be minimised, so that the summary column can expand more
column4: Version Workload Report UI improvements

column3: Write a Check for Integrity Checker that checks and fixes data inconsistency of links to non-existing issues.
column4: Create integrity checker for links to non-existing issues

column3: There has been some changes to the atlassian-extras codebase for the hosted eval licensing. We need to make sure the changes do not make it so that we can not upgrade to the latest version of extras.
column4: Review changes to atlassian-extras caused by hosted eval liceneses addition
Beat Current Powerball Record

column3: There was a problem that both JIRA and Confluence was seeing with Lucene 1.9.1 regarding "too many open file handles". I believe that Chris O has patched the lucene jar and that Confluence is planing of shipping 2.3 with this version of the jar. We need to talk to Chris to find out the scope of the change and if we are happy with the changes role the fix into JIRA.
column4: Spurious "Too many open files" thrown by Lucene. Upgrade the lucene 1.9.1 jar to the atlassian patched version
