column3:
From JIRA support

The 2 links on the front login page are going to 2 different locations

| Login  or Sign Up | /jira/secure/Signup!default.jspa |
| Not a member? Signup for an account. | /jira/secure/Administrators.jspa |

While running in private mode they're not needed and really perhaps shouldn't be shown. If the idea is to point them to the admins and get them to create the account, there should be some text clarifying this.
column4: Front page has Sign up link when in private mode

column3: The problem is that the portlet configuration is stored in the session when lazy loading a portlet. The PortletRenderer stores the config when rendering the dashboard and then when the request makes it out to the LazyLoadingPortletServlet, it retrieves the config and then removes it from the session. This will NPE if you make two requests at the same time. The first request gets the info and removes the session object. The second request can then not find the object in the session and it dies.\r\n\r\nOne way around this is to pass enough information in the request such that we can just lookup the portlet config from the db. There is no good way of doing this at the moment other than going to the db. Will need the portlet config id and some better mechanism than just grabbing the GV to make this happen.
column4: LazyLoading Portlets (Saved Filters portlet and charting) can NPE when getting two concurrent requests

column3:
Assembling the path to a velocity macro using the file-system specific separator fails on Windows when the velocity template is in a WAR. We need to load it using a URL and the URL syntax is always forward-slash ( / ), back-slash ( \ ) makes it fail.

The effect of this is that the comment or worklog issue tab panels fail to load if there are no comments or work logs. A message "Velocity template generation failed." is printed instead. First seen on WebLogic 8.1 SP4 and SP6.

An example stacktrace from Weblogic 8.1 SP6 running JIRA 3.6.5:
{code}
2007-02-02 18:41:27,797 ERROR [velocity] ResourceManager : unable to find resource 'templates\jira\issue\action\comment.vm' in any resource loader.
2007-02-02 18:41:27,797 ERROR [com.atlassian.velocity.DefaultVelocityManager] ResourceNotFoundException occurred whilst loading resource issue\action\comment.vm
{code}

Also affects UserMailQueuItem, ReleaseNoteManager, MailFetcherService and DefaultTemplateManager classes.
column4: FileSystem specific separator used for Velocity Template selection doesn't work with unexploded WARs on Windows

column3: Issue is able to create / update an issue with components and versions of other projects.
column4: Issue is able to use unassociated components and versions
Weblogic JSP pre-compilation broken on Windows

column3: Currently the unit test entityengine.xml is using the DumbFactory transaction factory, which causes us to need to invoke the UtilsForTestSetup.loadDatabaseDriver() method. There are lots of JIRA classes that initialize the db without us really realizing it and the ordering of the running of the unit tests can make it such that the "test" db connection gets initialized incorrectly.\r\n\r\nWe need to change the test entityengine.xml to use the Jotm transaction factory. This will cause the TestUpgradeUtils test to fail because the upgrade util is written in such a way that it assumes the Connection is in autocommit mode. This test and the method it tests either needs to be removed or we need to update the code to check if the connection is set to autocommit and if not then commit the connection.
column4: Fix the test entityengine.xml to use JotmFactory as the transaction factory and remove UtilsForTestSetup.loadDatabaseDriver()

column3: The Enterprise inner class in APKeys class seems to be used no longer. We searched for usages of the class as well as text search matching APKeys.Enterprise but found nothing but selfreference. This class can be removed
column4: Remove unused Enterprise inner class in APKeys class

The single-word.vm macro has a would-be NPE because it doesn't do an explicit null check for the issue priority object. Priority is optional.

This has recently been reported to me.

On FireFox the Wiki preview icon does not show preview - instead the spinner stays forever.

However on IE 6 I get a runtime error - see attached snapshot.

I do not see any errors in the log files that seem to be related to this at the time of invoking the preview.

column3: Indexing datefield currently utilizes the deprecated DateField class to transform the date to a String: {code}DateField.dateToString(toDate);{code}  This should be changed to use the newer DateTools class: {code}DateTools.dateToString(toDate, DateTools.Resolution.MILLISECOND){code}
column4: Replace usage of deprecated class DateField with DateTools

column3:
The definiton of the Interface AttachmentManager contains the following method

{code:title=http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/3.6.4/com/atlassian/jira/issue/AttachmentManager.html}
public ChangeItemBean createAttachment(File file,
                                       String filename,
                                       String contentType,
                                       User remoteUser,
                                       org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericValue issue,
                                       Map attachmentProperties,
                                       Date createdTime)
                                throws AttachmentException,
                                       org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException
{code}
Actually the {{Date createdTime}} refers to {{java.util.Date}} but the underlying ofbiz layer does not support it. Instead of {{java.util.Date}} it can persist {{java.sql.Date}} which is a subclass of it. The following stack trace shows what happens with {{java.util.Date}}:
{noformat}
org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericNotImplementedException: Java type java.util.Date not currently supported. Sorry.
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.SqlJdbcUtil.getType(SqlJdbcUtil.java:720)
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.SqlJdbcUtil.setValue(SqlJdbcUtil.java:632)
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.SqlJdbcUtil.setValue(SqlJdbcUtil.java:601)
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.SqlJdbcUtil.setValues(SqlJdbcUtil.java:436)
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDAO.singleInsert(GenericDAO.java:114)
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDAO.insert(GenericDAO.java:88)
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericHelperDAO.create(GenericHelperDAO.java:63)
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDelegator.create(GenericDelegator.java:470)
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDelegator.create(GenericDelegator.java:450)
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericValue.create(GenericValue.java:77)
        at com.atlassian.core.ofbiz.util.EntityUtils.createValue(EntityUtils.java:61)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultAttachmentManager.createAttachment(DefaultAttachmentManager.java:101)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultAttachmentManager.createAttachment(DefaultAttachmentManager.java:202)
        .....
{noformat}
I suppose that the definition of the method (and the other createAttachment method) and the implementing class should be changed to {{java.sql.Date}}.

h4. Workaround
Use {{java.sql.Date}} instead of {{java.util.Date}}
column4: The definition of the Interface AttachmentManager is inconsistent with ofbiz

column4: Localisation problem: Wrong link in "Aufgaben: Administration"

column3:
The custom field configuration links (e.g. for default value, options) on the  ConfigureCustomField action always use the id of the fieldconfigscheme for both the fieldconfigscheme and the fieldconfiguration parameters. If the tables fieldconfigscheme and fieldconfiguration are not id-matched for each custom field, this can lead to unexpected results such as configuring the wrong field or a 500 page caused by a null pointer exception.

There is no known way the data can become inconsistent in this way except by direct modification of the database, but there is no data integrity violation and the link is clearly wrong.

The error is in the expression on line 70 of configurecustomfield.jsp where the id for the fieldconfiguration should be given the value of "../key/id". Instead it doesn't resolve (as "../id" so Webwork (in its wisdom) walks up the value stack and finds the fieldconfigscheme id which just happens to be the correct value for the fieldconfiguration id in all normal cases. One case where it is not the same is in the example provided for [JSP-7492|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-7492] where there is something strange in the data making the ids of those two tables unaligned.
column4: In certain data the custom field configuration links are wrong

column3:
As identified here, 

https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-7492

It appears that the patched file corrects a long standing problem that can only be uncovered when the ids of fieldconfigurations and fieldconfgschemes are not the same for the same fields. Legend has it that the CSV importer could cause such a situation to occur (when importing non global custom fields)  even though it can't be caused using the admin UI. 

Fix the the bug as per the patch on [JSP-7492|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-7492] and investigate the CSV importer bug.
column4: Add fix for issue identified with editing custom fields where scheme id is not the same as fieldconfig id

column3: This was a problem with the TimeInStatusCFT from the charting plugin. The removeValue method tries to do a findByAnd with the value in the custom field and this makes a value= in sql, which mssql does not handle for unlimited text fields. This method needs to either, not try to compare on the value (we need to investigate the implications of changing the behavior of the method) or we need a new method that will just delete the values for the issue.
column4: CustomFieldValuePersister.removeValue fails if the value is of type unlimited text in mssql

column3:
We need to change the way that the CustomFieldManager discovers the registered plugins of customfield type. The reason is that  we may run into a situation where a plugin has a dependancy on the CustomFieldManager which will force the manager to be created and initialized before all plugins have had a chance to register themselves. In the case of the CustomFieldManager it assumes that all custom field types have been registered and it eagerly instatiates its cache, which is incorrect since not all custom field types have been registered. So at the moment we refresh the managers AFTER we know that all has been setup within the ComponentManager.start() method, when this issue is fixed we should remove this quick fix.

The problem is not as simple as changing the eager cache to a lazy cache. If we did this we would still find that if a plugin tried to access a custom field when it is initialized then we would be back in the same situation. There are a few options to solving this:
1. Add a lifecycle interface to our managers so you could then have a "postStartup" method and in the component manager you could get all managers that implement the lifecycle interface and alert them that they are now at postStartup
2. Remove the custom field managers cache and force it to query the pluginManager everytime it is looking for custom fields. This would need to have some profiling done before we could decide if this is feasable (it could be the case that performance would take a nose-dive by removing this cache).
3. The best option is probably to include an event system in JIRA and to make certain that events are fired on plugin enable/disable/registration. We would want to include enough information about which plugin is the object of the event so that the CustomFieldManager could look for these events and keep itself in the correct state based on the events its receives. This would allow us to keep a cache (which should propbably be reworked, take a look at it...), but it would allow the manager to be kept abreast of the change state of the system. This will become even more important when we start allowing plugins to be dynamically added to a running JIRA instance. This would also allow use to clean up nasty places like the resetCaches method in the JiraPluginManager.
4. Another option which was discussed was to make the CustomFieldManager not ever talk to the PluginManager but instead to have the CustomFieldModuleDescriptor know about the CustomFIeldManager and on enable/disable/registration the descriptor can register/deregister custom field types with the Manager. In essence we turn the communication around. The only draw back of this is that we would need to come up with some mechanism to "reset" the CustomFieldManager and this could be difficult since it is the PluginManager who will know the current state of the plugins in the system.

When we fix this please remember to take out the hack in ComponentManager.start()
column4: Fix the CustomFieldManager so that it is alerted when a plugin type of customfield is registered/deregisted and fix its cache so that it will not be out-of-date at startup

column3:
Deleted user leads to Java stacktraces. This was reported as https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-6653. I tested and verified this on 3.6.3.

The easiest way to reproduce it is to:
1. create a new user 'del'
2. log out
3. log in as 'del'
4. comment on any issue
5. log out
6. log in as 'admin'
7. delete 'del' user
8. navigate to the commented issue and voila! an exception is in the log file

The easiest userfriendly fix for this might be to lower the loggin level from *ERROR* to *WARN* or *DEBUG*. The code can be found in *AbstractGVIssueAction.getUser()* method aroung line 50.
column4: Deleted user leads to Java stacktraces
Add move hyper link to issuetype-edit template for a restricted list

It also looks like the saved filter is comming from the session so perhaps there is a way we get a stale version of the saved filter into the session, it needs further investigation. See https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-6358 for a possible way to reproduce the error using jira.atlassian.com data.

column3:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-10638].
  {panel}

JRA-10205 was reported regarding the displaying of issue summary, reported and assignee, type and status on certain issue operations when not logged in. For 3.6.3 the solutions was to simply throw an IssuePermissionException when the user doesn't have Browse Issue permission for that issue. Please see that issue for a description of how it was done and what files were touched.

However, it was noted that there were at least four different ways the Issue actions might report this to the user.
# Custom handling in the operation view. Creates a very nice error page with the operation, and friendly error message - http://server/jira/secure/AddComment!default.jspa?id=12345
# "You are not logged in" message with standard Jira banner, user gets redirected to permission-violation page (permissionviolation.jsp), not so friendly, but the user gets the point - http://server/jira/secure/ViewIssue.jspa?id=12345 (note, this page has trackback info)
# "Access Denied" message with big red background, user gets redirected to security-breach page (securitybreach.jsp) with standard Jira banner, not so friendly big red message, user still gets the point - http://server/jira/secure/attachment/12345/logs_jira-int_11_03_2005.txt or the ViewVoters or ManageWatchers urls (no trackback info). 
# 500 page catches IssuePermissionException, very, very unfriendly message, lots of nasty logging.

{note}all the Admin pages use the securitybreach.jsp{note}

These need to be standardised so all access denied reports are the same, and it is not possible to view any secure information if you do not have that permission.

While researching JRA-10205 the following was noted:
- IssuePermissionException is handled inconsistently. We need to either throw it from our Action.doValidate(), Action.doExecute() & Action.doDefault() methods or handle it in a consistent manner.
- We probably should handle the standard case in the framework. AbstractIssueSelectAction holds the issueObject, and should be able to handle 99% of the code paths. Attached is a version that does the 99% (doesn't handle the trackback case)
- We could further generify the issue handling of Actions by having them implement some kind of IssueAware interface and have an interceptor of the filter stack read the request parameters and insert the Issue into the action. This could also have a PermissionException injector method as well if the user cannot see an issue. (Please ask Scott for further information, as this is his idea).
- The trackback info is the wrinkle edge-case, we do actually have to provide some issue info in the trackback rdf if enabled.

Final caveat: The permission error page actually DOES HAVE TO HAVE the issue summary in it (if incoming trackbacks are turned on) in the trackback RDF. This currently works if the permissionviolation.jsp is the result (which it is for ViewIssue). We probably need to have a separate TrackbackIssueInfo object that the Issue can give us that is filtered through a trackback policy filter. Then we can have a trackback policy for enabling/disabling trackbacks based on their security (for instance allow trackbacks for public issues only, rinse issue summary from non public issues etc.)
column4: Clean up Permission Violation error reporting for all issue operations

column3: The way synchonization is implemented in the CombindedCachingServlet can hang the system under heavy load, this happened with jboss.jira.com. The JBoss people have submitted a reasonable looking patch attached to https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-6090. We need to incorperate this change into the atlassian-cache-servlet project and include that new version in JIRA. Confluence should also get this change.
column4: The CombinedCachingServlet can become a bottleneck under heavy load

column3:
Currently Tomcat re-use their output buffers (ostensibly for performance), but if you serve a large amount of HTML (say 10MB) the buffers sit around forever, and don't get cleaned up.  Note that Orion also has this problem.

There is a flag "org.apache.jasper.runtime.BodyContentImpl.LIMIT_BUFFER" that you can set which limits this.  We should set it in the standalone versions, and also let people to know to set it in their own Tomcat instances.

If you are using Tomcat you *must* set the following in your java options:
{noformat}
-Dorg.apache.jasper.runtime.BodyContentImpl.LIMIT_BUFFER=true
{noformat}

Note that this option is only available for Tomcat 5.5.15 and above. All earlier Tomcat 5 builds are susceptible to this problem and should be upgraded.

In JIRA Standalone this is set in the bin/setenv.sh or bin/setenv.bat by default.

If you do not set this you will get OutOfMemoryErrors.
column4: Set tomcat flag to not re-use buffers, as they result in OutOfMemoryErrors

column3:
Need to investigate the _ejb_location_ setting within the app server configurations.

At present, using Orion 2.0.2 and MS SQL Server, with the _ejb_location_ setting configured in the _data-sources.xml_, results in errors regarding attempts to commit a transaction while in *auto_commit* mode. 

This problem can be replicated while attempting a workflow migration (a JIRA managed transactional operation).

Need to investigate this setting on the other App Servers (e.g. Tomcat, Resin) and databases (e.g. Postgres, HSQL).

Also, investigate the need to set *auto_commit* to false while executing JIRA transactional operations - or does Ofbiz do this automatically.
column4: Investigate ejb_location setting within App Server configuration

column3:
We have two projects that share a common custom field (cascading select) between them. Each project has a distinct context for the field. When we move an issue from one project to another, the "Move Issues" screen doesn't pop up the shared field as one that needs to be updated as part of the move process. As a result, the moved issue now appears in the new project with an invalid, left over from the original project value. My users have to remember to go back and edit the moved issue after the fact to update the shared field's value to be valid in the new project.

For example, 
*Cascading SelectA*
Context: Project A, All issues types
Options a-1, b-1, c-1

Context Project B, All issue types
Options: x-1, y-1, z-1

The cascading select field has different contexts for each project.  The problem is that when I move an issue from Project A with a value of "a-1" to project B, it retains the value of "a-1" and I'm never prompted to map it to the values appropriate to project B. 

This is a fairly serious problem because we define work queues in our different divisions based on this cascading select.  If an issue is moved from one project to another with an invalid value in this custom field, it is, in effect, invisible to the folks in the destination and will languish.
column4: Cascading select custom field doesn't pop up in the "Move Issue" screen if the field has a context in source and destination projects.

column3:
Need to add documentation discussing DB connection pool size and possible effects this setting may have.

[JRA-10006|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-10006] disusses increasing the *maxActive* setting in the shipped server.xml files and notes possible results of having this connection set too low. 

By default, Tomcat configures the *maxActive* setting to be 8.
column4: Docs: Add documentation on DB connection pool size

column3:
Tomcat defaults the maximum number of DB connections in the pool - *maxActive* - to 8.

This should be increased in our included server.xml file to allow for more concurrent connections to the DB - perhaps 20.

Lack of connections can result in various problems:

* system hangs - if JIRA locks waiting for another connection to become available 

Further documentation on this setting is available at:

http://jakarta.apache.org/commons/dbcp/configuration.html

Example server.xml entry:

{code}
<Resource url="jdbc:jtds:sqlserver://192.168.0.89:1433/polycom" 
password="jira" 
name="jdbc/JiraDS" 
driverClassName="net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.Driver" 
type="javax.sql.DataSource" 
auth="Container"
username="jira"
maxActive="20">
</Resource>
{code}
column4: Tomcat Config: Increase *maxActive* database pool connection limit

column3:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-9979].
  {panel}

Currently the support system has 486k notificationinstances in JIRA's support system.  There is no way currently to clean them up easily.

If we can add a 'created' column to the notificationinstance table, then we can periodically remove ones that aren't relevant anymore.

For the old ones, can we have an upgrade task that sets the created date to be either the date of upgrade, or the date of update of the issue?

h3. Notes

Please refer to [Preparing for JIRA 5.2|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Preparing+for+JIRA+5.2] for a thorough explanation about how the changes within this improvement request affect JIRA and the way it now handles mail.
column4: NotificationInstance's should have a creation date, and a service to clean them up

column3:
We have workflow transitions with a simple Update PostFunction that changes the AssignTo field to auto-assign the issue to a particular user.

We just upgraded from 3.3 to 3.6 and I noticed the poplist with available users has changed. I mean the poplist that is presented when editiing the PostFunction of the workflow step.

In 3.3 it used to show all users, now in 3.6 it only shows assignable users for the projects the current user is also assignable for. 

The workflow I'm editing is specific for a single project in our JIRA installation. The Jira administrator is NOT an assignable user for that project. This means that the assignable users for that project are not shown in the poplist.

I now have to make the Jira administrator an assignable user, which is not what I want to do :-(
column4: Update workflow PostFunction does not show all users

column3: I really like the quick-add method of adding sub-tasks using the form on the parent issue display screen.  The only downside is that when I try to set the assignee using the dropdown provided, it never works.  The subtask always gets assigned to the project lead (the default behavior for newly created issues in that project).

column3:
When there is a lock timeout,  while trying to fetch the project to get the next counter, the issue is still created but with a NULL key.
Issue should not be created.


Doing a Bulk Delete (with attachments turned off) will delete the issue.

Create preset filter "most linked issues".
Assign due date of issue the same as fix version of release date.

In the error message below, "woth" should be "with".  Don't worry about the underlying error -- it's valid.  I was trying to set the issue to unassigned in a workflow step and apparently "0" does not mean unassigned -- bad guess.

column3:
While migrating Issue Tracking data from an old system to JIRA, I noticed that issues that had multiple components specified ended up having no components in JIRA.  For example, consider the following jelly:

{code:xml}
<jira:CreateIssue project-key="MYP" issueType="Improvement" summary="A big issue" priority="Major" components="A,B,C" assignee="awhitford"
reporter="awhitford" description="You know" created="2004-06-27 16:41:21.0" updated="2006-01-04 15:25:03.0"
issueIdVar="myIssueID" issueKeyVar="myIssueKey"/>
{code}

Despite the attribute called *components* (_plural_), it only seems to work if I only mention _one_ component.  From browsing the source code, it would appear that it is not sophisticatd enough to detect the string as a list and parse it into an array or collection.  Unfortunately, the consequence is that multiple components may not be specified meaning that a manual procedure to "fix up" the data is necessary.
column4: jira:CreateIssue via Jelly does not allow specifying multiple components

column3:
When unarchiving the jira .tar.gz file  on Mac OS X, the following error is displayed:

"A lone zero block at 81968"

A quick web search suggests that the archive file is not terminated correctly.

The problem doesn't appear to be causing any problems with installation however.
column4: Error unarchiving Jira on Mac OS X

column3: The problem might also be occuring on startup. However, this is difficult to reproduce.
column4: If a service is updated while it is running 2 services could be kicked off

column3:
We are using the excel export feature a lot. The reports we get out of the previous version from JIRA (JIRA 3.0.3 Professional) are rendered perfect and could be used as it was.
After our upgrade to JIRA 3.5 professional the excel exports became worse. The layout is terrible and cannot be used without a lot of manual formating.

I attach two excel sheets which displays the layout with version 3.0.3 (perfect-layout.xls) and with version 3.5 (broken-layout.xls).

Our expectation is that the new Jira version will at least deliver the same excel export format we used to have from the pervious version.
column4: Excel export layout became worse with the new JIRA version
Integrity checker should validate uniqueness of IDs across OSCurrentStep and OSHistoryStep.

column3:
We had to disable the google-summary module (which we like, BTW) because issues with quotes in the summary result in a malformed page that won't display in IE.

I put quotes in the summary so that you can test the issue... :)

column3:
From JIRA support

The 2 links on the front login page are going to 2 different locations

| Login  or Sign Up | /jira/secure/Signup!default.jspa |
| Not a member? Signup for an account. | /jira/secure/Administrators.jspa |

While running in private mode they're not needed and really perhaps shouldn't be shown. If the idea is to point them to the admins and get them to create the account, there should be some text clarifying this.

column3:
We had a user that was created by the CreateOrComment mail handler.  Since the handler sets the username of the user to be the email address and we use LDAP authentication, we later decided we needed to delete that user and re-add it with the username that matches his LDAP user.  I reassigned the issue that had been created along with the orignal user and changed the reporter to myself, so I could delete the user.  I then deleted the user.  

It so happens that there was a .vcf file attached to the original email and JIRA had dutifully attached it to the issue.  I discovered that, after deleting the user, every time the issue was viewed, errors were being written to the log.  Deleting the attachment fixed the problem.  

The functionality of JIRA appears to have been unaffected by this issue.  All the same, it seems that there are some vestigial connections to the deleted user that should be addressed at some point.  

Below are the log entries that were generated when I viewed the issue with the offending attachment and then deleted the attachment.

2006-03-01 13:05:11,025 WARN [jira.issue.managers.DefaultAttachmentManager] Trying to delete non-existent attachment: [/tmp/jira/attachments/HDT/HDT-4/10000_donthorpe.vcf] ..ignoring
column4: Deleting a user can leave traces of the user that will cause errors and warnings in the logs

column3:
Certain methods dosn't seem to work with Python. Users have reported errors when running:

# addPermissionTo
# createProject
# deletePermissionFrom
# updateProject

You get errors like 

{code}
SOAPpy.Types.faultType: <Fault soapenv:Server.userException: org.xml.sax.SAXException: Invalid eleme
nt in com.atlassian.jira.rpc.soap.beans.RemoteEntity - name: <SOAPpy.Types.structType detail at 2208
2304>: {'hostname': 'JIRASERVERONE', 'faultData': <SOAPpy.Types.structType faultData at 22082504>: {
'exception': None, 'message': 'Invalid element in com.atlassian.jira.rpc.soap.beans.RemoteEntity - n
ame'}}>
{code}

and 

{code}
org.xml.sax.SAXException: Invalid element in com.atlassian.jira.rpc.soap.beans.RemoteEntity - users
{code}

We'll need to setup a Python Environment and see if we can figure something out.
column4: Certain SOAP methods dosn't seem to work with Python

column3: The outward description example text is the same as the inward description example text (e.g. "is duplicated by"). The text should be: e.g. "duplicates".
column4: Minor typo in Edit Link Type outward description example text

column3:
Clarified "Updated" date searches as "Last Updated" searches. This can be confusing for some people.

http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?forumID=46&threadID=10091

We _could_ change the "Updated" to "Last Updated" but that may make the GUI a more clunky. If that looks bad, then it might be best to just update the tooltip.
column4: Clarify "Updated" date searches as "Last Updated" searches

column3:
There are missing parameters in explanation strings (see underlined {0} in the screenshot). 

Also, there are two identical explanation about "unassigned issues" with different numbers; i think, there could be "projects" in second string.
column4: Wrong explanations when editing general configuration.

column3:
We have around 1800 users in our Jira installation.

When using the "Send email" function to send them all an email the email is rejected by our SMTP server because the header is greater than 32k.

To enable us to use the "Send email" feature which is very useful, it would be useful if the emailer would send several email to batches of (e.g.) 500 users so that the header limit was not breached.
column4: Send email can fail with large number of users due to mail header size
Fix TestImportExport functional test

column3:
View issue screen with subtasks has erroneous HTML (maybe tags aren't closed properly). This *can* cause strange HTML redraw problems in picky browsers (e.g. the quick search bar was doing this in Opera for quite a while)


If you install the [HTML Validator extension|http://users.skynet.be/mgueury/mozilla/] in FireFox, you should see this
column4: View issue screen with subtasks has erroneous HTML
Due date field cannot be set through RPC under non-English locale

column3: When selecting the add comment screen, the description of the comment field is not translated to German (see attached screenshot, below "Kommentar hinzufügen").
column4: German localization: The comment field description is not translated

column3: As we are so used to using Alt-N and Alt-P to navigate an issue result list, having a shortcut for Return to Search would also be helpful. Since so many issues are wider than the screen width, using the shortcuts avoids a lot of scrolling, but the Return to Search is not available. Would you be able to find a shortcut key that might be available for all browsers?
column4: Add keyboard shortcut for "Return to Search"
Bash syntax in shell script setenv.sh

column3: Create a custom field of type "Date Time" and one of type "Date Picker" and make them accessable in a screen.\r\nSelect a date in both fields. On the same client: one field produces "9/Jan/2006 02:03 PM", the other "9-Jan-2006" (note: slash versus hyphen).
column4: Change the format of the Date Time and Date Picker fields to be consistent

column3:
To reproduce:

1. Add the 'Update Issue Field' post function to the create issue transition within a workflow. Set the assignee to be a specific user.
2. Move the post function to be executed after the issue has been created within the post function execution order.

Once an issue is created through this workflow, the issue appears with the incorrect assignee within the 'View Issue' screen.
However, the issue is displayed with the correct assignee within the issue navigator. Re-indexing does not resolve this issue.
column4: 'Update Issue Field' post function on assignee field results in inconsistent results when added to 'Create Issue' transition.

column3: At the moment the Generic Event notification (and hence the e-mail that is sent out) is used only in Workflow Transitions. The e-mail notification should contain the status change as it is unclear what happened to the issue.\r\n\r\nNeed to ensure that the html and text templates are updated.
column4: Add Status to the Generic Event template

column3:
At the moment each table of the Version Workload report does not have a total for each issue type and the overall total.

The total needs to be added at the bottom of each report table.
column4: Add totals row for Version Workload report

column3: When you call the getIssue remote service the assignee and reporter names in the RemoteIssue are full namesIn contrast, the createIssue service requires you to populate the RemoteIssue with userids (as the full name is not unique).  Would it be possible to make these two services consistent?  Remote clients can always look up the full username from the ID.
column4: SOAP service getIssue returns full usernames instead of user ids

column3:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-8966].
  {panel}

There are a few general configuration properties that influence the operations and values that are allowable when calling the remote interface.  Examples of such properties are:
* Allow users to vote on issues
* Allow users to watch issues
* Allow unassigned issues

I need to know the value of these properties to correctly show/hide various actions.

A service that returned name/value pairs would be sufficient.
column4: SOAP service to list general configuration properties

column3:
if you enter an invalid issue key (e.g. 98765) into the Quick Search, you get an error in I.E.:
Line:  40
Char: 7
Error: 'Calendar._TT.WEEKEND' is null or not an object
Code:0

column3: Adding "Current Assignee" to the Browse permission for a project lets any user of the system see that project (they can't necessarily view issues or create issues, but they can see the project).
column4: "Current Assignee" on Browse Permission creates security hole

column3: Try creating a "Visible to" multi-user picker custom field, and allow only this custom field's users to "Browse" issues in the permission scheme. One can no longer view issues in affected projects, even if you are in the "Visible to" custom field for some issues.
column4: Granting User Custom Field "Browse" permission has no effect

column3:
To replicate:

# Create a "Visible to:" multi-user picker custom field
# Create an issue-level security scheme
# Create a security level, and add the "Visible to" custom field as a member to that level
# Set a project to use the security scheme and level
# Create an issue, and add your own username to the "Visible to" field

The issue will be visible to you (and no-one else) when accessed directly. However when searching, this issue will not show up for you.
column4: User Picker custom field used in Security Level makes issues invisible to searchers

column4: List of available objects in the Velocity context for Email template

column3: When switching to a foreign locale, the View Preferences and Edit Preferences pages show an English window title, whereas most (or all) of the other pages I visited had their titles match the foreign language display.

column3:
I noticed that in 3.4 you change the footer to:
Powered by Atlassian JIRA the Professional Issue Tracker. (Enterprise Edition, Version: 3.4.2-#108) - Bug/feature request 
by changing includes\decorators ooter.jsp
But the logout page and Contact Administrators page still has the old wording:
Powered by Atlassian JIRA (Enterprise Edition, Version: 3.4.2-#108) - Bug/feature request
probably because you forgot to also change decorators rontpage.jsp
column4: Footer message inconsistent on logout

column3: If the Issue Navigator list contains several pages of issues, and you happen to be positioned anywhere other than the first page, when you export to Excel it only exports a partial list of the issues - from the page you're on and beyond.  So, for example, if there are 4 pages of issues and you're sitting on page 3, the Excel file will only contain the issues that appear on pages 3 and 4 within Issue Navigator.  \r\n\r\nExport to Excel should always give you the complete list, even if you're on page 3 of 4.
column4: Export to Excel doesn't export all records unless you are on Page 1
Add documentation on Bulk Workflow Transition functionality.

column3: When i rename a filter and only change the case of a character (e.g. from uppercase to lowercase), JIRA tells me that the renaiming failed because a filter with the same name does exist already.\r\n\r\nof course, it is trivial to workaround this, but it should also not be that complex to fix it :-)
column4: renaiming a filter fails

column3: A lot of customers would like to extend e-mail notifications to display custom field values, however the custom field manager object is not placed into the Velocity params. Hence it is not possible to get to custom field values easily without editing JIRA's source.
column4: Include custom field manager in Velocity context for notifications

column3:
Cookies are scoped by host (eg. 'jira.atlassian.com') and path (eg. '/' or '/jira'). JIRA's UI-oriented cookies (set in issue navigator and admin section) are only scoped by host. This causes two problems:

 - All 13+ JIRA cookies are sent to other applications on the same host (Confluence?), quite likely pushing the user's browser over the [20-cookie limit|http://support.microsoft.com/default.aspx?scid=kb;EN-US;306070] causing odd breakages.
 - You can't have two parallel JIRA servers without their cookie-based preferences interfering.
column4: JIRA cookies aren't scoped by path, so break other webapps on the server

column3: In 3.2 External User Management was split up into External Password Management and External User Management. The difference between the 2 can be confusing so the docs need to be updated to explain this.
column4: Upgrade "Configuring Jira" documentation

column3: When clicking the printable icon in the top-right corner of the View Issue page the resultant view should not have the JIRA toolbar (with Home, Find Issue  links, etc).
column4: On Orion the printable decorator of an issue does not remove the toolbar
Improve the Bulk Delete Operation

column3: Jira should always default to english if an existing locale cannot be found. This will avoid problems like in JRA-8667, where jira is using the Ukrainian locale that is not supported. The 'None' option should also be removed in the Default Locale in General Configurations.\r\n\r\nHowever jira should still default to system when jira is in setup. The only difference is that if no language pack is found then English is chosen instead of 'None'.
column4: Date picker date format incorrect when server language is not English

column3:
JIRA sets cookies to 'remember' the state of some screens, e.g. the state of sections on Issue Navigator and the right-hand menu of the Administration section. There is a limitation of the number of cookies that a web browser will send to a particular server (URL). Hence we need to restrict the amount of cookies set.

There are several options to investigate:
- see if we can unify some cookies into one and encode the information in one cookie
- see if we can restrict a cookies only to certain URLs (all cookies do not need to be sent for each JIRA URL)
- as some cookies are only used by JS and do not need to be sent, we can try restricting a cookie to a URL in JIRA that does not exis, to stop the browser from sending the cookies. In this case need to ensure that JS can still access these cookies.
column4: Jira sets too many cookies

column3:
When no project is selected, all statuses are displayed in the Issue Navigator's Status multi-select box.

Only those associated with an Active Workflow should be displayed.

When projects are selected, only Statuses from associated workflows should be displayed (it already does this).

We will have a look at this for 3.4.2 but it may be quite a lot of work.
column4: Issue Navigator should only display available statuses when no project selected

column3:
Currently, when viewing the dashboard, the user is presented with a warning message "Need to be logged in' in order to view particular portlets.

This looks ugly and clutters the dashboard - these portlets should be hidden quietly.
column4: Do not show portlet 'Need to be logged in' message when viewing dashboard.

column3:
The original estimate, Time Spent and remaining estimate fields constitue a great feature of Jira. However, it should be possible to customize the way it displays in the web interface and in various exports (excel).

Examples for us: we need to know the number of days/m that need to be spent on a particular issue. The current patern is confusing (need to translate weeks into days, etc). Best would be something like 24,5 days (exported as 24,5 in excel) instead of 4 weeeks 4 days and 4 hours.

The best would be to be able to configure a pattern in some configuration file.

If I could this by myself from the source, please let me know. We use 3.4.1 Enterprise Edition.
column4: TimeTracking format should be configurable

column3: It would often be useful to be able to package images like icons inside a plugin.  AFAIK it isn't currently possible.
column4: Allow images in plugins

column3: It's possible to customize which events that will trigger an e-mail notification, but it's not possible to turn off e-mail sending when a Jira account is created. \r\n\r\nThe admin tool should have an option tu turn off this e-mail notification.
column4: Turning off mail generation when account is created

column3: If I do a search on "export data"~3 in summary, I should see issues where the summary has the word data within 3 (maybe 4) words of export. However, it finds issue JRA-7470 whose summary has 4 words in between export and data.\r\nAlso, on a related note, even though I don't specify wildcards, it appears that wildcards are implied. Otherwise, why does that search also find JRA-6121 (Cannot reload exported XML data) and JRA-2066 (Invalid XML characters when exporting data)
column4: search not performing as per documented syntax

column3: The JIRA Webapp edition auto-generates a jira.xml file valid for Tomcat 4.1 and 5.0.  It isn't valid for Tomcat 5.5.  To avoid confusion we should generate both a tomcat5.0/jira.xml and tomcat5.5/jira.xml
column4: Generate a Tomcat 5.5-compatible jira.xml

column3:
It appears that Axis does not provide any SOAP endpoints when JIRA is run behind https.  When one requests /rpc/soap, eg:

https://support.atlassian.com/rpc/soap/exec sp_prepexec @P1 output, N'@P1 bigint,@P2 bigint,@P3 nvarchar(4000),@P4 nvarchar(4000),@P5 nvarchar(4000),@P6 nvarchar(4000),@P7 datetime,@P8 decimal(38,0)', N'INSERT INTO jiraaction (ID, issueid, AUTHOR, actiontype, actionlevel, actionbody, CREATED, actionnum) VALUES (@P1 , @P2 , @P3 , @P4 , @P5 , @P6 , @P7 , @P8 )', 12823, 10549, N'neala', N'comment', NULL, N'The main problem is that ''smart'' quotes are really "dumb" because only MS Word knows about them.', 'Dec 31 2005 1:53:17:257PM', NULL



One gets back:

"""
And now... Some Services

    * null (wsdl)
"""

instead of the usual:

"""
And now... Some Services

    * null (wsdl)
          o getUser
          o createUser
          o getComponents
          o createGroup
          o getGroup
          o login
          o getServerInfo
          o updateGroup
"""

The WSDL is correspondingly empty.
column4: SOAP does not work over HTTPS / SSL on certain configurations

column3:
Dear JIRA support,

actually we would like to add a log file rotation for all the output, what is normally print our in the console.
For this, we added at the moment in the "catalina.sh" the following line:

  touch "$CATALINA_BASE"/logs/catalina.out
  if [ "$1" = "-security" ] ; then
    echo "Using Security Manager"
    shift
    "$_RUNJAVA" -Xms256m  -Xmx512m $JAVA_OPTS -Djava.awt.headless=true -Dorg.apache.commons.logging.Log=org.apache.commons.logging.impl.SimpleLog -Dorg.apache.commons.logging.sim
plelog.log.org.enhydra.jdbc.xapool=warn $CATALINA_OPTS \n      -Djava.endorsed.dirs="$JAVA_ENDORSED_DIRS" -classpath "$CLASSPATH" \n      -Djava.security.manager \n      -Djava.security.policy=="$CATALINA_BASE"/conf/catalina.policy \n      -Dcatalina.base="$CATALINA_BASE" \n      -Dcatalina.home="$CATALINA_HOME" \n      -Djava.io.tmpdir="$CATALINA_TMPDIR" \n      org.apache.catalina.startup.Bootstrap "$@" start \n      >> "$CATALINA_BASE"/logs/catalina.out 2>&1 &

      if [ ! -z "$CATALINA_PID" ]; then
        echo $! > $CATALINA_PID
      fi      
  else

Do you have a better solution?

Kind regards,
Thomas Lingenfelder

IT Entwicklung & Systemintegration
ING-DiBa AG
Theodor-Heuss-Allee 106
60486 Frankfurt am Main

Telefon	069 / 27 222 6869
Telefax  069 / 27 222 6910
T.Lingenfelder@ing-diba.de
www.ing-diba.de

column3:
When a user creates an issue in a project that they do not have permission to see (either through security levels or permission scheme settings), the user is currently directed to a 'Permission Violation' page.

This can lead to ambiguity - has the issue been successfully created or not?

Probably best to redirect the user to a page confirming issue creation but noting that the issue cannot be viewed due to the security/permission settings.
column4: Redirect the user to a suitable page after user creates an issue that they cannot view

column3:
At the moment the CSV Documentation does not explain field mappings very well. Especially with the 'Import as Blank' Option.

From a support email:
"When importing the CSV file containing our defect data, I populated the
resolution field incorrectly.  When I mapped our string resolutions (fixed,
cancelled, etc) with the pull down list in the importer, I left the items
that I wanted to keep open as "No Mapping" instead of "Enter as Blank".
This caused problems in the database because the items that I had mapped
were entered as their numerical ID for the status, and the items I had
selected as "No Mapping" had their strings in the table instead of the
blank I had wanted.  On the list of issues, these issues with incorrect
resolutions were listed as "UNRESOLVED", however they did not appear in any
of the "Open Issue" lists.  When I went back and reimported the data with
the "Enter as Blank" everything worked fine."
column4: Improve doc on mapping field values for CSV

column3: We are going to downgrade our licence from Professional to Standard. We are currently using only one feature of Professional: sub-tasks. Is it possible to convert them into regular tasks, for example by editing backup xml file before data migration? \n\nStandard version doesn't have sub-tasks, so it is not possible search this issues according to its type.
column4: How to transform sub-tasks to tasks when downgrading from Professional to Standard?

On startup , tomcat reports a Java exception : 

> bin/catalina.sh run
Using CATALINA_BASE:   /home/jira/jira/jakarta-tomcat-4.1.31
Using CATALINA_HOME:   /home/jira/jira/jakarta-tomcat-4.1.31
Using CATALINA_TMPDIR: /home/jira/jira/jakarta-tomcat-4.1.31/temp
Using JAVA_HOME:       /usr/lib/java
[INFO] Http11Protocol - -Initializing Coyote HTTP/1.1 on http-8443
Starting service Jira
Apache Tomcat/4.1.31
[INFO] PropertyMessageResources - -Initializing, config='org.apache.struts.util.LocalStrings', returnNull=true
[INFO] PropertyMessageResources - -Initializing, config='org.apache.struts.action.ActionResources', returnNull=true
[INFO] PropertyMessageResources - -Initializing, config='org.apache.webapp.admin.ApplicationResources', returnNull=true
[INFO] StdSchedulerFactory - -Quartz scheduler 'JiraQuartzScheduler' initialized from default resource file in Quartz package: 'quartz.properties'
[INFO] StdSchedulerFactory - -Quartz scheduler version: 1.0.7
[INFO] QuartzScheduler - -Scheduler JiraQuartzScheduler_$_NON_CLUSTERED started.
[Filter: profiling] Using parameter [jira_profile]
[Filter: profiling] defaulting to off [autostart=false]
[Filter: profiling] Turning filter off [jira_profile=off]
[WARN] ServletDispatcher - -Unable to find 'webwork.multipart.saveDir' property setting. Defaulting to javax.servlet.context.tempdir
[INFO] ServletDispatcher - -Action dispatcher initialized
[INFO] Http11Protocol - -Starting Coyote HTTP/1.1 on http-8443
2005-04-14 10:39:01,917 WARN [service.services.export.ExportService] Exception running export service: Error in action: com.atlassian.jira.action.admin.DataExport@23551c, result: null: Stream closed
java.io.IOException: Stream closed
        at java.util.zip.ZipOutputStream.ensureOpen(ZipOutputStream.java:41)
        at java.util.zip.ZipOutputStream.finish(ZipOutputStream.java:281)
        at java.util.zip.DeflaterOutputStream.close(DeflaterOutputStream.java:131)
        at java.util.zip.ZipOutputStream.close(ZipOutputStream.java:307)
        at com.atlassian.jira.action.admin.DataExport.execute(DataExport.java:209)
        at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:131)
        at com.atlassian.core.action.DefaultActionDispatcher.execute(DefaultActionDispatcher.java:34)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.services.export.ExportService.run(ExportService.java:90)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.JiraServiceContainer.run(JiraServiceContainer.java:53)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.ServiceRunner.execute(ServiceRunner.java:50)
        at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:147)
        at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:387)
rethrown as
com.atlassian.core.AtlassianCoreException: Error in action: com.atlassian.jira.action.admin.DataExport@23551c, result: null: Stream closed
        at com.atlassian.core.action.ActionUtils.checkForErrors(ActionUtils.java:49)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.services.export.ExportService.run(ExportService.java:91)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.JiraServiceContainer.run(JiraServiceContainer.java:53)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.ServiceRunner.execute(ServiceRunner.java:50)
        at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:147)
        at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:387)



The exception is thrown due to a call to java.util.zip.ZipOutputStream.close() at com.atlassian.jira.action.admin.DataExport.execute(DataExport.java:209) . 
According to Sun Java documentation (http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4.2/docs/api/java/io/PrintWriter.html#close()) , the stream has already been closed by the previous call to java.io.PrintWriter.close() at line 207 . 
The exception is not caught at this level (lines 210 or 213 , resp.) , so it appears on the screen . 

The file is closed correctly by line 207 , so I assume the backup _file_ can be used . 
The call to .getResult() (l. 212) is not executed , so the backup _task_ is not completed . 

Possible solution : One could catch the exception on line immediately , on l. 210 .
column4: Double Close in com.atlassian.jira.action.admin.DataExport

column3:
I have created a filter with criteria: "Assigned to: specific-group: A"

After that I have created a two-dimensional portlet: columns had asignees, rows had priorities.

When clicking on the name of assignee, I get back a list of issues assigned to group, *NOT THE USER* since the query built looks like this:

http://jira/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?...&assigneeSelect=specificgroup&assignee=XXXX&...&assigneeSelect=specificuser&assignee=YYY

instead of:

http://jira/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?...&assigneeSelect=specificuser&assignee=YYY

better yet, issue navigator should parse the string and take the *LAST* not the first parameter, something like:

String[] vals = request.getParameterValues("assignee");
String assignee = vals[vals.length-1];
column4: Two dimensional filter not working corrently when using filter by specific group and displaying Assignees and clicking the asignee

column3:
As I already informed in issue JRA-6196, there's an error in the Filter Statistic portlet, and it is not fixed in 3.1.1 (despite this is what supposed to do, as you said in JRA-6196).

The description of the problem is the following:

If you create a filter using an specific field (status, for example), and then use the portlets Statistics or TwoDimensionalStatistic to show this filter using the same field you chose to create filter, the information the portlet shows is right, but when you click in one of the links (anyone of the statuses, in the example), it will show you not only that status, but ALL of them.

This is an example of the URI that fails:

/jira/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&statusIds=1&statusIds=3&statusIds=10000&statusIds=10003&statusIds=10004&statusIds=10005&assigneeSelect=issue_current_user&statusIds=10005

As you can see, an "&statusIds=10005" is added at the end of the URL because of the status you clicked in, but it has no effect due to the other "statusIds" at the beggining of the URI (the ones which belongs to the filter itself, that in this case should be removed).

I hope to explain myself good enough, english is not my first tongue and is difficult to me to express things exactly.

Regards,

Andrés.
column4: Filter Statistic Error
Update XML-RPC/SOAP docs
Document new features in 3.2

column3:
The Excel report does not contain any reference to linked or sub- tasks when an export is made.  This is annoying as it does not accurately reflect the current state of issue.

Please aadvise how we can add functionality to ensure that the "sub-task" field is viewed and can be populated in JIRA.  Similarly, for linked tasks, it would be highly useful to have a list of linked tasks included in the Excel output
column4: Show subtasks in excel view

column3:
Consider the following scenario.  (This is exactly what happened to us and not a contrived scenario)

JIRA is installed in a production location and everything is just peachy.

A new release of JIRA is available and so it is installed in a sandbox area for test driving purposes.  Data for this sandbox instance is obtained from the aforementioned production instance, i.e. you export from production and import into the sandbox.

A big error has crept in!

The data in the JIRA tables includes the location of the backups, attachments and indices.  So, unwittingly, the sandbox instance is pointing at the same location as production for backups, attachments and indexes.

You notice this and proceed to update the index location for the sandbox instance to a sandbox location.

Gradually the users are increasingly insistent that JIRA (on production) isn't working.  Filters are throwing exceptions and the like.

You start piecing together apparently disconnected information and deduce the cause:
The reason for this is that when you changed the location of the index in the sandbox instance, JIRA-sandbox first blew away the indexes at the old location before creating it at the new location.  AAAARRRRGGGHHH!

Now, the title of this issue should make sense.
column4: Ability to change index location without clobbering old location

column3:
If I create a new custom field, let's name it "A" with options "1", "2", "3", and "4", I have no way of searching for issues like this:

"All issues which have A with either '1', '2' or '3'"
"All issues where A is not set (is null)"

Now I can only search:
"Issues where A IS 1"
"Issues where A IS 2"
"Issues where A IS 3"
"Issues where A IS 4"
"Issues where A IS ANY"

"Reported By" or "Assignee", the following javascript error appears:

The combo changes, though, but the user input field stays grayed out, so you cannot choose the user.


This used to work in 3.0.3 and stopped working when we upgraded to 3.1.

If you are planning to have this fixed only in 3.2, please tell us at least how to fix it by ourselves.

column3:
When using custom fields, left pane gets extremely wide if you have a custom field that has longer description.

The problem lies in the ugly HTML that says:

[...snip...]
<td nowrap>
[.../snip...]

That way the text does not break into multiple lines and you get a really wide (3/4 of screen, depends on the lenght of your description) left pane and there's almost no room left for the actual isues.

Quick fix: add this CSS:

.subText {
        word-wrap: normal;           /* Internet Explorer */
        white-space: normal;         /* Firefox */
        white-space: -moz-pre-wrap;  /* Other Mozilla, since 1999 */
        white-space: pre-wrap;       /* css-3 */
        white-space: -pre-wrap;      /* Opera 4-6 */
        white-space: -o-pre-wrap;    /* Opera 7 */
        display: block;
}

This allows the description to wrap.


Actual fix would be to tidy up the HTML of the whole Jira and maybe even make it XHTML 1.0 compliant...
column4: Left pane in "Find issues" is waaay to wide with custom fields having long descriptions

There is a missing negation in the german translation of "You cannot vote or change your vote on resolved issues" (in closed issues):

"Sie können für gelöste Vorgänge stimmen oder Ihre Stimme zurückziehen."
           ^
I suggest the following:

"Sie können nicht für gelöste Vorgänge stimmen oder Ihre Stimme zurückziehen."
or
"Sie können für gelöste Vorgänge Ihre Stimme weder abgegeben noch zurückziehen."

http://www.jetbrains.net/jira/browse/IDEADEV-28

column3:
Customer wants to have a comment for each issue in the "Release Notes".

The release notes are currently just a list of resolved issues (actually only the subject of the issues). If we could have a note for each issue, the release notes would be a much more useful document.

When resolving an issue, the developer usually enters a comment with important information about the fix.

If JIRA would display this particular comment in the release notes, it would be a useful and practical improvement that should not take too much effort. Maybe JIRA could display a checkbox to include/not include the comment into the release notes.
column4: Add comment to Release Notes entry

column3: For example, desription of Environment at secure/CreateIssue.jspa. I have JIRA default locale set to Russia, my own profile is English (due to bug in calendar) and it displays description in Russian, but other text is in English.\n
column4: Translate field descriptions to multiple languages

column3:
I suspect there is a bug in the code that upgrades the DB from older releases of Jira to 3.03. To my recollection, I have updated twice up to 3.03 but I don't recall the exact details.

I have recently upgraded to MySQL 4.1.9 and I noticed this in my Tomcat logs the next time I restarted:

[core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] WARNING: Column "AUTHOR" of table "jiraaction" of entity "Action" has a column size of "85" in the database, but is defined to have a column size of "255" in the entity definition.
[...]

I get this warning for exactly 157 different columns in different tables. I tried updating them by hand but it's taking way too long.

When Jira finds such a mismatch, there should be a way for us to tell it to automatically update the DB to reflect the entity definition. Especially if the DB size is smaller than the entity definition, it should automatically update the DB since there is no risk of data loss.

I filed this as a bug instead of a RFE because the DB should have never gotten into this bad state in the first place...
column4: Mismatch between entity definition and database

column3:
This may or may not be a bug:  One of my CVS Modules was accessing the wrong CVS Repository.  When I initially defined the CVS Module I plugged in a value for the ViewCVS URL.  However, I can't clear it out.  It points to the wrong CVS repository and the new CVS repository doesn't have ViewCVS installed/enabled.  So I changed the CVSROOT and password and tested the new repository information without incident.  I tried several times, though, to remove the URL in the ViewCVSURL field.

It does not harm having it in there.  The links generated on the Version Control tab, though, will not point to the correct files.  I'll just tell my users, for that specific project, don't click on the linked files.

--Mel
column4: Can not clear ViewCVS URL...

column3:
Hi ,
  We are facing problem while migrating from JIRA 2.6 to 3.0. 

Status of our Environment
1. Using MSSQL DB
2. We are having 121 Projects , Each project has more that 100 issues.

Problems Identified:
Thru XML backup we are not able to restore data. --( No specific error is found in catalina.out log)

Let us know the possible ways to migrate to JIRA 3.0 ASAP.

Waiting for your solutions.
Is that pointing the new JIRA 3 instance to the current DB will work with out any changes?

--Britto

Best regards , 

G.Beilhack

column3:
If I use the 'No view for transition' (e.g. remove the extra dialog page) option for the transition and the Validator check kicks-in a run-time exception occurs:

HTTP Status 404 - No view for result [error] exists for action
[WorkflowUIDispatcher]

type Status report
message No view for result [error] exists for action
[WorkflowUIDispatcher]
description The requested resource (No view for result [error] exists
for action [WorkflowUIDispatcher]) is not available.

It seams like Jira is confused where to display the validation result.

To reproduce: Simply create a validator and select 'No view for transition'
column4: Validator and 'No view for transition' causes error

column3:
I created a Custom Field with a type of "Version Picker".  Once created, I am able to create a Filter and reference this Custom Field.  However, I am not able to specify multiple values from the list of possible values for that field (i.e. there is no multi-select capability).

E.g. the Custom Field contained the values: "V1.1", "V1.2", "V1.3".  I am only able to indicate one value (e.g. "V1.1").

According to Anton Mazkovoi: "at the moment the Versions Custom Field only allows to select and search for one version value".  I understand that we can customize JIRA to do this, but I would rather see this 'built in' to the product.

Thanks!
column4: Enable multi-select on Custom Fields (of type "Version Picker") when used within Filters

column3: With Summaries like 'You forgot ', the "" is not escaped in the HTML mail.\n\nYou can see the "" in subject line of the mail, but not in the Summary line in HTML mail.
column4: Summary line in HTML mail is not properly escaped

column3: Basically I have an open bug with a summary of: "Use <composite-id> once XDoclet supports it" but when I'm in the dashboard view or other views that list multiple issues and show their summaries, the word: "<composite-id>" is swallowed up.\n\nLooks to me like you need to automatically escape these special character sequences if users use them.
column4: Can't use brackets in issue summary
Add finnish calendar

column3: Even on the very first page of the "Create New Issue" wizard, one with the "Project" and "Issue type" fields, I cannot proceed to the next page by hitting Enter.
column4: Enter Won't Work as Next in "Create Issue" Wizard Pages

column3: Many users are shooting themselves in the foot with the 'Update Issue Field' post-function.  For instance, they might try to update the 'Resolution' field value to 'Duplicate'.  This then breaks JIRA, as the 'resolution' field value *actually* has to be a foreign key ID into the resolution table.
column4: 'Update Issue Field' post-function value not checked for validity

column3:
We have several Field Layout Schemes for our project, each matching a different Issue Type. When I hide a version field ("Affects Version/s", "Fix Version/s") in ONE of our Field Layout Schemes, Roadmap and/or Change Log disapear from the Browse Project page. Also, the Find Issues page no longer shows the "Fix For:" and/or "Matches Versions:" criteria (when selecting our specific project).

I would be glad to hide these features when ALL of my Field Layout Schemes hide the version fields. However, what I expected to see was that, when only SOME of the Field Layout Schemes did hide the version fields, then these features would still be available but they would not show (or match on) the issues of types which were associated to a Field Layout Scheme hiding the version fields.

I guess from issue JRA-5304 that the same situation happens with the Component/s field.

The problem is that these fields make sense for almost all of my issue types (therefore Field Layout Shemes) but are not relevant for very specific issue types (specific kinds of Tasks and Sub-Tasks).
column4: Roadmap & Change Log disapear when ONE Field Layout hides version fields

column3: If I attach a file with a name containing german umlauts (e.g. "äöü") to an issue, I'm not able to download the attachment.\n\nOn the server the attachment is saved with a scrambled name - all umlauts are substituted by '?'. After renaming the attachment on the server to the correct name the download is working again.
column4: Attachment with german umlaut in file name can't be shown

column3:

607 

Reported Issues: 
93 

This is a big problem since it seems that I have to assign all the issues to another user one by one to be able to delete the user.

column3:
To reproduce:

1. Import one bugzilla project (A), do not check "Import only new issues".
2. Import one bugzilla project (A), check "Import only new issues".
3. Import a different bugzilla project (B), do not check "Import only new issues".
4. Import a different bugzilla project (B), check "Import only new issues".

After step 1, project A has been imported once. (check!)
After step 2, project A has been imported once. (check!)
After step 3, project B has been imported once, (check!)
          and project A has been imported twice. (noooo!)
After step 4, project B has been imported once, (check!)
          and project A has been imported twice. (check! ... sort of)

So, importing only new issues works fine, but project selection does not.  From the looks of the source, Map projectToBugzillaIdMap is initialized on line 96 once when JIRA loads.  It is used create the sql statement for issue selection (whereSelectedProjectClause()) instead of using this.selectedProjects.  Since projectToBugzillaIdMap is only initialized when BugzillaImportBean is loaded, it accumulates every project that has been selected for import.  When an import is run, the logs claim that this.selectedProjects are being imported (correct), but proceeds to import every issue in a project in projectToBugzillaIdMap.

Fix:
Initialize projectToBugzillaIdMap on every import.  (In create() maybe?)
column4: Bugzilla and Mantis import accidentally imports multiple projects

column3: I am convinced that this is a duplicate of another JIRA bug, but I can't seem to find the other one.  I needed to import work history from Bugzilla, so I patched BugzillaImportBean.java.  This is a simple patch, and does not retrieve the comment associated with the work, only the hours worked and the timestamp.  If you view the All tab, the work log entry should occur just below the comment.  This patch also sets the time estimate and time remaining - hopefully correctly. :-)\n
column4: Bugzilla import does not import Work History

column3:
Currently we don't use oscache in JIRA anymore.  We should remove it from project.xml.

From what I can tell, we also need to:

- Find and remove all usages of CacheUtils.flush() and CacheUtils.flushAll()
- Remove oscache.tld
- Remove oscache.properties

Also, in core - we should check what else uses oscache, and remove them also.  Then remove the dependency from oscore, and rev it.
column4: Remove oscache

column3:
We just migrated to JIRA 3.0.2 on Oracle.
There is a problem on the workflow : JIRA cannot import XML File sizes greater than 4000 characters.
It's due to the oracle mapping that is made on VARCHAR2(4000).

Consequently, we cannot import the XML workflows we have defined.

Do you have a quick solution for this problem ?

- While not logged in to Jira, navigate to http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/CreateIssue.jspa
- You will be presented with a screen to logon
- Logon and you will see the following exception on the create issue screen
Form Errors:
An exception occurred: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Generic Value cannot be null..

This seems to be caused because the user is redirected to the same form they tried to use without being logged in, and the info sent to the form has not been updated with their login session.

Simply clicking on 'Create New Issue' removes the form exception

column3:
annoying problem.
If description field is required then you cannot progress past step 3 as there is no way to set a description while moving an issue.

If assignee is set to 'automatic' and there are no component leads and no component lead assignees then you get stuck in step 4 if you disable unassigned issues. The prog doesn't seem to default to the project lead in this case.


the biggest problem with these scenerios is that the user is just faced with the same screen and no error message. It's difficult to determine what went wrong.



This isn't the right place, but I'm gonna mention it anyway - it'd be nice to be able to 'force' a new state for all moved issues at the admin level. To enable this in my copy I modified the com.atlassian.jira.web.action.issue.enterprise.MoveIssueUpdateWorkflow and hard-coded a string in there. But it'd be nice to do it from the admin gui.

-wc

column3:
In JIRA's text notification emails, the "Remaining Estimate" and "Time Spent" field updates are reported in seconds, rather than something more useful (hours, minutes):

----------------------------------------

           Time Worked: 4 hours
    Remaining Estimate: 252000 (was: 266400)
            Time Spent: 36000 (was: 21600)

-----------------------------
column4: Time updates in notifications are in seconds

column3: The page http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/Dashboard.jspa includes a <Log In> link in the top-right corner. Clicking this link brings you to the page http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/Dashboard.jspa?os_destination=%2Fsecure%2FDashboard.jspa, which again has a <Log In> link. Clicking this link brings you to the page http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/Dashboard.jspa?os_destination=%2Fsecure%2FDashboard.jspa%3Fos_destination%3D%252Fsecure%252FDashboard.jspa. In other words: Jira produces ever longer URLs and directs the browser to a new page each time (different URLs --> different page, as far as the browser concerns).\r\n\r\nThis issue is not a problem in day-to-day use, but it is a problem for some site crawlers: these tend to get stuck in the Jira web interface as it keeps producing new pages. This creates an unnecessary burden on sites running Jira. Hope you can fix this soon.
column4: Clicking the Log In link creates ever longer URLs

column3: When i add the "Current Reporter" to the "Browse Project" Permission of one project. This project instantly becomes visible to ALL users(via the project table portlet), if they have any kind of permission to see this project or not. \n\nSo all users can see this project, but can't see any issues within it. Thats not very good, as we want to keep our customers strictly seperated from one another and we have a lot of projects. That would be very confusing if you see lots of projects in your dashboard, but only one or two of them are relevant to you and the rest is empty.
column4: "Browse Project" permission for "Current Reporter" grants users to see projects they are not permitted to.
Send out property changes to translators

column3:
I have a problem with the datepicker. Instead of updating the date in the Slovenian locale it uses the default locale.

Explanation:

When I pick a date where the first three letters of the month in Slovenian notation  don't match with the English locale (ex. ENG: 13-Oct-2004, SLO: 13-Okt-2004), the page responses:

*********************************************************************************
You did not enter a valid date. Please enter the date in the format "d-MMM-yyyy".
Due Date: <textbox>
*********************************************************************************

Then I have to change the month, for example: Oct -> Okt

On the other side, if the first three letters of the month match in both languages,
(ex. ENG: 13-Sep-2004, SLO: 13-Sep-2004), Jira accepts it, of-course.

Do I have a wrong configuration?
column4: Update date picker calendar widget to support new languages

column3:
I have a filter with global sharing, which has a subscriber. If I delete this filter, I get this text: Deleting this filter will not alter any subscriptions, as there are 0 subscriptions associated with it. 

Which is incorrect, since there is another subscriber.

I expected that I get a warning not to delete the filter because there are subscribers.

Also, the page "View Subscriptions for ..." should list all subscriptions, not just my own, at least if I am the author of the filter.

column3: All Jelly tags involving workflow/status change need to be revisited - in order to accommodate custom workflows - eg ResolveIssue.
column4: All Jelly tags involving workflow/status change need to be revisited.

column3:
USE CASE:
Define component leads for a lot, but not all components of a Jira project.

Create an issue, select a component with a set component lead.
Do not change the Assignee field (leave it on Automatic).

EXPECTED:
The issue is assigned to the component lead user.

REAL:
The issue is assigned to the project default user.
The Default Assignee in dialog "Edit Project" is set to Project Lead and cannot be changed (see attached EditProject.jpg)

ANNOTATIONS:
Configuration: see attached file system.txt
We upgraded from 2.5.1 PE to 2.6.1 EE
Tried both scenarios: allow or disallow unassigned issues.
In the jira-manual.pdf for 2.6.1 I did not find any help on this issue.
column4: Document selecting component leads as default assignees.

column3: With the ability to create new statuses - the new status ids should not conflict with original system status ids. The new statuses should obtain ids from > 10000.
