column3:
Currently velocity generation fails if the war file is not unpacked. This is listed in issues JRA-3558, JRA-3671, JRA-3788, and also JSP-65.

This appears a problem across application servers (Tomcat, JBoss and Weblogic).

Owen had a suggestion, which doesn't seem to have been followed up on:

" I think the problem is that it is using a file system loader and not a classpath loader.
See.
  http://jakarta.apache.org/velocity/developer-guide.html#Configuring Resource Loaders

If we jar up the vm templates this should stop the errors in tomcat."

We should investigate this, and fix this problem.
column4: Velocity template generation failed

column3:
Ensure that all appropriate permissions are available on initial setup.

With the introduction of new permissions - e.g. EDIT_WATCHER_LIST - ensure that these permissions are granted to correct users/groups when JIRA is setup initially.
column4: Ensure appropriate permissions available on initial setup

column3:
The HTTP-headers of the Dashboard page and Browse pages differ, causing some proxy servers (e.g. Microsoft ISA server) to succesfully cache/update the Dashboard page, but to fail caching the browse-pages correctly (see JRA-4019 ).

Here are the liveheaders of the Dashboard page
(generated using Mozilla/Liveheaders):

http://internal:8080/secure/Dashboard.jspa

GET /secure/Dashboard.jspa HTTP/1.1
Host: internal:8080
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.7) Gecko/20040626 Firefox/0.9.1
Accept: text/xml,application/xml,application/xhtml+xml,text/html;q=0.9,text/plain;q=0.8,image/png,*/*;q=0.5
Accept-Language: en-us,en;q=0.5
Accept-Encoding: gzip,deflate
Accept-Charset: ISO-8859-1,utf-8;q=0.7,*;q=0.7
Keep-Alive: 300
Connection: keep-alive
Referer: http://internal:8080/secure/BrowseProject.jspa
Cookie: seraph.os.cookie=foo.bar; JSESSIONID=foo.bar

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store,  must-revalidate
Pragma: no-cache, no-cache
Expires: Thu, 01 Jan 1970 00:00:00 GMT, -1
Content-Type: text/html;charset=UTF-8
Transfer-Encoding: chunked
Date: Mon, 26 Jul 2004 11:20:13 GMT
Server: Apache-Coyote/1.1

--------------------------------

Here are the headers for a Browse page

http://internal:8080/browse/ISSUE-1

GET /browse/ISSUE-1 HTTP/1.1
Host: internal:8080
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.7) Gecko/20040626 Firefox/0.9.1
Accept: text/xml,application/xml,application/xhtml+xml,text/html;q=0.9,text/plain;q=0.8,image/png,*/*;q=0.5
Accept-Language: en-us,en;q=0.5
Accept-Encoding: gzip,deflate
Accept-Charset: ISO-8859-1,utf-8;q=0.7,*;q=0.7
Keep-Alive: 300
Connection: keep-alive
Referer: http://internal:8080/secure/Dashboard.jspa
Cookie: seraph.os.cookie=foo.bar; JSESSIONID=foo.bar

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: text/html;charset=UTF-8
Transfer-Encoding: chunked
Date: Mon, 26 Jul 2004 11:20:49 GMT
Server: Apache-Coyote/1.1
Pragma: no-cache
Expires: -1

--------------------------------------

Suggested improvement:

a) make the caching HTTP-headers in all Jira pages work the same

b) add "Cache-Control: no-cache, no-store,  must-revalidate" and 
"Pragma: no-cache" to response headers in Browse pages (and possible others)

c) Why does the Dashboard page gives a response header of
"Pragma: no-cache, no-cache". I assume this is a bug, and it should be "Pragma: no-cache".

d) Use "Expires: Thu, 01 Jan 1970 00:00:00 GMT, -1" instead of 
"Expires: -1" header in Browse pages.

e) Follow the HTTP/1.1 standards http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html 
and make sure it works proxy servers such as Apache and Microsoft ISA server.
column4: Change HTTP headers of browse page to prevent caching of pages

column3:
Steps:
* Change group membership in User > Edit Groups (either add or remove)
* Click on left side menu headings to expand/contract a menu category

Expected result:
Page refreshes with selected menu newly open or closed, but otherwise essentially unchanged.

Result:
Page refreshes with the following error:
----
Form Errors:
User does not exist

<< Return to viewing user ''
----
and no user selected.  It appears that the user variable gets replaced by an emptystring or a broken escape string or something similar, as instead of saying 'Return to viewing user "<user>"' it says 'Return to viewing user "' (note the single-quote).

Frst discovered when initially adding confluence-users and confluence-administrators, per http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/How+to+delegate+user+management+in+Confluence+to+JIRA, but it also happens when changing the built-in (and still-unchanged, in my new trial install) groups, jira-*.

column3: The workflow integrity checker will need to determine a suitable default workflow id/step from the current workflow of an issue during the correction process.\n\nAt present - the workflow checker is hardcoded to set the invalid issue to workflow step/id 6 - which may not exist in a custom workflow.
column4: Workflow Integrity Checker should handle custom statuses/workflows.

column3:
When requesting Release Notes from JIRA, the generated overview contains all issues for the specified version regardless their status or resolution. Since the releasenotes don't contain any further information like status or resolution, it is not clear what has been fixed in a release.

Normally one would, ofcourse, move all open issues to another version, but in our case we do a lot of builds of our "platform" which is then given to the various other teams that depend on it. So before we do a formal release, a lot of builds have been taken place and we would like to include a list of things that have been changed and have that one grow up to the point of the first actual release. 

So, I would like to be able to generate releasenotes for unreleased versions (typically a branch version like 1.8) and have either a list of things that have been closed or resolved, OR a list of issues including their status and resolution.
column4: Releasenotes show all issues

column3:
If you are setting up ViewCVS integration for a CVS repository and your ViewCVS has multiple cvsroots, Jira asks you to supply a 'root' parameter.  This parameter is later passed to ViewCVS on the command line like:

http://viewcvspath/viewcvs.cgi/path?root=whatever

In viewcvs 0.92 at least, the parameter looks like it should be 'cvsroot' and not 'root'.

This was implemeted to fix JRA-3193, and the comments there indicate 'cvsroot' but the implementation appears to be 'root' instead.  Even the description text where you provide the value of your cvsroot incorrectly describes the parameter as 'root'.
column4: ViewCVS integration passing incorrect parameter

column3:
In the "Affects Version/s" field the released versions should come first. Most people entering an issue are working with a released version, therefore the "Released Versions" should come first to save their time.

For example, on entering this bug I had to scroll way down in the "affects versions" field to find the proper version. This is inefficient. Many people might even skip filling the "affects version" field because it is not easy enough.

This should be a trivial fix.
column4: "Affects Versions" field should start with "Released Versions"

column3:
Currently, the bugzilla import process allocates new issue IDs for each bug.  The original bugzilla ID seems to be buried in some kind of custom field in the imported issue.

It would be great to have the option to use bugzilla's ID instead, e.g. Bug 123 would be imported as issue XYZ-123. 

This would make it much easier to move users across to JIRA, since our users make heavy use of bug IDs.

column3:
when there are a large number of issues spanning a large number of dates in Jira, searches using date criteria will fail with the exception:

An error occurred searching: org.apache.lucene.search.BooleanQuery$TooManyClauses

see stack trace below.

The problem is that the date range search query actually turns into a BooleanQuery inside lucene, and if there are more than 1024 different dates, lucene will fail.

What needs to happen is the "Created After" and "Created Before" search criteria need to be combined into a single date range.  Right now, they are individual RangeQueries, causing lucene to try to match every single date on one side or the other of the chosen boundary.

If the user only chooses "Created Before" (for example), and there are more than 1000 possible dates, Jira should present some kind of error message asking for a lower limit.  Or (perhaps better) go as far as it can and report the limit in the search results.

Note that the lucene api allows you to retrieve terms less than a given term - see IndexReader#terms(Term).  It would be possible to use this to determine that too many dates match.

Another solution would be to "normalize" dates in the search index to whole number days only.  Right now it would appear the actual timestamp is indexed and the hours, minutes and seconds are not stripped off.  Stripping these off would reduce the number of indexed terms in the lucene index.  However, after a few years (1024 days, to be exact :) even this will fail - so Jira will still need to do some error checking.

stack trace:

org.apache.lucene.search.BooleanQuery$TooManyClauses
	at org.apache.lucene.search.BooleanQuery.add(BooleanQuery.java:109)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.BooleanQuery.add(BooleanQuery.java:101)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.RangeQuery.rewrite(RangeQuery.java:137)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.BooleanQuery.rewrite(BooleanQuery.java:244)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.IndexSearcher.rewrite(IndexSearcher.java:188)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.Query.weight(Query.java:120)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.IndexSearcher.search(IndexSearcher.java:128)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.MultiSearcher.search(MultiSearcher.java:150)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.Hits.getMoreDocs(Hits.java:93)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.Hits.<init>(Hits.java:80)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.Searcher.search(Searcher.java:71)
	at org.apache.lucene.search.Searcher.search(Searcher.java:65)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider.search(LuceneSearchProvider.java:75)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.DefaultSearchProvider.search(DefaultSearchProvider.java:43)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultIssueManager.execute(DefaultIssueManager.java:144)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.CachingIssueManager.execute(CachingIssueManager.java:82)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.issue.IssueNavigator.getBrowsableItems(IssueNavigator.java:370)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.issue.IssueNavigator.doExecute(IssueNavigator.java:258)
	at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:154)
	at com.atlassian.jira.action.JiraActionSupport.execute(JiraActionSupport.java:46)
	at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:131)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraServletDispatcher.service(JiraServletDispatcher.java:181)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:856)

column3:
We have many administrators (about one per project) and each of these administrators create users, reset passwords etc.

Now, the problem is that when they do this and Jira sends its emails out to the users (for new user / reset password emails) the user doesnt know which administrator did it -  in order to contact them when there is a problem. This information is missing from the email.

It would be better if the email contained some information as to which administrator (logged in user) performed the action that resulted in the email.

-Nick
column4: Include Jira Administrator Name (and email address) in email

column3:
Today everybody can see time estimates made on an issue. It would be nice if it was possible (for example via the permission scheme) to determine who should be able see them.

An idea to the level of permissions could be:
- Edit others time estimates
- Add/Edit own time estimates
- View time estimates

This could also help another issue: That an administrator maybe doesn't want to enable time tracking on all projects. With the above solution the administrator can just choose not to set any Time Tracking permissions on the projects that shouldn't use Time Tracking.

/watson
column4: Hide Time Tracking estimates from certain users (e.g. customers)

column3:
Resolving an issue should put the estimated time remaining to 0.

To be consistent, on the user interface that allows reopening an issue you should be able to enter a value for Estimated time remaining.

This is very annoying. Is there something I missed or do not understand?
column4: Resolving an issue should automatically put the estimated time remaining to 0

column3:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 25/Nov/2010|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5|bgColor=#E7F4FA}

Hi Guys,

We are proud to announce that JIRA 4.3 has just been released!

4.3 includes the new LDAP integration functionalities that we've been working on.

In addition, we've completed a whole host of other cool new features. For more information - please check out our release notes at: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+4.3+Release+Notes.

Thanks for your patience, and feel free to contact us if you have feedback or questions for us.

Regards,
Edwin Wong
JIRA Product Management
edwin at atlassian dot com


{panel}

NOTE:  We have updated this description based upon our plans to improve the LDAP support in JIRA

Currently, JIRA's LDAP integration is limited to being able to check a user's password against that in a LDAP directory, as documented at

http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/ldap.html

If you're not aware, Confluence and Bamboo use atlassian-user, FishEye and Crucible have their own stack, and JIRA uses OSUser. Crowd's LDAP stack is different again. 

We are going to put Crowd's LDAP stack into both JIRA and Confluence, and then into the rest of the products. This is a large amount of engineering, and in JIRA in particular, will affect a lot of the code. Much of the Crowd team will be helping out on this effort. The work will not be delivered in JIRA 4.0, but it will start as soon as 4.0 ships.  This issue has been assigned to the short term roadmap of JIRA to reflect this.
column4: Improve the LDAP stack in JIRA

column3: If you have a user with International characters in the user picker they get corrupted.
column4: German characters don't show in User Picker when using Informix database

column3:
This (or similar) problem was mentioned in JRA-122.

Non-ASCII characters are entered correcty into the database, but are displayed as questionmarks ('?').

Encoding is set in JIRA perferences as UTF-8. HTTP responses from the server are correctly marked as "Content-Type  text/html;charset=UTF-8". 

I added <input-charset> elements to weblogic.xml, but it didn't help.

I must emphasise that input is not mangled by WebLogic (as it is correctly written by JIRA into the database). It seems that the only problem lies somewhere in the rendering phase.
column4: Support for UTF-8 characters in WebLogic

column3: Some of the names we are using for database tables are reserved words.  We need to check that we don't use them!\n\neg "VALUE", "TRIGGER".
column4: Review database mappings for reserved words

column3: We've had the occassional issue that's been closed with the wrong "Fixed In" version against it.  Originally the issue was targetted for one version, but somebody got the urge to fix it sooner and it made it into an earlier version; however, they didn't notice it had the wrong version against it when they resolved the issue.  One side effect of this is the issue doesn't appear in the Changes Log, and even when it does eventually appear it'll be against the wrong version.  So, in the interests of accuracy, I want to change it back to the correct version.\r\n\r\nUnfortunately, even with administrator privileges, the only way to do this is to re-open the issue then close it again, which is a bit cumbersome.  It would be nice if this were made more streamlined e.g. by allowing administrators to Edit certain fields even in closed issues (actually, that's about the only field I can think of which would benefit from being able to do this, since you can still add Comments already)
column4: Allow Fixed In field to be edited without reopening issue

column3: Add time zones to user profile.     That way the dates displayed to a user are always contiguous with their local time zone, rather than the server's time zone.
column4: User Preference: User Time Zones

column3:
h3. Description
Whenever a comment is added with a user mention, two events are expected to be triggered:
- comment
- commentMention

Previously, in both the *old and new* issue views, whenever a user was mentioned on a comment these two events were fired by Jira. This seems to have started to happen when the old issue view started to handle mentions as *\[Full Name|~accountid:<id>\]* instead of referencing the email address.

Currently, however, the "commentMention" event is *not* being fired upon a mention in the *old issue view*, causing email notifications to *not be sent* unless the user is configured as a recipient of the *Issue Commented* event.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Switch back to the *old issue view*
# Create a comment with a mention, as exemplified below
*  !Screen Shot 2019-06-04 at 11.15.19 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected results:
Events are triggered by Jira and mention notification is sent.

h3. Actual results:
Only the *comment* event is triggered. In case the user who's being mention is not configured to receive this type of message in the *Notification scheme*, he *will not be* notified of this event.

h3. Workaround:
This problem *does not occur* when using the new issue view. Also, this does not occur if the user mentioned is set as a recipient of *Issue Commented* events in the *Notification Scheme*

h5. Notes:
This impacts scenarios where notification schemes are configured so that users only receive notifications of comments where they are *mentioned*.
column4: Mention does not trigger "commentMention" event in Old Issue View

column3:
h3. Summary

"Copy Value From Other Field" post-function does not work for the "due date" field 
h3. Environment

Atlassian Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Prepare a date picker type custom field
# In the Edit the workflow screen, add the post-function *Copy Value From Other Field* on the *Create* transition
 !スクリーンショット 2019-02-25 17.04.19.png|thumbnail! 
# Create a post function to copy the value of 1 to "due date".
# Click the plus icon in the sidebar. set a value for field 1 and create

h3. Expected Results
 * due date field has a value set

h3. Actual Results
 * due date remains empty

h3. Notes:
* This issue is similar with [JRACLOUD-68751|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-68751], which turned out to be an intended feature and was fixed to not to show up "Status" field, in [JRACLOUD-67714|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-67714]. If this behavior of the due date is also an intended one, it'll be great that the same fix will be implemented.
 
h3. Workaround
* Create a custom field for due date(date picker type) and use that field as an alternative
column4: "Copy Value From Other Field" does not work for the "due date" field on the "Create" transition

column3:
h3. Summary

When attempting to configure Jira Cloud to [send mail on behalf of a custom domain|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-jira-cloud-to-send-emails-on-behalf-of-your-domain-900996548.html], if the domain entered into domain-check.atlassian.com starts with a numeral the check will fail and a HTTP 422 (Unprocessable Entity) error will be returned in the browser dev console. In addition, if you attempt to configure a custom project e-mail address in JIRA using a claimed domain that begins with a numeral this will also fail and return an error stating 'DKIM/SPF validation error.' This occurs despite the SPF and DKIM DNS configuration being correct.
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to [https://domain-check.atlassian.com|https://domain-check.atlassian.com/]
 # Enter a domain that starts with a numeral (ex. 2wire.com, 99perblems.com)
 # Click 'Check' button

Or attempt to configure a custom project e-mail using a claimed domain that start with a numeral
 # Choose the Jira icon (  !https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/files/946613651/946613716/1/1520474494630/core.png|width=19! ,   !https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/files/946613651/946613719/1/1520474554077/software.png|width=19! ,   !https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/files/946613651/946613718/1/1520474568265/servicedesk.png|width=19! ,   !https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/files/946613651/959785988/1/1538713322379/Jira+Ops-icon-neutral-rgb%402x.png|width=16!  or   !https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/files/946613651/946613717/1/1520474599238/jirafamily.png|width=19! ) > *Projects*.
 # Select *Settings* > *Summary.*
 # Under the *Notifications* section and click the pencil icon to the right of the *Email* address.
 # In the resulting *Project Email Address* dialog box, enter a valid email address in the *Email* field, and click *Update*.

h3. Expected Results

SPF\DKIM records are verified or found to be missing
 The project e-mail is set successfully.
h3. Actual Results

'Unknown server error' is displayed.
 Checking the browser dev console, a HTTP 422 error is returned.
{code:java}
Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 422 ()
 index.js:83 Error: Request failed with status code 422
 at e.exports (createError.js:15)
 at e.exports (settle.js:18)
 at XMLHttpRequest.d.(/anonymous function) (https://domain-check.atlassian.com/static/js/main.748193d6.js:4:8199)\{code}
{code}
 Attempting to set the project e-mail results in 'DKIM/SPF validation error.'
h3. Workaround

None
column4: DKIM\SPF Validation Fails for Domains That Start With a Numeral

column3:
One of our public articles, [Changing Server ID for Test Installations|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/changing-server-id-for-test-installations-285839562.html], contains instructions about how to proceed when facing a specific problem in our server platform.

This situation, however, *also affects cloud*. 

It would be great to have this documentation reflecting both scenarios, providing our customers information about how to proceed in each different situation.

As a suggestion, I would add the following:
{quote}
h3. Server installation:
 * *All the information already provided*


h3. Cloud installation:
 * If problem is affecting a cloud instance, please contact our Technical support.
{quote}

That way, customers would now exactly how to proceed on both platforms, as sometimes not explicitly specifying if problem affects server or cloud causes confusion.
column4: Update public Knowledge Base Article

column3:
h3. Problem Definition
With the New "full detail" Jira issue view, users lost the ability to sort attachments and to see them in a list mode.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability for users sort attachments and see them in a list mode while viewing the issue in the "full detail" view.

Previous "full detail" issue view:
 !Attachments sortable.png|thumbnail! 

New "full detail" issue view:
 !Attachments non sortable.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Why this is important
This should enhance greatly the user experience.

h3. Workaround 
You can temporarily disable the New Jira issue view in Business projects by clicking "See the old view" (on the top right corner of the screen).
 !New issue view.png|thumbnail!
column4: As an user I'd like to manage the attachments of an issue as I could before (New Jira issue view)

column3:
In the new issue view, it's not possible to sort comments, history or worklogs.
 It would be great if we have the option to choose the order of the activities.

 
h3. Workaround

You can disable [the new issue view|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/the-new-jira-issue-view-938040503.html] by either:
 * Going to your personal settings in Jira: [https://NAME.atlassian.net/secure/ViewPersonalSettings.jspa|https://name.atlassian.net/secure/ViewPersonalSettings.jspa] and disable the new UI at all:
!https://community.atlassian.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/79462i91DCCFC71F667D63/image-dimensions/302x214?v=1.0|width=302,height=214!
 * Adding *?oldIssueView=true* to the url when opening an issue for which you would like to see the attachments section. For example: [https://NAME.atlassian.net/browse/ABC-123?oldIssueView=true|https://name.atlassian.net/browse/ABC-123?oldIssueView=true]
column4: Ability to sort activities when using the new issue view

column3:
h3. Summary
Custom fields formatting is not converted to markdown in the new Jira issue view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a project with a text custom field using the Wiki Renderer;
# Add some formatting in this field, using [wiki markup|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/WikiRendererHelpAction.jspa?section=all];
# Turn on the new Jira issue view.

h3. Expected Results
The custom field should retain its formatting, similar to system fields.
Here's an example of two fields, *Description* and a *Custom text field* with the same formatting:
 !text-formatting-old-view.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Only system fields are correctly formatted. Custom fields will be displayed with plain text:
 !text-formatting-new-view.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
Regardless if the custom field is using the *Default Text Renderer* or the *Wiki Style Renderer*, it's not possible to add any formatting in the field.

h3.Workaround
Disable the Labs in the user profile in order to disable the new issue view (only for Software project):
 !profile-labs.png|thumbnail!
column4: Custom fields formatting is not converted to markdown in the new Jira issue view

column3:
Today everybody can see time estimates made on an issue. It would be nice if it was possible (for example via the permission scheme) to determine who should be able see them.

An idea to the level of permissions could be:
 - Edit others time estimates
 - Add/Edit own time estimates
 - View time estimates

 # The agency wants to be able to control who can see any time estimation and tracking information, such as customers (likely not), internal project management (rather yes) etc.
 # In some circumstances, this information is sensitive and needs to be handled accordingly.
column4: Hide Time Tracking estimates from certain users (e.g. customers)

column3:
h2. Problem Description

Running a Jira Import on a Jira Cloud instance hits into error:
{noformat}
jira-import timed out: HEARTBEAT
{noformat}

h2. Steps to Replicate 

# Process import file (/) No errors
# Redirected to Jira Import Wizard, make selection and click proceed (/) No errors
# Jira Import progress showing starting task, stuck on 0% for 5 minutes and error message (x) Waited for 5 minutes and error pops up
{noformat}
["jira-import timed out: HEARTBEAT"]
{noformat}

h2. Workaround

Currently there is no workaround to this issue, we are still actively working to resolve this. Please watch this bug ticket to get an update when it is available.
column4: Jira Cloud Import Failed with jira-import timeout HEARTBEAT

column3:
h3. Summary

Attempting to generate a backup for server in JIRA Cloud results in an error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Attempt to generate an Backup for server in a JIRA Cloud site

h3. Expected Results

Backup is generated successfully.

h3. Actual Results
The following error is displayed.

"Export error
Export failed (Completed pre-export checks)
Please try again later or contact support if error persists."

!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. 
Workaround
None
column4: Create Backup for Server Fails

column3:
h3.Summary

There have been reports of webhooks failing randomly causing third party add-on (and other services that relied on webhooks) to not work properly. Investigation is currently being done on the matter by our internal team.  Currently we don't have much information what is causing this yet.

This bug ticket will be updated as we have more information of the problem.
column4: Webhooks are failing randomly

column3:
h3. Summary
Messages containing embedded images sent from Amazon WorkMail are not added as attachments to issues created via JIRA mail handler.

h3. Environment
JIRA Cloud
Amazon WorkMail

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a mail handler in JIRA
# Send a message from Amazon WorkMail containing an embedded image to the address for the mail handler

h3. Expected Results
Issue is created and the embedded image is added as an attachment

h3. Actual Results
Issue is created but the embedded image is not added as an attachment 
 
h3. Notes
Issue appears to be specific to Amazon WorkMail. Other mail provider's messages are processed as expected, with the embedded image added as an attachment. No error or failure is reported by the JIRA application logs when the embedded image fails to be attached. Mail headers from both a successful and failed message with an embedded image are attached.

h3.Workaround
Attach the images to the message rather than embedding it.
column4: Amazon WorkMail Embedded Images Not Attached Via Mail Handler

column3:
h3. Summary
Issues with Story Issue Types missing from Sprints on a scrum board and they are being added to backlog. The users are not able to move Stories back to Sprint from Backlog section.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a Scrum board which has Story issue types included in it.
# Check the backlog of the board and find a Story.
# Try to move Story from backlog to an active sprint. No error is displayed in the UI.
# When page is refreshed, Story goes back into Backlog.

h3. Expected Results
* Stories should be displayed in the correct Sprint.

h3. Actual Results
* Stories are missing from the sprints even though they assigned to a Sprint.

h3.Workaround
No workaround at the moment.
column4: Issues with Story Issue Types missing from Sprints

column3:
I was browsing through our documentation and was able to identify that one particular page, [All Atlassian Gadgets|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GADGETS/All+Atlassian+Gadgets], looks broken.

As you can see below, the browser console is returning multiple errors, causing the page to not render properly.
 * !Screen Shot 2018-03-27 at 5.57.05 PM.png|thumbnail! 
!Screen Shot 2018-03-27 at 5.55.55 PM.png|thumbnail! 

This may cause frustration to our customers, as this documentation is being referenced in [Using dashboard gadgets|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/using-dashboard-gadgets-776636252.html]
{quote}
For more ideas, see the big list of [all Atlassian gadgets|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GADGETS/All+Atlassian+Gadgets].

* This gadget is only available if you have installed/configured the relevant plugin.
{quote}
column4: "All Atlassian Gadgets" page is broken

column3:
The KB article [[https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/how-to-change-google-apps-domain-in-atlassian-cloud-instances-691011949.html]] is for users who consider changing their Gsuite domain from "@domainA.com" to "@domainB.com".
h3. Current situation:
 * This article is last updated in 2016. Since then, Atlassian experienced a lot of changes related to users management (Gsuite, SAML, Identity management...) also, apparently, google also experienced changes related to their Gsuite console.
 * Currently, the article requests to disconnect Gsuite which is actually not required.
 * Currently the article does not clarify that for users who has different Atlassian products they just need to make the sync in one product.

h3. Expected situation:
 * To avoid any duplicate users that may be created the steps are described in the following comment:
 ## Access to your jira cloud instance ***.atlassian.net and sync users before doing any change in google side (this will ensure users details are up to date).
 ## You don't need to disconnect Gsuite.
 ## You go now to your Google console through [https://admin.google.com|https://admin.google.com/]
 ## You add and verify the new domain as shown in the screenshot below. [[https://support.google.com/a/answer/7502379?hl=en]]
 ## !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
 ## You then need to update users emails as shown in the screenshot below
 ## !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail!
 ## After finishing all users, you wait 10 minutes then get back to your Jira cloud instance and you Gsuite sync again.
 ## !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail!
 ## Users will now be able to connect to any of the products using their new email address and their old password.

h3. Note:
 * As I already specified these steps will update the Atlassian account which will provide access to the different products.
 * Users who will try later to access with the old email address will not be able to, the access is possible only with the new domain email address.
 * All the history is under the same Atlassian Account accessible through the new domain email address.
* Warning: If the email address mapped to the new domain already exists in the cloud instance, their old account's email address will be modified to  username+conflict@domainB.com.
* You don't need to set the new domain as primary domain.
column4: outdated google domain change documentation

column3:
As described in the two documents below, the *External System Import* functionality is different then the *Create issues from CSV*. 
 * [Creating issues using the CSV importer|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/creating-issues-using-the-csv-importer-764478441.html]
 * [Importing data from CSV|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/importing-data-from-csv-776636762.html]

However, the statements below lead to believe that it is possible to map both the *reporter* and the *assignee* when performing a *Bulk Create from CSV* operation:
{quote}
If you are importing a username-based CSV field (e.g. Reporter or Assignee) and you do not check the Map field value option for this field, then the import process will automatically map imported usernames from the CSV file to (lowercase) Jira usernames.

You can choose to have the importer automatically create Jira users for any values of the Assignee or Reporter field.
{quote}

The problem is, whenever trying to map the Assignee field, it is not returned in the existing Jira fields:
 *  !Screen Shot 2018-03-05 at 11.51.26 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to reproduce:
 # Click *Issues > Search issues*
 # Click the *...* button and select *Import issues from CSV*
 # Upload the CSV file and try to map the Assignee field
column4: Impossible to map assignee on CSV import

column3:
h3. Problem Definition
The context for custom fields can be deleted without confirmation.

h3. Suggested Solution
In the delete button highlighted in the image below, add a confirmation that the existing data of the context will be deleted.
!configure-custom-field.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Why this is important
This is a serious concern on the reliability as it's possible to delete something without confirmation. There is a chance to click in the cog icon to edit the context and click on the bin and delete it accidentally.
If you have for example a custom field with multiple preset values, if the context is deleted, you must recreate the context and edit all issues accordingly.
!custom-field-no-context.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround 
None.
column4: Add a confirm dialog when deleting context of custom fields

column3:
h3. Summary
In some instances, JIRA Trello integration is firing too many REST API Calls. The amount of REST API Calls being triggered are massive and rapid, that it will cause outages in some instance.

Below is the sample REST API Calls from access log:
{code}
xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx - [23/Oct/2017:12:19:05 +0200] "GET /rest/api/2/issue/xxxxx?expand=renderedFields HTTP/1.0" 200 300 61 "-" "atlassian-connect-express/2.1.3"
xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx - [23/Oct/2017:12:19:05 +0200] "GET /rest/api/2/issue/xxxxx?expand=renderedFields HTTP/1.0" 200 300 61 "-" "atlassian-connect-express/2.1.3"
xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx - [23/Oct/2017:12:19:05 +0200] "GET /rest/api/2/issue/xxxxx?expand=renderedFields HTTP/1.0" 200 300 61 "-" "atlassian-connect-express/2.1.3"
xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx - [23/Oct/2017:12:19:05 +0200] "GET /rest/api/2/issue/xxxxx?expand=renderedFields HTTP/1.0" 200 300 61 "-" "atlassian-connect-express/2.1.3"
xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx - [23/Oct/2017:12:19:05 +0200] "GET /rest/api/2/issue/xxxxx?expand=renderedFields HTTP/1.0" 200 300 61 "-" "atlassian-connect-express/2.1.3"
{code}

h3. Steps to Replicate
None, as it occurs in some instances

h3. Expected Results
JIRA Trello Integration should not fire massive amount of REST API Calls

h3. Actual Results
JIRA Trello Integration is firing massive amount of REST API Calls

h3. Workaround
Remove group memberships from user {{addon_jira-trello-integration}} and deactivate {{addon_jira-trello-integration}} user
column4: JIRA Trello Integration is firing too many REST API Calls that will cause outage

column3:

"Copy Value From Other Field" post-function does not work for the field Status
h3. Environment

Atlassian Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create project > Edit the workflow > Add the post-function *Copy Value From Other Field* on the *Create* transition
 ** !update status.png|thumbnail!
 # Create a *Story* > Change the status to *In Progress*
 # Create a subtask

h3. Actual Results

h3. Notes:
h3. Workaround

column3:
h2.Summary

Issue collector throws an error when attachments are attached to IE 11. This has been successfully being replicated on 11.0.9600.17631 . 

h2.Steps to Replicate
# Load an issue collector on IE 11.
# Try to raise a new ticket and attach a new file to the ticket.
# The below error will be returned {{Cannot attach file issue collector.html: JIRA could not attach the file as there was a missing token. Please try attaching the file again.}} .
# Attempting the action again will return {{Cannot attach file issue collector.html: JIRA could not attach the file as there was a missing token. Please try attaching the file again.}}.

h2.Expected results.
Attachments should be attached to the ticket without issues.

h2.Current results
Attachment cannot be attached and error message is returned.

Note : Issue collector worked fine on my latest version of Chrome (Version 51.0.2704.103 m) .
column4: Issue Collector returns error when attachments are being attached on IE

column3:
h3. Summary

After performing a JIRA Site Import and a Confluence Import from another instance the remote links from JIRA to Confluence display 'Page Failed to load' as both the appId and pageId have changed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create instance-a containing JIRA Cloud and Conlfuence Cloud
# On instance A create an issue and then refer to that issue from a Confluence page
# Take a site backup and space backup of JIRA and Confluence
# Import the JIRA Site backup into instance B
# Import the Confluence space backup into Instance B.
# View the JIRA Issue on instance B

h3. Expected Results

A remote link to the page on instance B exists.

h3. Actual Results

The remote link on instance B says:

{quote}
Page Failed to load
{quote}

If you check the database the pageId and appId will not match the space export.

h3.Workaround

As both the pageId and appId have changed it's nearly impossible to map the pages back in any automated fashion. Recreating the links will be your best option.
column4: Remote links fail to load after any confluence import due to changing appId and pageId
User not created if present as comment author only

column3:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64629].
  {panel}

When importing users into JIM from .csv files there is a use case for giving users the option to do something of the following:
* Import all those users, and put them into the jira-users group for example
* Import all those users, but have them as users who are not in any groups (not active and will not count towards the license count)
* Do not import users
column4: JIRA Importers Plugin (JIM) to give the option to import users or not
No way to add Value Mapping for users defined in Comments column
Errors parsing dates should count as failures
Support QA Contact and Alias and any other built-in custom fields in Bugzilla
External Issue ID should be always re-used if it exists

column3:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64588].
  {panel}

Hi,

it's great for us to use the CSV-Importer for uploading issues including comments with datetime and user information.
After uploading all issues the Activity Stream shows an exact history. When uploading attachments the automatically generated
attachment destroys this history view. (see screenshot).

Kind Regards
Udo Ottink
column4: Option for importing attachments, to disable automatically generated comments
Do not import unused users if external user management is turned on

column3:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64556].
  {panel}

Tested in CSV, but may be happening elsewhere.

We should inform the user that the configuration is wrong, in the same way we do for multiple columns with same header:
- if the field can receive multiple values, say nothing (and do as expected)
- if the field cannot receive multiple values, like Summary, display a warning and add fail messages if proceed (fail because we get data loss - user thinks he imported data from column X but it was discarded)
column4: When I map multiple values to the same field only the first value is used and the other are SILENTLY ignored
When you type some project name in Add Project combo and this project does not exist you should be able to easily create it.
Importer should try to guess mapped columns
Support importing users from CSV by their Display Name
Read Trac attachments from the web
Make it possible to select how to map usernames when importing CSV
Fogbugz value mapper ignores (de)selected projects when displaying possible values
Show all custom fields and let the user decide if she want to extend their scope
Streamline fields selection page
Custom field import not controllable
Support Clone field from Bugzilla
As a system administrator I'd like to save the configuration before starting the import process
Update Database Schema Developer Docs for JIRA 7

column3:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63123].
  {panel}

+Issue Summary+

When searching for an issue in JIRA using the advanced JQL search option, clicking on an option would have no effect in Chrome browser.

+Environment Summary+

|JIRA Version|JIRA Server 7.1.9, 7.2.4|
|Browser|Chrome|
|Operating System|Windows|

+Steps to Reproduce+

# Go to {{Issues > Search for Issues}} page.
# Switch the JQL option to Advanced Search.
# Start searching for something like project and when the option is shown, use your mouse to select the option rather than using the keyboard.

+Expected Behavior+

JIRA would complete the search.

+Actual Behavior+

Nothing happens when you click on the option.

(i) Tested this on chromium also on Linux operating system and other browsers on Windows and it works as intended.
column4: Clicking on option Not working during Advanced Search
issue collector script wont run as embedded javascript in "strict" mode

column3:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60469].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
* Recently there was an issue with Domino LDAP integrated with JIRA where [Users with special characters in their full name are not able to log into JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Users+with+special+characters+in+their+full+name+are+not+able+to+log+into+JIRA]
* The [Supported Platforms page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/adminjiraserver071/Supported+Platforms] does not show supported LDAP engines 

h3. Suggested Solution
* Include a list of LDAP engines that are supported in the [Supported Platforms page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/adminjiraserver071/Supported+Platforms]
 !ldap.png|thumbnail!
column4: Show LDAP Engine supported in the Supported Platforms Documentations
Text Formatting for {{monospace}} has an incorrect example of what is displayed
Ability to hide JIRA User Timezone Difference Warning
Difficulty in getting the correct quote

column3:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-34473].
  {panel}

It appears that Axis does not provide any SOAP endpoints when JIRA is run behind https.  When one requests /rpc/soap, eg:

https://support.atlassian.com/rpc/soap/exec sp_prepexec @P1 output, N'@P1 bigint,@P2 bigint,@P3 nvarchar(4000),@P4 nvarchar(4000),@P5 nvarchar(4000),@P6 nvarchar(4000),@P7 datetime,@P8 decimal(38,0)', N'INSERT INTO jiraaction (ID, issueid, AUTHOR, actiontype, actionlevel, actionbody, CREATED, actionnum) VALUES (@P1 , @P2 , @P3 , @P4 , @P5 , @P6 , @P7 , @P8 )', 12823, 10549, N'neala', N'comment', NULL, N'The main problem is that ''smart'' quotes are really "dumb" because only MS Word knows about them.', 'Dec 31 2005 1:53:17:257PM', NULL



One gets back:

"""
And now... Some Services

    * null (wsdl)
"""

instead of the usual:

"""
And now... Some Services

    * null (wsdl)
          o getUser
          o createUser
          o getComponents
          o createGroup
          o getGroup
          o login
          o getServerInfo
          o updateGroup
"""

The WSDL is correspondingly empty.
column4: SOAP does not work over HTTPS / SSL on certain configurations

column3:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-31581].
  {panel}

We have several customers that collect "common hours" such as vacations and meetings on the same issue for all employees. This means that the history of these issues grows very big (thousands of changes).

We have noticed that adding hours to these issues takes a good deal longer than adding hours to "new" issues (5-10 seconds, sometimes longer). We have tried both the standard "Log work" function and Tempo with the same results.

Experimenting a bit also shows that it looks like the "dispatchEvent" parameter to the "createWorklog" function is the key. Setting the "dispatchEvent" to false makes everything OK. This means that somebody that is listening to the ISSUE_WORKLOGGED_ID event is taking a long time processing.

Note that we disabled all plugins except the Atlassian plugins (see attached screenshot) which means that it's either JIRA itself or some of the listed Atlassian plugins that is the culprit.

Best regards,

Bjarni (Tempo plugin)

h5. Workaround

As a temporary workaround, the JIRA WebHooks Plugin can be disabled through the UPM.
column4: Adding worklogs to issues with large histories is very slow

WAR distribution script and process for creating WAR file must be changed now that we use dbconfig.xml instead of entityengine.xml

column3:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25210].
  {panel}

In the initial JIRA start we don't allow users to point to a db with existing data when configuring connection.
Currently we show an error, we need to modify the error message and add a link to upgrade documentation. Something like  "The database specified is not empty. Please specify an empty database for your JIRA installation. If you want to upgrade the existing installation please follow this instructions." where 'this instructions' is a link to a documentation page.

h3. Workaround

# Stop JIRA.
# Manually alter the {{$JIRA_HOME/dbconfig.xml}} or use the [JIRA Configuration Tool|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Using+the+JIRA+Configuration+Tool] to point to the database.
(!) Please ensure to follow the appropriate documentation for [Connecting JIRA to a Database|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+a+Database].
# Start JIRA.
column4: Point users to upgrade documentation if they try to connect to db with existing jira data.

column3:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-22214].
  {panel}

This is a clone of JRA-18493 which was resolved as fixed. 

During an upgrade from Jira 3.13 to Jira 4.1.2 two re-indexes occur, one for Build 440 and one for Build 518.   
Please reduce this to one if at all possible.

On a system with many issues, like 200000, this double re-indexing consumes 2 hours of site down time instead of 1 hour. 
In our upgrade from Jira 3.13 to 4.1.2, we need to manually re-index a third time as we have dropped and then re-added a custom calculated field that changed due to changes in the Jira API.
column4: CLONE - Remove any re-index from the JIRA 4.1 upgrade tasks that's not needed

When building project key patterns, custom patterns should be wrapped in parentheses.

See class DefaultKeyMatcher constructor.

See support issue https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-63357

In essence, subtle pattern match problems can arise, if the JIRA administrator provides a pattern which has alternates.

Assume for the moment that the administrator provides this simple key pattern: 

   ALPHA|BETA

Then, the project key regular pattern will be constructed as

   /^ALPHA|BETA$/

Which will match any of the following

   ALPHA
   ALPHA-DOG
   BETA
   5BETA
   %^&^&**()BETA

Does this make sense?

The proper pattern should be:

   /^(ALPHA|BETA)$/

Since I'm unfamiliar with the Perl5Util classes, I can only ask why the need to enclose the entire pattern in stroke characters.  From my knowledge of Perl, the stroke characters are part of the syntax used to indicate that there is a pattern, and they are not maintained as part of the pattern.
column4: Add Guarding Parentheses in DefaultKeyMatcher class

JIRA Cloud Supports Google Apps Integration

# Use a Third Party Plugin from the [Atlassian Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com] such as [OpenID Authentication for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.pawelniewiadomski.jira.jira-openid-authentication-plugin/server/overview]
# Use [Atlassian Crowd|https://www.atlassian.com/software/crowd/overview/], and then integrate with Google ID as per the documentation: [Configuring the Google Apps Connector|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CROWD/Configuring+the+Google+Apps+Connector]

h3. Original Request
JIRA Studio- OnDemand-style Google Apps integration for JIRA Standalone would be cool, particularly the Activity Bar and the ability to attach/preview Google Docs.

When a user has no issues and no projects in JIRA, they are probably a new user who is unsure about how to use the product, especially for users who are evaluating the product. The "No issues found" screen is fairly important and a chance for us to explain JIRA's functionality in more detail. Currently these screens are fairly empty. I've attached screenshots of some of the important screens.

This could be a very simple fix. For example, the screen that says 

"You have no favourite filters at the moment" 

could be rewritten to say 

"You have no favourite filters. [Learn more about filters|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Saving+Searches+('Issue+Filters')] or [create a new filter]." 

We provide the user with an opportunity to learn more about the product and use the product in a beneficial way, and introduce him/her to the documentation. Furthermore, the cost to existing users is extremely low, as the screens disappear as soon as they begin creating projects.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-17463].
  {panel}

(See linked issues for failing use cases.)

All of our indexing goes through the EnglishAnalyzer which passes the stream through several filters: lowercase, stop word removal, apostrophe removal, tokenizing on underscore and dash, and stemming. This works pretty well when you do a natural language kind of query but has numerous cases where it fails to return results that user experiences. What we need is some kind of secondary "exact text" index and use that to boost results.

One way would be to create a new "exact query" field in the SummaryIndexer, EnvironmentIndexer, and DescriptionIndexer and a PerFieldAnalyzerWrapper to use a "dumber" Analyzer that uses the WhitespaceTokenizer instead of the StandardTokenizer. Then we'd need to fix querying to understand that this new field exists. We could either overload the tilda operator and make it smart enough to search across both fields and combine the results in a smart way. Or we could make the equals operator handle text (right now it throws an exception). We'd also want some kind of UI configuration to enable/disable this since it changes behaviour and not everyone is going to want the new behaviour. This would likely break the existing unit tests and func tests for indexing and JQL so we'd need to fix those. We'd probably want to writer new Analyzers for German, French, and Spanish as well instead of just limiting this new behaviour to our English users. Possibly Chinese/Japanese/Korean as well. We'd want better func test coverage on searching in non-English languages to try to make sure this change doesn't have adverse effects for non-English users.

We'd also need to figure out how to handle text custom fields in all of this.

Another approach would be something more along the lines of the SynonymAnalyzer described in "Lucene in Action": have a single Analyzer emit multiple tokens with the same virtual position. Under the covers the Analyzer would multiplex TokenStreams from a "normal" Analyzer and a "dumb" Analyzer. I'm not sure if sharing the Reader between Tokenizers like that works, if not we'd might have to make changes to Lucene core. Having both kinds of tokens in the same index field seems like it OUGHT to end up giving better results for these "exact searches". But it might have adverse effects on normal search ordering. This approach would probably have less impact on JQL but has a higher risk of us running into shortcomings in Lucene APIs.
column4: Better exact-text searching

Currently to perform low level mail debugging you have to set mail.debug=true on the command line and restart JIRA.

We should be able to toggle a switch in the logging section of JIRA and have it turn on dynamically.

Ideally one should only have to set System.getProperties().setProperty*"mail.debug","true") however there is a block on this

In order to get this to work, atlassian-mail needs some surgery as decsribed here: 

http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/MAIL-38

Also in the IMAP/POP fetcher we dont use the same mechanism but instead rely on javax.mail.Session.getDefaultInstance() which is a static.  We need to call setDebug() on this object before using it.

After that we should be able to get dynamic mail debugging in place without a restart.

JRA-10205 was reported regarding the displaying of issue summary, reported and assignee, type and status on certain issue operations when not logged in. For 3.6.3 the solutions was to simply throw an IssuePermissionException when the user doesn't have Browse Issue permission for that issue. Please see that issue for a description of how it was done and what files were touched.

However, it was noted that there were at least four different ways the Issue actions might report this to the user.
# Custom handling in the operation view. Creates a very nice error page with the operation, and friendly error message - http://server/jira/secure/AddComment!default.jspa?id=12345
# "You are not logged in" message with standard Jira banner, user gets redirected to permission-violation page (permissionviolation.jsp), not so friendly, but the user gets the point - http://server/jira/secure/ViewIssue.jspa?id=12345 (note, this page has trackback info)
# "Access Denied" message with big red background, user gets redirected to security-breach page (securitybreach.jsp) with standard Jira banner, not so friendly big red message, user still gets the point - http://server/jira/secure/attachment/12345/logs_jira-int_11_03_2005.txt or the ViewVoters or ManageWatchers urls (no trackback info). 
# 500 page catches IssuePermissionException, very, very unfriendly message, lots of nasty logging.

{note}all the Admin pages use the securitybreach.jsp{note}

These need to be standardised so all access denied reports are the same, and it is not possible to view any secure information if you do not have that permission.

While researching JRA-10205 the following was noted:
- IssuePermissionException is handled inconsistently. We need to either throw it from our Action.doValidate(), Action.doExecute() & Action.doDefault() methods or handle it in a consistent manner.
- We probably should handle the standard case in the framework. AbstractIssueSelectAction holds the issueObject, and should be able to handle 99% of the code paths. Attached is a version that does the 99% (doesn't handle the trackback case)
- We could further generify the issue handling of Actions by having them implement some kind of IssueAware interface and have an interceptor of the filter stack read the request parameters and insert the Issue into the action. This could also have a PermissionException injector method as well if the user cannot see an issue. (Please ask Scott for further information, as this is his idea).
- The trackback info is the wrinkle edge-case, we do actually have to provide some issue info in the trackback rdf if enabled.

Final caveat: The permission error page actually DOES HAVE TO HAVE the issue summary in it (if incoming trackbacks are turned on) in the trackback RDF. This currently works if the permissionviolation.jsp is the result (which it is for ViewIssue). We probably need to have a separate TrackbackIssueInfo object that the Issue can give us that is filtered through a trackback policy filter. Then we can have a trackback policy for enabling/disabling trackbacks based on their security (for instance allow trackbacks for public issues only, rinse issue summary from non public issues etc.)
column4: Clean up Permission Violation error reporting for all issue operations
AddComment jelly tag should take tag body as comment body

* AddComponent (Web Action)
## Migrate the methods getExistingEntityByName() and getProjectEntities() to use the ProjectComponent object.
## The equivalent Jelly method simply uses the AddComponent web action.
## No equivalent method within XML/RPC or SOAP.

* EditComponent (Web Action)
## This should be moved away from the EditProjectEntity interface - as the entity is now a ProjectComponent object
## Migrate all the methods to use the service and the ProjectComponent object.
## Remove the back-end action ComponentEdit and perform the edit through the service.
## No equivalent method within Jelly, XML/RPC or SOAP.

* DeleteComponent (Web Action)
## This should be moved away from the DeleteProjectEntity interface - as the entity is now a ProjectComponent object
## Move the swapComponent logic to the service.
## Migrate all the methods to use the service and the ProjectComponent object.
## Remove the back-end action ComponentDelete and perform the deletion through the service.
## No equivalent method within Jelly, XML/RPC or SOAP.

* ViewProject
## Migrate the components.jsp to use the ProjectComponentManager

h3. Problem Definition

Currently by default when the site admin enables the option to add users via the self-signup feature i.e *Anyone with one of the following email address domains can join*, the site admin gets email notification by default for all the new users created which is working as expected.


 Once the above feature is enabled, *notification about new users* is checked and greyed out. The customer wants this feature to be available so that he can uncheck the option in *notification about new users* and hence get no notification when the users are added using the self-signup option

!Screen Shot 2018-09-14 at 5.32.32 PM.png|width=544,height=274!
h3. Suggested Solution

To enable the *Notification about new users* in site access when self-signup feature i.e *Anyone with one of the following email address domains can join* is selected.
h3. Workaround

No workaround to tackle the issue.
column4: Disable email notification for selected domains self sign-up

In case the user has over 30 groups, it is not possible to view all of them, as only the first 30 groups will be displayed.

h3. How to reproduce:
 * Access a user that who is a member of more than 30 groups


h3. Expected result:
 * Either all groups would be displayed or a pagination index would be available

h3. Actual behavior:
 * Only the first 30 groups are displayed:
  !Screen Shot 2018-07-18 at 5.31.33 PM.png|thumbnail!

 * In this case, user was a member of 51 groups
||User||Number of groups||
|testuser|51|

column3:
h3. Description:
 * When closing an Atlassian account, a spinning wheel is displayed but no confirmation message is ever displayed. If you check the browser console, an *Uncaught TypeError* is returned with the message:
{quote}
Uncaught TypeError: this.appConfig is not a function
{quote}
 *  !close account error.png|thumbnail! 

h3. When is the problem noticed?
 * Whenever closing any Atlassian account through https://id.atlassian.com/manage/close-account

h3. Steps to reproduce:
 # Navigate to https://id.atlassian.com and login using account credentials
 # Go to https://id.atlassian.com/manage/close-account, click the checkbox and click *Close account*
 # Check browser console 

*Note:* Even though no message is displayed, the account *is actually closed*. By refreshing the page, you will be logged out of your account.


*Note #2:* This bug is a duplicate of [ID\-6469: id.atlassian.com page hangs when trying to close account|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/ID-6469]
column4: When closing an Atlassian account, no message is returned

column3:
h3. Summary

New users invited in Atlassian Cloud applications that use SAML integration are not automatically logged after clicking on the invite link.

They are redirected to the application page but they need to click on the "Log in" button on the far right upper corner.

!Screen Shot 2017-09-05 at 11.40.34 AM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Description

When a new user receives an invite from an Atlassian Cloud application the email redirects him to our [Atlassian Account identity portal|https://id.atlassian.com/], then they need to create a new password after that they are redirected to the instance URL,however, they are not promptly logged they need to click on the upper right button "Log in" which does not seem to load the application, leaving a blank page, new users need to close their browser and re-open it in order to be logged in.

This is an annoyance, especially for new users.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have an instance with SAML set up
 # Provision a new user
 # User receives the invite, clicks on the link is redirected to id.atlassian.com. The user's email address is pre-filled and there is a field for entering the password. Entering a password will not work here as the user needs to authenticate via their SAML login portal.

h3. Expected Result

User should be directed to log into their Atlassian account by authenticating via their SAML login portal.
h3. Actual Result

User is prompted to enter a password into the id.atlassian.com page instead of going to their SAML login portal. There is no easy way for users to progress to their SAML login portal from the id.atlassian.com screen.
h3. Workaround

Go directly to [https://id.atlassian.com|https://id.atlassian.com/] type your federated email, you will be redirected to your SAML login portal after that you can click on the invite link.
column4: New site invites don't work with SAML users

column3:
SVNKit 1.7.6 introduced couple fixes that were affecting FishEye users:
 * http://issues.tmatesoft.com/issue/SVNKIT-319 Too many svnserve processes in case of svn+ssh connection
When FishEye tries to index svn repositories over svn+ssh protocol, it creates far too many Java threads inside FishEye JVM and also spawns the same amount of svnserve processes on the subversion repository server.
 * http://issues.tmatesoft.com/issue/SVNKIT-316 Diff always displays absolute paths instead of relative on Windows (even URL-URL diff)

Fisheye in 2.7.x releases use SVNKit 1.3.3, and Fisheye 2.8.x releases use SVNKit 1.7.4.  

h4.Workaround
Switch to [Native Subversion Client|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Native+Subversion+Client] with the latest SVNKit version (1.7.6+).
column4: SVNKit upgrade 1.7.4v1 to 1.7.6

column3:
When a crucible licence holder adds or removes a FishEye licence:

When licence removed: Throw exception and don't start repo if more features in repo than allowed by licence (implemented in current behaviour)

When licence added: 
* Allow user to continue with possibly reduced functionality: (good) Allows users to continue to use crucible while their repo is being indexed (for some users, could take weeks) - (bad) reviews would be split between the old and new repos
** Log a warning about reduced features
** Display a banner when viewing the repo about reduced features
* Force user to reindex: (good) all reviews on one repo, best for most people with smallish repos (bad) for big repos where no reviews possible while re-indexing

Add Unit Test for the Licence Added behaviour

Admin changes split out as CRUC-4135

column3:
When retrieving the file contents we get the file contents from cleartool and store them in a temporary file. After we have read this file, the file is deleted. 

If two threads try to get the same file at the same time, we get a FileNotFoundException from thread 1 because the file was deleted by thread 2 before it was read by thread 1. We should make sure that multiple threads cannot get in each others way.
column4: ClearCase get file content causes exceptions when multiple users are trying to get the same file at the same time

column3:
* If a file is {{hg rm file}} and then {{hg cp other file}}, the diff just shows a modification (to the same named file), but the meta information in hgfelog.py says it is a copy and the parent rev is the rev id of the parent where it was copied from - so:
*# That revision of the named file may not exist (as it is actually a rev of the copy source)
*# If we use the copy source, we don't have the right diffs to properly calculate the LOC.

* If there was no revision of the copy target in the parent commit, (i.e. a copy over something that was deleted a while ago), the diff will work properly, diffing to the copy source and we can use that as the predecessor/ancestor.
column4: HG: Cope with copies over deleted files

column3: Currently, the git style diff detects one of the files in binary and produces a binary patch, which we interpret to mean the current rev is binary - probably need to look at the file contents instead.\r\n\r\nIn addition, this causes the line count to be wrong - the text version of the file will have a line count of 0, and all subsequent mods will add/remove from that.
column4: HG: Correctly detect when a file moves from binary -> text

column3: # In hgfelog.py, the MetaChange detection is too simplistic: a duplicate modification on a second branch shows up as a MetaChange because the file rev on the other branch is re-used. hgsubversion and hgconvert both produce commits from svn merges that have filerevs whose linkrev is not the current commit.\r\n# In FishEye, we create a new revision, but it's parent rev is the last content change revsions parent, instead of the last content change revision, because that's what mercurial stores in it's filectx. We'd have to detect that and cope with it.\r\n# In FE, a subsequent content mod will also have as it's parent the previous content mod revision, instead of the perm change revision, again, because that's what mercurial stores.
column4: HG: Cope with MetaChanges (permission changes)

column3: When indexing in DvcsScanner.indexUpdatedContent(), the status is set as a file is added to the list of things to process.\r\n\r\nRather, it should be set as the content is actually processed in HgScanner.indexContentBlock (and the corresponding git call), else if an error occurs, it looks like the process is stuck on indexing the final file in the batch.
column4: HG: status while indexing content is misleading.

column3: Ina  merge commit, if a file is modified then we get a diff to parent0 which generates a LOC change. This change can be the sum of the changes we have already indexes down the parent1 branch, so the LOC count for all those commits gets duplicated in the merge.\r\n\r\nNeed to spec out a way of dealing with this, review that and then fix.
column4: HG: Line Count totals broken for merge commits.

column3: hgconvert and hgsubversion produce repos that hg does not when used natively, with file revs included in the changeset when they were just merged.\r\n\r\nDocument this more and come up with some way to work more optimally for ex-svn repos.

column3:
I am using a starter license, and while trying to get the total committers down to 10, I used the suggested approach of starting from a later revision:
{quote}
*Set a starting point*
Some of the FishEye SCM integrations allow you to configure a starting revision from which to start indexing. All commits prior to this starting point are not included in FishEye and do not contribute to the committer count. [Read more|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Configuring+Repository+Details].
{quote}
 However, if you do this and choose to initially import the state of the repository prior to that revision, FishEye will create an anonymous user that ends up counting against the 10 committer limit, so actually you only get to have 9 committers. I think this is a bit unfair, as the whole idea was to skip over commits made by other users, yet we get penalized by then only getting 9 committer slots instead of 10. And if you don't choose to do an initial import, you lose access to any files within the repository that were never touched by anyone after that revision, which should not be part of the restriction as the license currently reads.

FYI, this is using a subversion repository.
column4: When using the "initial import" feature, an anonymous committer is automatically created which counts against your license

I'll track each of these as subtasks:

- Reduce latency, particularly for all-repository searches.
- Wherever possible, include hit in displayed results. For example, searching for author's username displays rev ids, but nothing else.
- Allow search by authors' full names.
- Allow camel-case search of filenames.
- Include results from Crucible.
- Support slashes in filename searches.
- Improve weighting of recently modified files.
- Document keywords (e.g. filename:foo.txt cs:765765).

> Do we indicate if the backup has been anonymized? Or is that something separate?

It gets printed as a warning to the console when you create the archive:

"Warning: this backup has been anonymised and should NOT be used as a backup. It does NOT contain your data."

But I agree that we should also add that to the archive meta data here.
In fact: I'll take a look to see if its possible/feasible to include the entire log/output in the archive (or otherwise at least all error/warning messages).

column3:
one of the commiters seems to be the "" empty string, and appears in all the dropdowns. this is a bug, there should never be a "" commiter

Blank (absent?) commiter names can occur in SVN when using cvs2svn (for example).

We could given blank/absent commiters the name no_author (prefered solution), or handle the construction of urls "to" blank committers.

column3: Annotation information for individual files could be stored in the infdb cache for all files or a subset of files to reduce the calculation needed get annotation or blame.\r\n\r\nOne strategy would be to cache the annotation after a set number of modifications, so there's a maximum number of steps required to generate the annotation for any file.

column3: Currently the template folder lives inside the Crucible/Fisheye home directory. This should be moved to the data directory so that each time we upgrade Crucible/Fisheye we aren't throwing away all the carefully crafted templates we made. Perhaps it could be in both, so that if they don't exist as overrides in the data folder, the defaults are used from the home directory.

column3: Currently the only way to regenerate the lucene indexes for content and diff text is to do a full repository reindex.  We should add options in the maintenance screen to reindex these components separately.

column3: Currently when we retrieve LOC data for charts or raw data export we collect all the data, then process it.  This could potentially be a lot of data using a lot of memory unnecessarily, so this should be redesigned to process data as its retrieved.

column3:
There are various existing and requested features in FE & Crucible that would benefit from quartz or equivilent. Digest emails, backups, notifications, workflow sweepers and it would be an obvious plugin point as well. 

This is a parent task, related tasks will include:

* Implement common scheduler
* Admin pages
* Retrofit existing fuctionality
* Implement at least one new feature (FE-144 for instance)
* Add plugin point, document and implement a sample plugin.

Generated from [https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-1057], can be reproduced on privateeye. 

Steps to reproduce on privateeye

1) Login as admin 
2) In Repository defaults > Properties > Edit, Set show-changelog-calendar to true. 
3) Navigate to the https://svn.atlassian.com/privateeye/changelog/private/ (i.e. the changelog tab) 

The tab will spin for ages (I did not wait to see if it would complete). 

The thread dump shows that the it is stuck in the getContainedRevisionCount method:

column3:
After creating a new repository in Fisheye, I get the following stack trace when attempting to restart the repository.

While creating the repository, I modified its trunk/tag/branch structure. I used "Test Path" to verify my regex patterns, and was presented with an error page stating that my regex was incorrectly formatted. I edited the repository and fixed the regex error. Now, I cannot restart the repository or re-index it. Its status is just "Enabled:" and the only operation available on the main admin page is "View". I have the feeling that the incorrect regex caused the repository to be created in some invalid state. Restarting Fisheye seems to have alleviated the issue -- at least, it is scanning the repository now and I can stop/start it.

column3: In the individual 'file history' view, logical view mode, a revision is shown when a branch is created that includes that file.  This is different than in the CVS mode, where branches are only included once a change is made on that branch.  FishEye should offer an option (with a globally settable default) to hide these 'branch creation' revisions, both from listing as a revision and from appearing on the 'History' graph for that file.  (I'd prefer not even having the option, and just always doing this... but I could see how some people might want it listed.)\r\n\r\nListing the branch creation revisions shows a ton of clutter on the individual file history pages and makes using them inconvenient.  (It also makes the history graphs completely unusable for projects that branch a lot.)
column4: SVN Repositories Should Hide Branch Creation Revisions From File History

column3: FishEye can be told to produce a backup, but it would be good if it can be configured to produce its own (ie daily etc).
column4: FishEye should be able to produce its own regular backup.

column3:
We should make it easier to link to JIRA. One way of doing this would be to add a JIRA linker type in addition to the simple and advanced linkers with a config screen that generates the regexp for punters.

There are two broad strategies for jira linkers:
# X chars followed by - followed by digits - e.g.  (?i)(\p{Alpha}){2,6}-\d+ 
# specific project keys - e.g. (?i)(CLOV|CRUC|FSH|FE|CEP)-\d+

1) is the simplest and suitable for most installs (maybe make the min/max issue key length configurable), however you need to use the second strategy if you have multiple Jira instances.

Ultimately it would be nice to just put in a JIRA url and auto-discover the issue keys, but it could cause more trouble than its worth (e.g. jira api not enabled, authentication, refreshing list of keys, etc).

It will also be a _good thing_ to know about jira urls for future integration features (displaying issue data in fisheye etc). 

An alternative approach would be to configure your JIRA instances separately to linkers ... ?
column4: JIRA specific linker

Currently, there isn't an updated list of Crowd build numbers (and the version that they are for) available in our documentation. It'd be great if we could get this, so that it can be used as a point of reference in the future.

Reason: 
Users are affected by the issue described here: [Error: "Table 'crowd.REMOTEGROUP' doesn't exist" After Migrating Crowd Database From Another Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=726564970]

Current outdated list: 
[Crowd Build and Version Numbers Reference|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=703401603]

Expected behavior:
Have a list of Crowd's build number similar to the following page: [Confluence build information|https://developer.atlassian.com/server/confluence/confluence-build-information]
column4: List of Crowd build numbers
