column3:
FreeIPA 3.x is a very powerful replacement for MS AD. As it turns out, it also contains a full RBAC system that has host-based differentiation capabilities.

Imagine: Individual permissions allow very granular mapping to actual functions in the Atlassian stack. Traditional Atlassian roles such as jira-administrator allow a smooth migration path for existing users. Privileges are created to map these permissions to roles. Add hosts to the mix, and roles can be differentiated by server such that the jira-administrator role can be the same everywhere, but with only certain users available to exercise a role per host.  

FreeIPA does all this out of the box. 

Crowd is great, but FreeIPA has slowly improved to where Crowd was originally going to go. FreeIPA is incredibly detailed, maybe too detailed for the beginner user. As it's turned out, they compliment each other quite remarkably! Supporting both Crowd and FreeIPA will make the Atlassian stack incredibly valuable.
column4: Support FreeIPA Roles/Permissions/Privileges

column3: From the application point of view, the creation/removal/change of an alias is perceived as a user rename. Once Crowd-to-Crowd incremental sync supports user renames, there is no need to invalidate the incremental sync anymore on alias events, they can be rewritten as application-specific rename events.
column4: Recast alias change events as user renames for incremental Crowd-to-Crowd sync

column4: Bulk Edit User Access

column3: The default value of {{0}} for {{session.validationinterval}} leads to poor performance. As the documentation says, it means that every single incoming request to the application will need to make at least one request out to Crowd. Currently when using SSO (i.e. the Crowd authenticator) it makes 2 connections to Crowd per request. One to validate the SSO token and one to get the SSO cookie configuration (see CrowdHttpAuthenticatorImpl#isAuthenticated) Since Confluence does this in a filter, it means even requests to fetch CSS, JS and other resource files make 2 requests. I measured the dashboard in Confluence 3.3 make 38 requests to Crowd in a single page load.\r\n\r\nWe should really change the default value in the bundled properties file (and update the documentation) to a non-zero value so it looks up the user from the session until the validation interval is reached.
column4: Default value of 0 for session.validationinterval leads to poor performance

column3:
The issue:

when using self signed certificates for SSL, the apache mod_authnz_crowd module (Crowd Apache Connector) rejects the certificate regardless of configuration on the crowd server.

The symptoms:

when setting CrowdURL to a https value in apache you will receive a 500 error through the browser, looking in the apache error_log you will see: "Failed to send authentication request (CURLcode 60)" - this is returned by the CURL library that the module uses to make its connection, and error code 60 from the CURL library can be found here http://curl.haxx.se/libcurl/c/libcurl-errors.html
/>
CURLE_SSL_CACERT (60) - Peer certificate cannot be authenticated with known CA certificates.

A quick look at the CURL manual (http://curl.haxx.se/libcurl/c/curl_easy_setopt.html#CURLOPTSSLVERIFYPEER) reveals: This option determines whether curl verifies the authenticity of the peer's certificate. A value of 1 means curl verifies; 0 (zero) means it doesn't.

The Solution:

See attached patch file, simple one liner fix.
column4: Crowd Apache Connector (mod_authnz_crowd) fails when using https with self signed certificates

*Steps to reproduce*
# Click Application => Add Application on the side
# Enter an application type, name, and password (anything!)
# Click Next (should be at the "Connection" tab after this)
# Enter a valid URL
# Enter a remote IP address with an IPv6 scope. E.g. "::1%2"
# Click Next

*Expected result*
Should have successfully proceeded to next step.

*Actual result*
Error message with: "You must enter a remote IP address"

If you enter a remote IP address without the scope, e.g. "::1", then it will succeed.

column3:
This is useful for the admin of bamboo to get information that something has gone wrong with the syncing (perhaps the crowd server went down)

There are two scenarios:
1) Initial sync: In this case, if there were errors the assumption is that the user base will NOT be changed (will stay on local) but page will show that errors have occurred.
2) Subsequent syncs: In this case, the page will show message that error has occurred.
column4: User Management Page: Give some indication if a sync error has occurred.

column3:
Currently says "Remote Atlassian userbase has not been refreshed. [Flush the cache|http://example.org]." 
Two issues: 
# You need to think about 'Remote Atlassian userbase' for it to make sense.
# You can't flush an empty cache.

Should say "Users and groups have not yet been loaded from the server. [Load now|http://example.org]."

Once users and groups have been loaded, we should have a message like:

"Users and groups were last synchronised at XXXX (took YYYsec). [Synchronise now|http://example.org]."

This is consistent with the synchronise terminology we use in JIRA & Conf. See attached screenshot.

If there's an error, we should say "The last synchronisation failed. See the logs for details. [Synchronise now|http://example.org]"

column3:
Crowd clients that are synchronising group memberships need access to all user and nested groups. This is currently two separate HTTP requests for each group. We should add a single resource to return everything.

Add {{usermanagement/1/group/membership}}, a resource with all membership information.

e.g.
{code}
<memberships>
 <membership group='parent-group'>
  <users>
   <user name='parent-group-user'/>
   ...
  </users>
  <groups>
   <group name='child-group'/>
   ...
  </groups>
 </membership>
 ...
</memberships>
{code}
column4: Create a REST resource for group membership of all users and child groups

column3: Currently we use cn attribute for group names, but this value is not always unique, which is a requirement for successful synchronisation. We already use sAMAccountName for user names. We also need to add a Group Name RDN attribute, and change SpringLDAPConnector#addGroup to use it when generating dn.

column3:
For Studio Rise of the Machines, we require a version of CrowdService that is able to filter out certain groups.  This CrowdService should accept a list of groups to filter out in search, findByName and other operations.

The following are the guidelines about how to handle filtered groups.

{{addGroup}} will throw an OperationFailedException (runtime exception version).
All other operations will behave as though the group does not exist: {{getGroup}}, {{getGroupWithAttributes}}, {{search}}, {{isUserMemberOfGroup}}, {{isGroupMemberOfGroup}}, {{updateGroup}}, {{addUserToGroup}}, {{addGroupToGroup}}, {{setGroupAttribute}}, {{removeGroupAttributes}}, {{removeAllGroupAttributes}}, {{removeGroup}}, {{removeUserFromGroup}}, {{removeGroupFromGroup}}, {{isUserDirectGroupMember}}, {{isGroupDirectGroupMember}}
column4: Create a version of CrowdService that performs filtering

column3:
Crowd's password encoders should be marked as system plugins so that they appear as such in Confluence/JIRA.

Crowd does not bundle the UPM, so this issue isn't as prevalent in Crowd, but embedded Crowd apps will display the encoders as a user "installed plugin". Disabling the password encoders plugin will mean that users will be unable to authenticate into the app, which is a serious consequence.

This should fix: http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFDEV-2434
column4: Crowd's password encoder plugins should be marked as system plugins

column3:
After upgrading to the latest version of ehcache, ensure that the "phone-home" feature is disabled.

Ehcache 1.7.0+ will periodically phone home and emit a log message if there is a newer version available. This isn't a useful check when ehcache is shipped as a library in another product.
column4: Upgrade ehcache and disable phone-home timers

column3:
If the user or group does not exist, the remove method should return silently.

For individual remove operations, a boolean should be returned to indicate whether a removal operation occurred.

This affects RemoteDirectory, UserDao, GroupDao, InternalRemoteDirectory

Consider doing the same for membership removal operations as well (e.g. {{RemoteDirectory#removeGroupFromGroup}} should not throw {{MembershipNotFoundException}}, etc).

The Bamboo Jmeter Plugin can interpret CSV data: https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/wiki/display/JMETAGG/Bamboo+JMeter+Aggregator+Plugin

If we spit out a one-line CSV that has of the form: 10k load gen, 2k ou swap, 1k to 10k, etc

then we will be able to aggregate statistics over builds, so that we can visualise any performance regressions.

If we have issues with this, the best person to ask for help is James Roper.

column3:
Authentication should skip over failing directory in ApplicationServiceGeneric.authenticateUser().

This means:
- we should catch (swallow) OperationFailedException, log it as an error
- if we do run into an OperationFailedException AND the user is not authenticated successfully in any other directory, then we throw the first OperationFailedException we run into
-- this will also require changes to the catch block of InvalidAuthenticationException, ie. we need to unit test this one pretty thoroughly
- if possible, we should write an integration test for this behaviour
- we should update the javadoc

column3:
A bit worried about the LDAP connection pool code (in CrowdAdminServiceImpl):

* Firstly it seems that getSystemConnectionPoolProperties() could be called before the System Properties are initialised by getApplication().
* Secondly CrowdAdminServiceImpl.getApplication() lazily initialises the system properties but CrowdServiceImpl.getApplication() does not.

Was there a reason not to just eagerly initialise the SystemConnectionPoolProperties in the constructor?
Why are we setting System properties rather than just reading and merging with DB properties?
(Can this sometimes fail? eg with security settings)
column4: Review the initialisation of LDAP Connection Pool settings in the system properties

column3:
Crowd performs case-insensitive comparisons of user/group name by:
1) String.toLowerCase and comparing the lowercase values
2) String.compareToIgnoreCase

This is inconsistent and produces an ordering/equality based on the system locale.

We should to using a single form of normalising user/group names for case-insensitive comparison, for a specific locale:

{code}
String.toLowerCase(FIXED_LOCALE)
{code}

This method should be available on a util class. The FIXED_LOCALE should default to Locale.ENGLISH.

This affects equals, hashcode, compareTo and comparators for domain objects with case-insensitive/case-preserving name schemes.

If Crowd 2.1 users are on a system locale that's not compatible with Locale.ENGLISH, then:
1) They would be able to export their data to XML and re-import it, so the normalisation process happens in Locale.ENGLISH for Crowd 2.2
2) We could allow them to specify an override for the FIXED_LOCALE via a system property
column4: Case-insensitive String comparison is not tied to a locale

This improvement request is based on [this bug|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CWD-1655], which makes the test search fail via the "Configuration" tab.
The above options like the "Active Directory Connector" configuration, helps in resolving the problem for "Delegated" configuration too by using the following workaround, as suggested by a customer:
{quote}
I found a workaround, by tweaking the database (cwd_directory_attribute) table.
I set: 
ldap.pagedresults to 'true' (was 'false'
I added 'ldap.pagedresults.size' with value '999'.

This makes the directory attribute similar for 'AD' and 'Deletaged AD'.
{quote}

column3:
The bug occurs when the user performs a search on LDAP and *all* of the following conditions are satisfied:
* LDAP directory supports paged results
* total number of results is greater than {{maxResults}} parameter
* {{startIndex}} is greater than 0

When the conditions above are satisfied, the user will receive less than the desired number of results.
column4: Spring LDAP Connector will sometimes give less than desired number of results when LDAP directory supports paged results

column3:
Taken verbatim from http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257346810&#257346810

Hey All,

Ive created a patch against Crowd-Apache-Connector (http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CROWD/Integrating+Crowd+with+Apache)

To allow Idle session timeouts in basic http auth.

It does this by maintaining a Cache::FileCache table (the same as Crowds auth cache).

The session is based on the remote ip (fetched from the apache request object) and the supplied username.
It performs the session check AFTER they have been successfully authenticated..this is to stop storing sessions on random user connects.

Configuration is pretty simple and by default idle session timeouts are disabled.

Id like for Atlassian to include this patch in further versions of the crowd apache connector as this allows basic http auth with crowd in apache to be compliant for things like PCI DSS which requires idle sessions be logged out.

Documentation:
New configuration options are added to support this:
PerlSetVar CrowdIdleSessionsEnabled off
PerlSetVar CrowdIdleSessionsTimeout 300
PerlSetVar CrowdIdleSessionsLocation /tmp/CrowdIdleSessionsCache

I should also note, currently sessions do not expire...this is because technically someone could leave an authenticated browser open for an indefinite time and if the session has been cleaned up then they can refresh and still be authenticated...

UPDATE: Noticed a bug in checking if CrowdIdleSessionsEnabled was set to off it wasnt taking effect. have uploaded v2 which fixes this
Any Questions/Criticisms please let me know.

Cheers
Brendan
column4: Patch for Crowd authentication within apache for idle session timeouts

column3:
Crowd's LDAP RemoteDirectory implementations throw ObjectNotFoundExceptions instead of the appropriate UserNotFoundException/GroupNotFoundException.

To make things even harder, the problem cannot be statically detected because ONFE is now a RuntimeException.

All of the RemoteDirectory LDAP implementations need to be reviewed and fixed accordingly, including unit tests and integration tests.
column4: Crowd's LDAP RemoteDirectory implementations throw ObjectNotFoundExceptions

column3: It would be great if Crowd could support wildcards in the IPs of trusted proxy servers, for example, {{127.0.0.\*}}.  This is useful in deployment situations where multiple tomcats, bound to port 8080 on different loopback interfaces, all starting with {{127.0.0.\*}}, are being served through mod proxy on Apache.

column3:
When the User does not exist in the Delegated Directory and Crowd finds him in LDAP, the user is correctly added to Crowd's DB, however, the JIRA App Cache is not Updated.

*Possible consequences:*
# The user can login, but will not be a member of the *jira-users* group
# Sometimes the user can't login

\
*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Delete the test user from Crowd delegatedDirectory. The directory is configured to automatically add jira-users group membership on new user creation in the local group memberships directory.
# Restart Crowd, JIRA, and start up Confluence. We log into JIRA as an administrator account, and view the user browser. The test user is not present. Log out of the administrator account, and then log in with the test user.
# The test user authenticates, but does not gain group membership of jira-users. The user does belong to confluence-users, however.
# The test user then authenticates to Confluence. This is successful, and the user belongs to both jira-users and confluence-users.
# The test user logs out of JIRA, and back into JIRA, but still does not have jira-users membership. Verifying in Crowd, the user now exists and owns both jira-users and confluence-users.
# After restarting JIRA, the test user can now log into JIRA, and has membership of both groups.
column4: Crowd Integration Cache for JIRA is not updated

column3:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 8 June 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hello everyone,

We have recently reviewed this issue and the overall interest in the problem. As the issue hasn't collect votes, watchers, comments, or support cases from many customers during its lifetime, it's very low on our priority list, and will not be fixed in the foreseeable future. That's why we've decided to resolve it as *Timed Out*.

Although we're aware the issue is still important to those of you who were involved in the conversations around it, we want to be clear in managing your expectations. The Crowd team is focusing on issues that have broad impact and high value, reflected by the number of comments, votes, support cases, and customers interested. Please consult the [Atlassian Bugfix Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-server-bug-fix-policy-201294573.html] for more details.

We understand how disappointing this decision may be, but we hope you'll appreciate our transparent approach and communication.

Atlassian will continue to watch this issue for further updates, so please feel free to share your thoughts in the comments.

Thank you,

Crowd Team
{panel}
 

Greetings, 

I've noticed this issue in the past, but didn't know what was causing it until I sat down to figure it out today.  

When an entry is created in an OpenLDAP-backed directory, it is generally given a schema with only the objectClass of inetOrgPerson.  This works sufficiently in a standalone configuration, but as soon as the directory is used more exhaustively, problems arise.  

Here is the Apache DS console output created while adding the posixAccount objectClass and it's MUST attributes to an entity created by Crowd:

{noformat}
#!RESULT ERROR
#!CONNECTION ldap://dev.itdatabase.com:389
#!DATE 2009-11-27T16:15:37.605
#!ERROR [LDAP: error code 20 - modify/add: objectClass: value #0 already exists]
dn: cn=brian,ou=people,dc=itdatabase,dc=com
changetype: modify
add: uid
uid: topping
-
add: gidNumber
gidNumber: 500
-
add: objectClass
objectClass: top
objectClass: posixAccount
-
add: homeDirectory
homeDirectory: /home/topping
-
{noformat}

This leads to #!ERROR [LDAP: error code 20 - modify/add: objectClass: value #0 already exists]

With some experimentation, it's clear that this failure does not occur if the entity is created with all the inheritors of inetOrgPerson.  This is true for both JXplorer and Apache DS Studio, so it is not like this is a problem isolated to a single browser.

Would it be possible for Crowd to start creating entities with the top, person and organizationalPerson objectClasses as well?
column4: Crowd creates insufficient schema in new user entities with OpenLDAP

column3:
To Reproduce:

1-) Create a new LDAP Connector and provide all the necessary fields (including the password)
2-) Before saving (_Continue_ button), click on the _Test Connection_ button.
3-) If the connection is successful (don't click _Continue_ until it is successful) click Continue.
4-) Go to the Users menu and try to search. The following error will be displayed:

{noformat}
Uncategorized exception occurred during LDAP processing; nested exception is javax.naming.NamingException: [LDAP: error code 1 - 00000000: LdapErr: DSID-0C090627, comment: In order to perform this operation a successful bind must be completed on the connection., data 0, vece�]; remaining name 'dc=sydney, dc=atlassian, dc=com'
{noformat}

5-) To fix the problem, go to the Connector, provide a password and then click _Update_
6-) Try to search Users again; the search will work without any problem.
column4: LDAP Connectors are saved without the User DN password if the *Test Connection* button is used before saving

column3:
There are two of the entries below in the web.xml:

<filter-mapping>
    <filter-name>johnson</filter-name>
    <url-pattern>/console/*</url-pattern>
</filter-mapping>

WebLogic will not deploy crowd until one of these is manually removed because the validation rules for web.xml in WebLogic do not allow this. This may or may not be a problem for other application servers.

Obviously this is easy to work around but it would be nice if it could be removed permanently.
column4: Duplicate filter-mapping in web.xml

column3: Currently, the Crowd installation process requires you to enter a database username and password. This prevents SQL Server users from using IWA (NTLM / Kerberos) to connect to the server, in violation of best practices on the Windows platform.\r\n\r\nWe should make username and password optional for SQL Server (or for all DBs?). Also need to make sure that Crowd continues to operate properly without a DB username & password.
column4: Make database username and password optional so SQL Server users can use IWA

column3: Creating a user without a password is not possible in Crowd. The clients will get an exception if trying to do this (expected behaviour).\r\n\r\nThe Problem is that JIRA, Confluence, Bamboo, etc requires the ability to add a user without a password being supplied, due to the OSUser and AtlassianUser interfaces.

column3: Table names are currently upper case. To match our other products (like JIRA) we will change the convention to lower case table names.

column3: When you search for a user/group and need to apply a disjunctive restriction to attributes, it is possible that the same entity will be returned twice in the result set. This is why a SELECT DISTINCT is performed. Internally, the DISTINCT operation on the database could generally be implemented by using sort on all fields prior to a cull. This process is expensive.\r\n\r\nSince we only need to DISTINCT when we do a join with a custom attributes table, we should optimise for the non-custom-attribute restriction path and not DISTINCT unless custom attributes are involved.
column4: HQLQueryTranslator needs to review usages of "distinct"

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 8 June 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hello everyone,

We have recently reviewed this issue and the overall interest in the problem. As the issue hasn't collect votes, watchers, comments, or support cases from many customers during its lifetime, it's very low on our priority list, and will not be fixed in the foreseeable future. That's why we've decided to resolve it as *Timed Out*.

Although we're aware the issue is still important to those of you who were involved in the conversations around it, we want to be clear in managing your expectations. The Crowd team is focusing on issues that have broad impact and high value, reflected by the number of comments, votes, support cases, and customers interested. Please consult the [Atlassian Bugfix Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-server-bug-fix-policy-201294573.html] for more details.

We understand how disappointing this decision may be, but we hope you'll appreciate our transparent approach and communication.

Atlassian will continue to watch this issue for further updates, so please feel free to share your thoughts in the comments.

Thank you,

Crowd Team
{panel}

column3:
JIRA calls {{findAllPrincipalNames()}}, then iterates over each username, asking for the user object.

Since {{findAllPrincipalNames()}} is implemented as a call to {{searchPrincipals()}} which fetches all the user details, we should optimise this code path by adding replacing the code that performs this in the crowd-integration-client with a call to {{searchPrincipals()}}.

This will make life much better for LDAP (particularly AD), and custom directory users.
column4: Improve JIRA integration by consolidating the findAllPrincipalNames() call with the individual calls to retrieve users.

column3:
Crowd currently uses remote-ip and X-Forwarded-For in the crowd.token validation factors. This is of course the appropriate default behavior. By binding a cookie.token to the client machine you prevent stolen cookies being useful.

However, there are some circumstances where you are willing to relax ip-binding check in order to achieve other goals, or to operate within other constraints. Examples are:
- large proxying firewalls where requests from the same browser might be served by different proxy ip addresses. This is not uncommon in large corporate environments.
- you are trying to achieve SSO between two crowd-enabled apps, where one app is behind Apache using AJP13 and the other is using HTTP ProxyPass. In this environment, AJP13 puts the correct remote-ip in the validation factors, where as ProxyPass puts the incorrect remote ip but a suitable X-Forwarded-For. This makes the validation factors incompatible and makes SSO unachievable. (This point relates to CWD-541.)
- you have users with mobile devices (laptops, those funny iPhone thingies) where moving between wifi access points, or moving from work to home, means a different IP and an invalid crowd.token. It would be nice to enable "remote ip check-less" or "mobile" mode for these users.

What I would like to see is a checkbox for disabling "use remote IP as a validation factor". This would cause Crowd to ignore remote-ip and X-Forwarded-For when looking at validation factors. I'm not sure where this checkbox would go, some combination of these?
- globally?
- per directory?
- per application?
- per user (or group of users)?

The default behavior of this checkbox should definitely, of course, be enabled. But I think there is a case where users may want to knowingly disable it in order to achieve SSO in their environment.
column4: Add toggle to turn off checking of remote-ip in Validation Factors

If you have a JIRA instance using Crowd, you can add your users via JIRA. JIRA has the following feature [http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/group_management.html#automatic_group_membership] which will automatically add users to a list of given groups.

column3:
The Apache connector needs to get the principal's group memberships when working out authorisation for subversion. All the other SOAP calls to Crowd are cached by the connector but this one (findGroupMemberships) isn't. The result can be slow performance browsing svn repositories (see CWDSUP-650).

A principal's group membership should be cached as well.
column4: Apache connector doesn't cache group membership lookups

column3:
What we would like to do is to monitor access patterns to our extranet to spot intrusions, intrusion attempts. So far we are goind this by analyzing the logs of our central inbound proxy server and correlating users, source IP domains and other information.
With CROWD we gained a central authetication point that records all authentication requests which is great.

However there are a few things that could be improved:
 * It would be nice if CROWD could write a simple audit trail that just records: username, requesting IP (the IP of the applications user, not the application), application and possibly requested information. Preferably in a format a la common log format so that it can be easily processed.
* We can extract this from the current logs (it is a little bit more complicated, but for this god gave us Perl). However what CROWD does not log is the IP of the reuqesting user. Looking at the SOAP API, this information is never given to CROWD. So I suggest to extend the API. This would also allow (possible) CROWD plugins that can enforce IP ranges.
column4: Support traceability of autehtication request to enable intrustion detection and forensics -> add requesting IP to authenticatePrincipal and add analyzable logs

column3:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 18th March 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi,

I wanted to let you know that we have released cross-domain Single Sign-On in [Crowd Data Center 3.4|https://confluence.atlassian.com/crowd/crowd-3-4-release-notes-966041084.html] that includes Remember me functionality.

You can download Crowd Data Center from here: https://www.atlassian.com/software/crowd/download/data-center

Please note that in order to use cross-domain Single Sign-On in Crowd with Remember me functionality you will need Crowd Data Center license.

You can create your evaluation license for Crowd Data Center here https://my.atlassian.com/license/evaluation

If you need any assistance with the Crowd Data Center installation you can follow our Getting started guide https://confluence.atlassian.com/crowd/installing-crowd-data-center-935369773.html

We hope that you will enjoy it as much as we do!

Please reply directly to my email to share your feedback or just add your comments in this ticket. We'd love to hear your thoughts!

Best regards,

Marek Radochonski
Senior Product Manager, Crowd
mradochonski@atlassian.com
 
{panel}


Currently, "remember me" / "auto login"  has to be handled on the client side.

It would be nice is this was a feature of the server so that all clients (applications) can make use of the functionality, eg. clients could have a "remember me" checkbox on their login page - this parameter would passed to Crowd and the Crowd server can handle the auto login.

Clients should be able use this feature via SOAP and as a convenience method in the Java HttpAuthenticator.
column4: Implement RememberMe / AutoLogin as a service call in the Crowd Server

column3:
An apache authentication module needs to be programmed to support Crowd.

This will involve writing a C/C++ client that will call the /crowd/services/SecurityServer?wsdl and authenticate a user through http-form based authentication.

The SecurityServerClient can serve as a good starting point for how to connect to the security server, get a valid authentication token and then query if the user has a valid username and password.

This following how-tos describes how the LDAP module works, which would be similar to the Crowd Java integration libraries. Based on the path/host/url Apache would use Crowd to validate through a positive authentication if the user is allowed to access a particular resource. Once the authentication is verified, no validation between request would be necessary as apache can handle if this is a continuous web session.

* http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.0/mod/mod_auth_ldap.html
* http://gentoo-wiki.com/HOWTO_Apache2_and_mod_auth_ldap

column3:
When subtask creation fails Crucible reports: "Error creating subtask in JIRA: Unknown error creating subtask for issue STUFF-1: null" This is because the error message appears in JIRA like this: {noformat}

pid: Anonymous users do not have permission to create issues in this project. Please try logging in first.

{noformat} So the pattern {{"]+class="errMsg">(.+?)<\/span>"}} (JiraIssueImpl.java:225) doesn't find it. We should change the Map containing regexes to contain a list of regexes, which would also simplify our treatment of keys for 4.1 vs later JIRA versions.
column4: Subtask creation doesn't extract error messages from JIRA 4.2

column3:
Due to using a PhraseQuery when searching, and the fact we index each character for every single file name, a long query string will take much longer to search than a shorter one. 

e.g. 9000ms (83 results) https://atlaseye-qa.atlassian.com/atlaseye/qsearch?q=ConfluenceActionSupport.properties&t=fd&repository=

c.f. 800ms (29055 results) https://atlaseye-qa.atlassian.com/atlaseye/qsearch?q=Action&t=fd&repository=


Investigate if it would be ok to only do sub-word substring matching using n-grams.
http://lucene.apache.org/java/3_0_0/api/all/org/apache/lucene/analysis/ngram/EdgeNGramTokenizer.html

The following file would be analyzed like so:
AbstractContentFactory: 

Abstract: a, ab, abs, abst...
Content: c, co, con, cont...
Factory: f, fa, fac, fact...
AbstractContentFactory: a, ab, abs, abst... abstractc, abstractco, .... abstractcontentfactory


This would mean the following queries would match this document:

ACF, AbConFacto, *Factory, abstract, abs, abstractcontent, fac, factory, AbsFac

And these would not match the document:

acf, tent, entFac, entFac*, *entFac, confact, FacAbs, your mum
column4: The longer the query, the slower the search.

column3: There could be a problem in how we are checking for a repository that is running when doing a search. This can cause intermittent outages of results for the repo when it is doing an incremental update, say.

This was happening when a committer used one capitalisation to commit (eg BobSmith) then later replaced lines using another capitalisation (bobsmith), so in the second commit the net loc change for Bob Smith was 0. column3:
When you write a comment, the details panel doesn't update your last comment or number of comments.

Screenshot:  Nick (currentUser()) has a general comment, but the details table shows blanks for him.

Not sure this is trivial to fix: 

The Comment object needs a field linking it to its author so we can update the table without an AJAX request.  Currently that data is only stored in the response object from the AJAX request to reload comments.

Alternatively, we can decorate the current user's row in the table with a "me" class and then update that row as the current user makes changes.  This method makes the defect/comment listing a bit harder though because we'd have to parse the "2 (1 defect)" string.  Also not as clean.
column4: Details table not updated when you write a comment.

column3: Currently crucible.css is overwriting a lot of the css rules from style.css that pertain to the directory navigation tree in the left column.  For example, crucible has ".tree span.folder" as "display: block" where FE is leaving it as the default inline.  FE has 2px more left padding on filenames than Crucible.\r\n\r\nIt should be pretty straightforward to get these back into a shared set of CSS rules which would reduce code and maintenance cost.
column4: Code Debt: Crucible and FishEye should share more CSS Rules

Follow changes that have meant that non-required AUI styles have been added to our products, a regression in the Firebug warning has occurred:
!http://img.skitch.com/20100901-dm4669ckifkixuy6dgc75tfdhk.jpg!

Its not as simple as merely accepting their style carte blanche as they use a different implementation and so there are UI side effects:

!http://img.skitch.com/20100901-ps3442p883uqndrs44bghiems8.jpg!

We need to remove our style and apply some additional to correct the UI glitches.

column3:
Automagically detect which branch is trunk for the branch selector. For example:
- Default (Hg)
- Master/Mainline (Git)
- Trunk (svn)
etc
column4: Branch selector: detect the default branch

column3:
!http://img.skitch.com/20100829-mgc8wu9nk7dsf2myyjcf2bemtw.jpg!

- Panel above file tree affects all content below this point (both left and right panes)
- The statistics tab will remain there on the left for now, and will also be filtered by the branch selector
- *NOTE:* If FE cannot determine the trunk of a repo, the admin system will need to prompt the user to tell it which directory is the trunk when first adding the repo. For customers who are already set up and upgrade, but for some reason it's not picking up trunk, we should display a message where the tree is supposed to appear. Something like: "FishEye cannot determine the main branch of your repository. Please log into the admin system and select this project's main branch"
- FE attempts to select a "home branch" for the "branches" selector. This will be done by detecting which branch, other than trunk, the user has last committed to. If the user has never committed to a branch on this repo, then the branch selector simply says "Branch: select... ▾"
- Once the user sets their "home branch" this control will become sticky (via a cookie pref)
- The branch selector will be a combined type-ahead and pull-down control
- The branch selector will need to show some sort of path in case you have more than one branch with the same name in different locations
- Q: Should we also include tags in this selector, or should we move them to within the cog tool menu?
- Once a branch is indicated in this selector, it will only show the branch name, not the path
- A pencil icon will appear to the right of a branch selector with a branch name in it indicating to the user the selector is editable.
- Clicking on the pencil should clear the selection and activate the type-ahead control, but have an "x" escape route if the user does not wish to change the branch
- Clicking on the "x" will return the selection to it's former state
- If the branch is currently selected, clicking on the branch selector (not the pencil) will do nothing
- If the trunk is currently selected, clicking on the branch selector (not the pencil) refreshes the page, filtering all views to the selected branch
column4: Create an advanced branch selector

column3:

As a result the last column content align right and slide waaay over to the right hand edge of the screen.

column3:
Currently, when FishEye is started for the very first time, it needs to transform our OSGi bundles using BND.

This consumes around 87% of the overall time it takes to start FishEye!

We should investigate using BND at build time to transform the bundled plugins.

There is an Ant Task that may help with this: http://www.aqute.biz/Code/Bnd#ant .
column4: Transform our bundled plugins at build time, instead of on first startup time

column3: With the move to scrolling pages the current fixed table head solution isn't required and hadn't been implemented consistently.\r\n\r\nRemove the current calls to add the faux heads and add any styles as needed now that the page's native THEAD is visible.

column3:
Steps to reproduce:

# Use a query like: 

{code}
select revisions from dir /path/to/dir/ where is head and path like fileX and not in review Review
{code}

# make sure the latest revision of fileX is not in reviewX 
# make sure some other revision of fileX is in reviewX
# the query should return the latest revision of fileX
# now add the latest revision of fileX to the review. 
# refresh the query and fileX should not be returned
# remove all other revisions of fileX from the review, excluding head
# now the query will return the latest revision of fileX again, which is {color:red}incorrect{color}.

Reported via atlassian forums: http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257330673

2) Rationalise code to one copy across the sites,
3) Remove redundant code, and
4) Only call the method when its required

column3:
Whilst crucible emits ReviewUpdatedEvents for things as trivial as a review name change, no event is emitted when the content of a review changes.

*Proposed solution A*: add a new event class, ReviewContentUpdatedEvent, and emit those when review contents are changed.
Why not just emit more ReviewUpdatedEvents ? Because it is nice to be able to distinguish between content changes and details changes.  
*Proposed solution B*: just emit more ReviewUpdatedEvents.
column4: Crucible doesn't emit any events when content is added or removed from a review.

column3:
Each time FishEye needs the contents of a revision, it fetches it from the underlying SCM system.

FishEye should use some sort of per-repository, LRU, space-limited cache of the contents of revisions.
We should independently cache the text and binary versions of files (text versions are requested much more frequently)
Consider gz compression of files.
Consider reusing the file-on-disk when returning the StreamIndexedLineReader so as to reduce double-copying.
The cache state should be preserved across FishEye restarts.

The default size of this cache (per repository) should be 500MB. It should be customizable in the admin.
column4: disk-based bounded cache of the contents of revisions in FE

column3:
FE-2273 implemented a check where the list of "all users" in the Crowd application was filtered by the authorized-groups returned by Crowd.

The problem is, the Directories associated with an Application in Crowd can be marked "allow all users", and we don't check for that.

We need a better way to ask Crowd for the list of all users visible by this Application.
column4: Crowd-authentication is still not correctly respecting the list of "authorized users"

column3:
At present, QuickNav matches directory paths which contain the same set of path components, so the query a/b/c will match a/c/b a/x/c/y/z and so on. 
Each component is a prefix match, so a/b/c will also match boo/aha/cor. 
Each component may also do camel case matching, so a component AnB matches An*B*

We could make this behaviour more antglob like by:

1. ignoring components which are just * or **
2. Not doing prefix matches unless there is an explicit trailing *
3. Allowing leading and internal *s
column4: [QuickNav] support Ant globs for paths

In our environment, we have a team of "Reviewers" that will pick-up code to review by creating the reviews and reviewing the code.  Thus, the "reviewer" is always the "moderator" and there are no reviewers per-se, just the moderator and author.  When the reviewer completes his review, but (for some reason) then decides to "Uncomplete" his/her review, the following error is displayed when clicking the Uncomplete button:
"There was an error in the response from the server.
Refresh the page before posting more comments.
Click 'show details' for more information.
Show details
Details:
The reported problem was:
Error 1
The supplied participant is not a reviewer.
You are running release CR2.0.3 FE2.0.3 (build-417 2009-08-17), please report your release number when reporting bugs. "
This was received

column3:
Users often complain to admins that the index appears stuck, when actually it is not. 

This is because the large changelog that it is working does not change e.g. "Creating changeset 17 " (the files it is processing under the change log changes, however is only shown in the admin page). 

We should update the fisheye browse page to show a more accurate picture of the status, and make the things that get updated quickly (such as the current file that is being indexed) more prominent then those things that change less frequently such as changeset number, so that users/admin have a better idea of the current status.

column3:
The SQL upgrade task produces incorrect results for {{sql/HSQL/upgrade/upgrade_36.sql}} and so all reviews will look like they were created by the first user. 

The bug is in the following: 

{code:sql}insert into new_cru_state_change (select cru_id, cru_time_stamp, cru_superseded, cru_review_id,cru_new_state,
  (SELECT p.cru_user FROM cru_review_participant p WHERE cru_review_id = p.cru_review_id AND p.cru_moderator = true limit 1) from cru_state_change);{code}

The nested query seems to be joining on itself {{cru_review_id = p.cru_review_id}}. 

Changing the statement to the following fixes it:

{code:sql}insert into new_cru_state_change (select cru_id, cru_time_stamp, cru_superseded, cru_review_id,cru_new_state,
  (SELECT p.cru_user FROM cru_review_participant p WHERE cs.cru_review_id = p.cru_review_id AND p.cru_moderator = true limit 1) from cru_state_change cs);{code}

column3:
Related to support issue  https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CRC-501

The efficiency of the author blame calculation is bad in some situations, particularly on incremental updates to files that have been edited many times.  There's a couple of things that could be done to address this:
* cache the blame every 10 revisions, so that when calculating the blame there's an upper limit of ancestor files you need to calculate the blame for
* Re-write the applyHunksToSpans in AuthorLinecountCalculator to be N rather than -N^2- N^3
* Consolidate the blame chunks either constantly or periodically
column4: FE - address performance issues in author blame loc slurp

column3:
If you get the details of a review which has a patch, 

E.g.

[http://localhost:8060/rest-service/reviews-v1/CR-63/details]

You get:

{code:xml}
...
<patchUrl>/cru/CR-63/downloadPatch/1/TAC-1513-patch.txt</patchUrl>
...
{code}

I.e the url includes "downloadPatch" with capital P, however going to this url gives a 404 because the crucible action:

{code:xml}
<action name="downloadpatch" class="com.cenqua.crucible.actions.DownloadPatchAction">
            <result name="success" type="stream">
                <param name="contentType">${contentType}</param>
            </result>
            <result name="error" type="dispatcher">/WEB-INF/jsp/crucible/common/generalError.jsp</result>
        </action>
{code}

is for downloadpatch.

column3: As part of the new backup/restore mechanism, the TCP-based remote command code has been modified to use socket.shutdownOutput() when sending a command to the server (backup/restores relies on the connection to be closed). column3:
This is a catch-all jira for the process of rebuilding the FishEye site to enable us have flexibility, accessibility, and a 2.0 approach.

The end result will deliver a site in Semantic HTML that is based on reusable components, AJS (Atlassian JS), jQuery, and advanced CSS.
Success will see the site better able to respond to company needs for growth and change.

Sub tasks will include:
1) Rebuild page as a template
2) Create a mirror page for each on the current site - use broad strokes, first pass to include H1 for purpose, then flesh out from there.
3) Create a set of component widgets to reuse.
4) Update any behaviour JavaScript to jQuery and/or AJS as appropriate
5) Update any ajax
column4: Mirror FishEye site in Semantic HTML, jQuery, AJS, and 2.0 CSS

- Crucible and Fisheye config.xml is not backwards compatible.

- Add a version line to the config.xml that shows ether:
-- Version this config file will run with 
-- Version this config file is compatible with

column3:
Hitting "Post" or "Save as Draft" before the *first* autosave ajax request returns results in a spurious second comment because both posts are sent without a comment id.

Possible strategies:

# trigger an autosave on the first keypress and disable the buttons until it returns with a commentid.
# detect when the first autosave has been triggered but not returned and wait for the commentid before posting
column4: Autosave race condition

column3:
DiffHelper.getDiffExp() currently returns null when one of the specified revisions is non-text. However:

 Tom Davies  [ #permalink | (19 October 2008, 19:01)  ]   	 ^  v   	    	 Reply
Can we not return a DiffExplorer which shows the contents of the new file?
Or at least does something sensible -- even changing the DiffExplorer interface to provide a reason why the diff can't be seen? I'd be more comfortable with something like that than null.

Also see: https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-666#c5323
column4: Let DiffExplorer support non-text files

column3: CountStatesOn uses the StateChangeLog to determine the number of reviews in a particular state at a particular time. This requires a sub-select that takes a long time to complete.\r\n\r\ndue to database limitations we can't use a more efficient limit one, order by to get the last state change. {panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51035].
  {panel}

Team Calendars will always have limited "Advanced" editing possibilities, but luckily we can export and import (using ics files).

However there seems not to exist a 'remove all events' feature. This is needed if one performed major updates (i.e. replaced a single word in all events)

As a result one needs to remove the whole calendar and add the import the updated ics file to a new calendar. This has several unwanted side affects:
* breaks all existing user subscriptions / configurations (like color selection)
* breaks all watches
* on deletion an ics file is sent to all subscribers. They don't understand why this is and it's obviously not interesting to them.

To complete the circle an email could be sent to the watchers that this calendar is re-imported (I don't think it'll be a requirement to know the exact differences)
column4: Allow Remove all items (maybe just on import?)

column3:
h3. Problem Statement
Repeating events showing 1 hour difference before and after the DST change when Google/Yahoo calendar subscribes Team Calendar.

h3. Steps to replicate

# Set your Confluence timezone to {{(GMT+0100) Amsterdam, Berlin, Bern, Rome, Stockholm, Vienna}}
# Create a calendar in Team Calendar with the timezone (Europe/Vienna +0100)
# Go to October 2015, create a daily repeating event with time before 25th of October and ends at 31st of October.
# Note that Team Calendar shows all the repeating events at the same time.
# Right click the calendar and click subscribe and copy the link.
# Go to your Google/Yahoo calendar and set your timezone to Vienna (GMT+1). Under the "other calendar" add the URL and wait for it to load.
# You will find that the events before 25th October displays the time correctly. Events after 25th will show 1 hour earlier.

h3. Important things to note
# DST for Vienna ends at 25th October
# This only happens for repeating events
column4: Daylight saving time causing 1 hour difference between Team Calendar with other calendars (Google, Yahoo)

column3:
There is a TimeoutException that happens sometimes on Confluence Startup when Synchrony doesn't start within its timeout limit. This is a result of fixing a deadlock in Tomcat with the Synchrony Proxy webapp by dropping the timeout from 30 seconds to 10. 

We should get rid of this TimeoutException, either by increasing the timeout back to 30 seconds, or by simply removing that block altogether, if it's not really required.
{code:java}
2016-12-20 12:19:20,701 WARN [lifecycle:thread-20] [plugins.synchrony.bootstrap.SynchronyInteropBootstrap] onStart An exception occurred while waiting for Synchrony to start: Timeout waiting for task.
2016-12-20 12:19:20,702 DEBUG [lifecycle:thread-20] [plugins.synchrony.bootstrap.SynchronyInteropBootstrap] onStart Details:
java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException: Timeout waiting for task.{code}
The timeout doesn't actually affect Synchrony's operation. It will still start normally after that.
column4: Fix Synchrony Process Manager TimeoutException on Confluence start.

column3: The context path of Synchrony can be overridden by the system property synchrony.context.path (since 6.0.4) or reza.context.path (on 6.0.3 and below). Synchrony will fail to start up if that value of this system property is, for example, "sync". The correct value is "/sync".
column4: Synchrony will fail to start up if the user overrides the context path of Synchrony with a string not starting with a forward slash

column3: Currently, the JVM parameters used to configure Synchrony begin with 'synchrony.\*' for Data Centre, yet these same parameters are currently 'reza.\*' for Server (though not all of them have been implemented in Server). This can be a little confusing for customers.
column4: Support both "synchrony." and the "reza." system properties for overriding the Synchrony configuration
Remove the healthcheck for the synchrony-proxy webapp when Confluence is started up and monitor the proxy's running status
Use HTTP and localhost as the scheme and hostname when checking the proxy webapp's running state

column3:
Tomcat is not able to start the synchrony-proxy webapp before Confluence does the healthcheck on the proxy (race condition). Therefore, Confluence fails to enable the proxy mode and still uses the original /synchrony path and original port (8091 by default).
h4. *Workaround*

Restart Synchrony in the Confluence's Collaborative Editing screen will enable the internal proxy mode again.
column4: With the the system property synchrony.proxy.enabled is set (to true), the proxy won't be enabled after a Tomcat restart until we restart Synchrony

column3:
When trying to collaboratively Edit a page, an error can occur when the browser attempts to connect to Synchrony. This occurs when using Confluence's internal proxy due to exceeding the requestBufferSize of 4092 bytes.

!image-2016-09-16-17-34-42-611.png!

*Workaround*

To increase the request buffer size, edit <install-directory>/synchrony-proxy/WEB-INF and add the following parameter (after the maxThreads parameter):
{code:java}
        <init-param>
            <param-name>requestBufferSize</param-name>
            <param-value>8092</param-value>
        </init-param>


{code}
Save the file and then restart Confluence.
column4: Cannot connect to Synchrony via Confluence internal proxy

column3:
AppID's that contain special characters are rejected by Synchrony.

2016-08-17 15:27:42,711 WARN [synchrony-interop-executor:thread-1] [plugins.synchrony.config.DefaultSynchronyConfigurationManager] logJSONResponseField [Collab editing plugin] Response message for Schäferbarthold-GmbH-389d808a-b63c-3389-93c3-26ff2b9ab16d: Invalid AppID format

*Workaround*

# We generate the AppID using the organisation name from the license.  Since this is EAP if it is possible to obtain an evaluation license under a org name that does not contain special characters then that should mitigate this issue.
# If you upgraded Confluence from a milestone version and saw this problem, please try to turn Synchrony OFF and ON in the Collaborative Editing administration page (so that a new App ID will be generated). Please note that a Synchrony restart won't help.
column4: Synchrony app id does not handle special characters

column3:
Sorry, didn't get this working.

I did a fresh Windows 64bit Test-Installation running on port 80, accessed by a local Firefox browser. Local firewall is disabled. Editing a page is NOT possible (Not connected).

Log shows:
{code}
2016-08-16 11:09:50,067 ERROR [http-nio-80-exec-4] [confluence.plugins.synchrony.SynchronyContextProvider] getContextMap This instance could not be registered with Synchrony.
 -- referer: http://localhost/welcome.action | url: /pages/createpage.action | traceId: d198d726b5398a19 | userName: admin | action: createpage
{code}
I see that the Tomcat8 (Confluence) process spawns another Java VM (synchrony.jar) which runs for about 3 seconds with high CPU & IO before being terminated & respawned.

Server has 8 GB RAM, 2 GB allocated to Confluence, so it shouldn't be an OOM issue concerning Synchrony as this VM allocates exactly 2 GB.

Any ideas?

Jan-Peter
column4: Confluence 6.0 EAP Synchrony not using JRE bundled with Confluence

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29048].
  {panel}

As per the [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Concurrent+Editing+and+Merging+Changes], Confluence should be able to merge non-conflicting changes successfully when two users are editing a page at the same time, but this doesn't seem to be happening.

Steps to reproduce:
*1- User 1 opens page for editing, and enters text in one section:*
!A.png!

*2- User 2 opens page for editing, and enters text in another section:*
!B.png!

*3- User 1 saves changes, and gets the resulting page:*
!C.png!

*4- User 2 saves changes, and gets the resulting page:*
!D.png!

The changes made by User 1 were lost, even though they were not conflicting. No errors are shown during the process.
column4: Confluence fails to non-conflicting merge changes while editing page concurrently

column3:
When translating the blueprints into german, you have the effect that umlauts that are contained in the instructional text are not saved.

See attachments for a visual "proof" of the problem:
- (a) go as administrator to change a global template
- (b) insert umlauts in the instructional text and elsewhere 
- (c) save the template, and edit it again: umlauts are lost in instructional text (but present in the "normal" template text
- (d) created pages from the template also do not contain the "missing" umlauts

This makes this feature nearly unusable in an internationalized environment, at least in germany.

h6. Test notes
# Test umlauts as well as Japanese/Russian characters on text placeholders on new and existing templates
# Insert variables into a template
# Verify the tested characters from step 1 characters show up on template insertion page too
column4: Instructional text in Blueprints loses umlauts and other characters, when saving

*Assumptions, suggestions*
There was a [documentation problem earlier|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-26138], not mentioning that moving page with restrictions require space admin permissions. However, since it is possible to assign *Restrict* permission, it would make sense to link moving&restricting a page to this permission.

If the decision is not to do this, the solution could be to warn before saving the page that the operation will fail, since this may cause loss of work.
column4: Copying, restricting then moving a page produces stacktrace

column3:
Prior to upgrading from Confluence 5.0.3 to 5.1, Ctrl+S would save the page being edited.

In 5.1 it no longer works. Instead the native browser save page dialog appears. The Confluence keyboard shortcut documentation still lists Ctrl+S as an option.

Tested in Chrome and Firefox.
column4: CTRL+S no longer saves the edited page in Confluence 5.1

column3:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28557].
  {panel}

When a Confluence wiki page is using the JIRA gadget a "AJS" is undefined browser error is displayed in IE8 ONLY.

This works fine in Firefox 3.6.11

column3:
h5. Steps to reproduce:
# Access Confluence in IE browser
# Create a Confluence page
# Insert [Page Layout|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Working+with+Page+Layouts+and+Columns+and+Sections] e.g. Three columns
# Add text to all elements, add some links to that text.
# Save the page
# Edit the page. Editing of the links on top will work ok. 
# Scroll down. Editing of links is no longer possible, the menu (Go to link, Edit and Unlink) are not displayed. The layout flickers when links are clicked.
# See the screen cast for details: http://screencast.com/t/Y42hyAaiPFo
# Same issue is not observed without the use of [Page Layout|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Working+with+Page+Layouts+and+Columns+and+Sections] in IE
# Here's a sample space xml backup from a freshly installed Confluence 5.0.2 that represents the problem: [^ds-152558-6.xml.zip] - sample taken from Demonstration Space

h5. Workaround:
# Edit the links using [Confluence Source Editor|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.editor.confluence-source-editor] in IE browser
# Use Chrome or Firefox browser instead

h5. Note:
Upon further research, I found out that the issue only occurred when you have to scroll down the page to edit the links. It seems that when the page layout height is more than the default editor height (the need to scroll down the page), problem exist.

h5. Root Cause
The underlying problem is that Internet Explorer fires a scrolling event sometimes when the link is clicked, which results in the property panel being closed (which when scrolling normally is what is expected).
column4: Link in Confluence pages cannot be edited in IE9, IE10 & IE11 when Page Layout is in used

column3:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28415].
  {panel}

(!) Please note that there is a recent problem discovered with Chrome that produces the same symptoms and is being tracked in the following ticket. Please follow the workaround instructions there: [Page Editor shows at half height on Chrome|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-41035]
h2. Fixed in 5.1.3
We've put a fix for the Chrome bug in Confluence 5.1.3, upgrading to this release will fix the problem. Confluence OnDemand already has this fix and is not impacted. 

For people who can't immediately upgrade, there is a CSS workaround you can apply. We will shortly be releasing a plugin to do this automatically for you.

h2. Fixed via Plugin

The [Editor Height Fix for Confluence Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.editor-height-fix] automatically adds the CSS mentioned in the workaround below.

You can install it directly through the product (search for Editor Height Fix). 

NB: You may need to set your [Page Layout|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Customising+Site+and+Space+Layouts] back to default if you are still experiencing the issue after performing these steps.

h2. Workaround if plugin cannot be installed.
You can apply some custom CSS to resolve the issue. 

NB: You may need to set your [Page Layout|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Customising+Site+and+Space+Layouts] back to default if you are still experiencing the issue after performing these steps.

h4. Steps for Confluence 4.x

h6. Global Stylesheet
This will fix the bug in all Spaces using the default theme:
* Click 'Browse' in the header and click 'Confluence Admin'
* Click 'Stylesheet' under 'Look and Feel'
* Click the 'Edit' button on the 'Global Stylesheet' screen
* Paste the CSS snippet from below and click the 'Save' button

h6. Space Stylesheet
For spaces using the Documentation, Easy reader, or a custom theme, you need to apply the CSS change to them individually:
* Navigate to the space
* Click 'Browse' in the header and click 'Space Admin'
* Click 'Stylesheet' under 'Look and Feel'
* Click the 'Edit' button
* Paste the CSS snippet from below and click the 'Save' button

h4. Steps for Confluence 5.x

h6. Global Stylesheet
This will fix the bug in all Spaces using the default theme:
* Click the 'Cog' in the header and click 'Confluence Admin'
* Click 'Stylesheet' under 'Look and Feel'
* Click the 'Edit' button on the 'Global Stylesheet' screen
* Paste the CSS snippet from below and click the 'Save' button

h6. Space Stylesheet
For spaces using the Documentation, Easy reader, or a custom theme, you need to apply the CSS change to them individually:
* Navigate to the space
* Click 'Browse' in the header and click 'Space Admin'
* Click 'Stylesheet' under 'Look and Feel'
* Click the 'Edit' button
* Paste the CSS snippet from below and click the 'Save' button

h4. CSS snippet
{code}
/* CONF-28415 */
form.editor .editor-default,
.editor-fullheight {
    height: 100%;
    height: auto\9; /* IE8 */
}
{code}


Steps to reproduce:
* Open any page for editing
* What happens:
** Editor does not take the full height of the container area. Content of the editor are clipped. (see attachment)
* What should happen:
** The editor must take all the available height of the container area.
column4: Editor is not full height in Chrome 27

column3:
If the image inserted into a page / blog through attaching from pc,
it couldn't show in outlook 2007, even when I logged in confluence with IE 8.


I founded the images source URL has been changed in outlook 2007.
For example, the image source link was:
http://192.168.1.116/download/attachments/1245186/cat.jpg?version=1&modificationDate=1344266671018
But outlook, it was different:
http://192.168.1.116/download/attachments/1245186/cat.jpg?version=1&modificationDate=1344266671018
Outlook added "amp;" after "&" of the image link.
I doubt if this is the reason why outlook cannot show images.
 

Is there any solution for outlook to show the attached images?
BTW, is it possible to show images without login Confluence?
column4: image of notify mail is broken in outlook 2007

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-26031].
  {panel}

Problem: Moving a page can trigger lots of notifications, this sucks if you are doing some clean-up of a space. 

Solution: 
* The move page dialog should _not_ trigger notifications by default
* We should add a simple checkbox: 
!http://cl.ly/image/3N0g2k0W1p2D3A3F3G0V/Image%202012.07.16%203:31:18%20PM.png!
to let the user choose if they want notifications to be sent off
column4: Allow a user to move a page / page hierarchy without sending notifications

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-24536].
  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce*
(You will need to do the page creation steps in a non-IE8 browser if CONFDEV-6815 is not yet fixed)
* Create a page, add in a two-column layout. 
* In the first column, type some text and add in an image and table.
* Save the page

(Now you can switch to IE8)
* Position the cursor at the top of the page layout cell, and hit tab.
You will see the image get selected and then then the table. As you try to tab past the table in IE8, a JS error will be thrown.

The tab key should not select elements, it should move the cursor to the next cell.

The requirement to run PluginFramework Dependent upgrade tasks is not persistent. So if you kill an upgrading instance before it run the tasks and then restart it again, it will no longer attempt to run these tasks on start up.

column3:
When synchronising memberships with LDAP, and a user that Confluence hasn't yet synced has logged in while the sync is in progress, Confluence can get duplicate user or membership exceptions. In rare cases, the membership can have a hibernate ID attached to it, even though the object is not yet in the database. In this case, Confluence will get a null pointer exception after attempting to look up that membership and abort the synchronisation.

Example logs:

column3: We don't have very many tests around page and space permissions for users and groups that have been removed from LDAP. We should add some, if only to be sure that our code is working correctly.
column4: Improve testing of removed user and group permissions

column3:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23061].
  {panel}

Uploading a large plugin or large attachment causes an error using HSQL v2 or data truncation using an older version of HSQL.  The maximum size that can be stored using the current configuration is 16 MB.  

The current Hibernate->HSQL dialect maps blobs to longvarbinary types. These have a max size of 16MB. I think we can either change the dialect or configure HSQL to map longvarbinary types to blobs.

From the HSQLDB docs:
"You can set LONGVARBINARY to map to BLOB, with the sql.longvar_is_lob connection property or the SET DATABASE SQL LONGVAR IS LOB TRUE statement." 

Not sure which is easier to do.
column4: Can't install a plugin or upload an attachment > 16MB using HSQL for evaluation
Build and release 3.5.11
Ask customer to test delegated LDAP with group copying
Constraint violation failure when importing on SQL Server due to content permission nulls

column3: A customer has raised a support request which implies this doesn't work. We should quickly re-test it, then ask for additional information from the customer if necessary.

* Execute the search

see the screen shoot.
column4: You can't search things that are between {}

column3: Exceptions thrown from worker threads in an executor service are swallowed without any logging. If we lose connectivity to the database for any reason during a reindex, this will not show up in the logs. We need to log if this ever happens, and if possible, attempt to reconnect and resume reindexing.
column4: Improve error handling when rebuilding index
Merge UpgradeManager changes to trunk

column3: There is currently no remote API provided to read and write user profile settings (stored in the os_propertyentry table). It would be useful for other applications to be able to read and manipulate user properties via the SOAP and XML-RPC APIs.
column4: Add remote API support to read and write user profile settings

column3:
Attachment comment used to be retained after edit in word - this is the case when using Office Connector 1.5 _one point five_ in Confluence 3.0

Now it's no longer retained (tested in Confluence 3.5.5 and 3.5.7, OC 1.15 _one point fifteen_).

h5. Steps to replicate
# In a Confluence page, upload a word doc as an attachment. Include an attachment comment
# Edit in word and save
# In new version of the doc, the attachment comment disappears.
column4: Attachment comment is not retained after Edit in Office

column3:
Going to a password reset screen, e.g. https://extranet.atlassian.com/resetuserpassword.action?username=bwoskow&token=4205470cb3c23acaac0906d63a04a1be0c568201 contains an i18n key instead of an actual link.

Note that I reproduced this both on EAC and CAC (Confluence 3.5.7).

https://skitch.com/bwoskow/fe89k/reset-password-extranet
column4: Going to a password reset screen contains an i18n key instead of an actual link

column3:
Currently Confluence users are unable to use the #include Velocity function to include files into the rendered html via the Administrator site layouts area.  My use case is I have a standard header across multiple products (Confluence, Jira, Fisheye/Crucible, IP.Board), and I want to directly include it from a file shared across all products, so if I change that one file it will update everywhere. The workaround was to use #parse, but parse interprets statements in the file as Velocity code, which is problematic if your html/javascript contains statements that are similar to Velocity.

I've attached a patch that fixes this from Confluence 3.5.1-3.5.7(current), the problem is twofold:
1- There is no included file resource loader in Velocity's config, an easy addition to the properties file
2- There is a bug in the Hibernate resource loader that returns null instead of ResourceNotFoundException when it cannot find a resource in the database, preventing Velocity from falling through to the next resource loader.  Easy and tested fix.
column4: [PATCH included] Unable to use Velocity include function from site layouts
Release 3.5.8

column3: The method Confluence is currently using for connecting to the database during bootstrap checks only works for C3P0 based connection settings. These settings are only set for direct JDBC connections, and are not available for JNDI datasource connections. Confluence needs to verify the connection settings by using whatever ConnectionProvider is appropriate (e.g. as determined by Hibernate's ConnectionProviderFactory), rather than just choosing one at random.\r\n\r\nBy failing to open connections in with the correct provider, Confluence will refuse to start for any customer using MySQL via a JNDI datasource, making this a blocker for any affected customer.
column4: MySQL isolation level check does not work for JNDI datasources
Build & release Confluence 3.5.7
Build and release 3.5.6

column3:
Confluence can run out of memory when indexing certain Excel 2007 (xlsx) files. When such files are uploaded, the following stack trace is seen the next time the index queue flushing job runs:
{noformat}

A heap dump showed 900MB of {{com.atlassian.confluence.extra.officeconnector.index.excel.ExcelXMLTextExtractor$LiteralTextEntry}} objects.

h3. Fix

* For Confluence 3.3.x, download and install Office Connector 1.13.1
* For Confluence 3.5.x, download and install Office Connector 1.17 (should also work with Confluence 3.4.x, but has not been tested)
* Or upgrade to Confluence 3.5.8 or above
column4: OutOfMemoryError when indexing Excel files
Upgrade to Support Tools Plugin 2.6
