h2. Known issues
The fix for this issue adds further diagnostics that will (in much more limited circumstances) trigger more null pointer exceptions that will abort synchronisation. These are described in CONF-23102, and fixed in Confluence 3.5.12 or higher. For this reason, *the recommended fix is to upgrade to 3.5.12 or higher*.

h2. Patch

Attached to CONF-22342 is an updated version of [atlassian-embedded-crowd-hibernate2 jar|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/48380/atlassian-embedded-crowd-hibernate2-1.2.9-m3.jar], to patch this issue. When patched, transactions will now correctly rollback, and log the records that were in error.

It is known to work in Confluence 3.5.4 and 3.5.5, and might work in earlier versions, but these have not been tested, nor should they require it unless they are patching CONF-22342. It is not needed in Confluence 3.5.6, as that version already contains this fix.

h3. Installation
To install the patch:
# Stop Confluence
# Move the old atlassian-embedded-crowd-hibernate2 jar out of {{<confluence install dir>/confluence/WEB-INF/lib}}
# Copy the new jar into the same directory
# Start Confluence
column4: Null pointer when detecting duplicate memberships while synchronising
Build and release 3.5.5

column3:
Under MySQL, users and groups can wind up with duplicate membership entries in the cwd_membership table. The existing constraint:
{code:sql}
alter table cwd_membership add constraint cwd_unique_membership unique (parent_id, child_group_id, child_user_id)
{code}
has no effect thanks to child_group_id and child_user_id both allowing nulls. We need to apply a fix similar to the fix we did for the content permissions unique constraints fix, and apply different unique constraints in environments where nulls are ignored (mysql, postgres) vs nulls are distinct values too (oracle, sql server) vs illegal (db2).

h2. Patch

Attached is [^CONF-22541-patch-v2.zip], which will repair any duplicate memberships in MySQL, and add corrected constraints to the cwd_membership table. The patch is compatible with Confluence 3.5.1 - 3.5.5. Confluence 3.5.6 contains this fix, so does not require the patch. Due to changes in upgrade infrastructure between Confluence 3.5 and 3.5.1, the patch is not backwards compatible with Confluence 3.5.

h3. Contents
The patch contains 15 files in 3 directories:
 * confluence/WEB-INF
   ** com/atlassian/confluence/upgrade/upgradetask
     *** AbstractConstraintCreationUpgradeTask.class
     *** 7x ContentPermissionConstraintsUpgradeTask classes
     *** 4x EmbeddedCrowdSchemaUpgradeTask classes
   ** com/atlassian/crowd/embedded/hibernate2
     *** 2x additional_constraints properties files
 * confluence/admin
   ** fixcwdmemberships.jsp


h3. Installation
To install the patch:
# stop Confluence
# extract the zip to the top level of your {{<confluence install dir>}}. This will create the required directories under confluence/WEB-INF for the patched files.
# start Confluence
# Log in as a confluence administrator, and navigate to {{<confluence base url>/admin/fixcwdmemberships.jsp}}, and follow the prompts

When running the jsp on a confluence 3.5.x instance that has already run any 3.5.x upgrade tasks, this patch will cause log messages containing messages such as {code:none}Constraint cwd_group_name_dir_id already exists{code} or {code:none}Could not create unique constraint ... Duplicate key name 'cwd_group_name_dir_id'{code} to appear in the logs. These are harmless, and can be safely ignored.
column4: Unique membership constraints ignored on MySQL

column3:
h3. Summary of The Bug
ORACLE database users (10/11) could not modify their user directories, due to {{UNIQUE CONSTRAINT}} ERROR thrown by Confluence:
{noformat}
2011-05-07 00:39:13,768 ERROR [http-8353-1] [sf.hibernate.util.JDBCExceptionReporter] logExceptions ORA-00001: unique constraint (SEPCONFTWO.SYS_C004591) violated

 -- referer: http://localhost:8353/plugins/servlet/embedded-crowd/configure/ldap/ | url: /plugins/servlet/embedded-crowd/configure/ldap/ | userName: admin
2011-05-07 00:39:13,770 ERROR [http-8353-1] [sf.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl] execute Could not synchronize database state with session
 -- referer: http://localhost:8353/plugins/servlet/embedded-crowd/configure/ldap/ | url: /plugins/servlet/embedded-crowd/configure/ldap/ | userName: admin
2011-05-07 00:39:13,841 ERROR [http-8353-1] [atlassian.plugin.servlet.ServletModuleContainerServlet] service Request processing failed; nested exception is org.springframework.dao.DataIntegrityViolationException: Hibernate operation: could not insert collection rows: [com.atlassian.crowd.model.directory.DirectoryImpl.attributes#327682]; SQL []; ORA-00001: unique constraint (SEPCONFTWO.SYS_C004591) violated
; nested exception is java.sql.SQLException: ORA-00001: unique constraint (SEPCONFTWO.SYS_C004591) violated

 -- referer: http://localhost:8353/plugins/servlet/embedded-crowd/configure/ldap/ | url: /plugins/servlet/embedded-crowd/configure/ldap/ | userName: admin
org.springframework.web.util.NestedServletException: Request processing failed; nested exception is org.springframework.dao.DataIntegrityViolationException: Hibernate operation: could not insert collection rows: [com.atlassian.crowd.model.directory.DirectoryImpl.attributes#327682]; SQL []; ORA-00001: unique constraint (SEPCONFTWO.SYS_C004591) violated
; nested exception is java.sql.SQLException: ORA-00001: unique constraint (SEPCONFTWO.SYS_C004591) violated
{noformat}

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Install Confluence 3.5.x instance with ORACLE (10/11) database
# Create a new LDAP Directory, test and save it.
# Edit the directory (modify some of the LDAP attributes, eg. {{User Schema Settings > User Object Filter}}). Test and save. A System Error will be thrown.

h3. Fix
Use the attached patch to resolve the issue. To install the patch, extract it to your <confluence-install-dir>/confluence/WEB-INF/classes directory. Ensure that the following files are created:
# com/atlassian/crowd/embedded/hibernate2/HibernateDirectoryDao$1.class
# com/atlassian/crowd/embedded/hibernate2/HibernateDirectoryDao$2.class
# com/atlassian/crowd/embedded/hibernate2/HibernateDirectoryDao.class
Then, restart Confluence.

h3. Cause
This occurs due to Oracle treating blank strings and null values as equal, and Hibernate 2 not being smart enough to realise that the same entry already exists, because in Java, a blank string is not equal to a null. This causes Hibernate to try to insert a row that already exists.

h5. MySQL DEBUG log
{noformat}
2011-05-04 18:46:16,007 DEBUG [QuartzScheduler_Worker-2] [net.sf.hibernate.SQL] log select attributes0_.directory_id as director1___, attributes0_.attribute_value as attribut2___, attributes0_.attribute_name as attribut3___ from cwd_directory_attribute attributes0_ where attributes0_.directory_id=?
2011-05-04 18:46:16,017 DEBUG [QuartzScheduler_Worker-2] [net.sf.hibernate.SQL] log update cwd_directory set directory_name=?, lower_directory_name=?, created_date=?, updated_date=?, active=?, description=?, impl_class=?, lower_impl_class=?, directory_type=? where id=?
2011-05-04 18:46:16,018 DEBUG [QuartzScheduler_Worker-2] [net.sf.hibernate.SQL] log delete from cwd_directory_attribute where directory_id=? and attribute_name=?
2011-05-04 18:46:16,018 DEBUG [QuartzScheduler_Worker-2] [net.sf.hibernate.SQL] log update cwd_directory_attribute set attribute_value=? where directory_id=? and attribute_name=?
{noformat}

{noformat}
2011-05-06 23:58:51,560 DEBUG [http-8080-5] [net.sf.hibernate.SQL] log update cwd_directory set directory_name=?, lower_directory_name=?, created_date=?, updated_date=?, active=?, description=?, impl_class=?, lower_impl_class=?, directory_type=? where id=?
2011-05-06 23:58:51,563 DEBUG [http-8080-5] [net.sf.hibernate.SQL] log delete from cwd_directory_operation where directory_id=?
2011-05-06 23:58:51,576 DEBUG [http-8080-5] [net.sf.hibernate.SQL] log delete from cwd_directory_attribute where directory_id=? and attribute_name=?
2011-05-06 23:58:51,579 DEBUG [http-8080-5] [net.sf.hibernate.SQL] log update cwd_directory_attribute set attribute_value=? where directory_id=? and attribute_name=?
2011-05-06 23:58:51,581 DEBUG [http-8080-5] [net.sf.hibernate.SQL] log insert into cwd_directory_attribute (directory_id, attribute_name, attribute_value) values (?, ?, ?)
2011-05-06 23:58:51,622 ERROR [http-8080-5] [sf.hibernate.util.JDBCExceptionReporter] logExceptions ORA-00001: unique constraint (SEPCONFONE.SYS_C004301) violated

column4: Editing "User Directories" configuration is not possible for ORACLE DB user due to DataIntegrityViolationException
Build and release 3.5.4

column3: The DB2 builds are currently failing the PlatformCTKAcceptanceTest, due to using too long a key when looking up plugin settings. We have to truncate the key we're given whenever we invoke get or put operations on bandana data, to ensure we don't trigger this error.
column4: Fix failing DB2 build

column3:
Hibernate2BatchProcessor#commitTransaction() clears the transaction from ThreadLocal before trying to flush the Hibernate session. If the flushing fails, rollbackTransaction() will not clear the session because the transaction cannot be found. After this the whole batch operation will fail, as the offending operation fails on every subsequent flush.

Directory synchronisation algorithm is not atomic, so it can sometimes try to add existing users to the database, which cause the session flushing to fail. AbstractBatchProcessor has logic to handle these failures gracefully, but it does not work in Confluence because the session is not cleared properly.

In a large Confluence instance the following behaviour could trigger this issue:

# New directory is added with large amount of users
# Sync is started, synchronisation algorithm finds that all users in the new directory need to be added and starts adding them
# A user from the large user set logs in before the user sync is completed (This triggers user creation in the local instance)
# Sync operation tries to add the user who was created in the previous step thus causing the flush to fail

At this stage no new users can be added as all flushes will fail. Membership synchronisation will proceed very slowly as some users have not been added, so batch operations will fall back to individual processing.

h2. Patch

Attached is an updated version of [atlassian-embedded-crowd-hibernate2 jar|^atlassian-embedded-crowd-hibernate2-1.2.9-m3.jar], to patch this issue. When patched, transactions will now correctly rollback, allowing the synchronisation to complete. All records in the rolled back transaction will be ignored until the next synchronisation attempt (or until the affected users log in).

It is known to work in Confluence 3.5.4, and might work in earlier versions, but these have not been tested. It is not needed in Confluence 3.5.6, as that version already contains this fix. 

This patch also addresses CONF-22631, so that any records that fail to synchronise are logged correctly. Users with Confluence 3.5.5 should install this patch to avoid that issue.

h3. Installation
To install the patch:
# Stop Confluence
# Move the old atlassian-embedded-crowd-hibernate2 jar out of {{<confluence install dir>/confluence/WEB-INF/lib}}
# Copy the new jar into the same directory
# Start Confluence

column3:
The ConfluenceAuthenticator implementation in 3.5 behaves very differently to every previous version of Confluence in that login() now does the authentication and authenticate() is a dummy method that just returns true or false based on the result of login().

This has broken custom authenticators that subclass ConfluenceAuthenticator. Even if they were updated to work somehow, there's no easy way to fall back to authenticating with Confluence, if the external authentication fails. Extended implementations might also neglect to fire the events that enforce a CAPTCHA after a number of failed logins.

We should restore the previous way of extending ConfluenceAuthenticator in 3.5.

h4. Workaround

There is a patch attached to this issue to fix this issue in Confluence 3.5, 3.5.1 and 3.5.2. To install the patch:

# Shut down Confluence.
# Download [^atlassian-seraph-2.5.1.jar] and put it in {{confluence/WEB-INF/lib/}}.
# Remove the old version of this library, {{atlassian-seraph-2.4.0.jar}}, from {{confluence/WEB-INF/lib/}}.
# Download [^ConfluenceAuthenticator.class] and put it in {{confluence/WEB-INF/classes/com/atlassian/confluence/user/}}, creating any directories as required.
# Put your custom authenticator in place as normal.
# Start Confluence again.

Customers who are not comfortable patching their instance can wait until the Confluence 3.5.3 release, which is currently scheduled for Monday 2 May.
column4: Custom authenticators which subclass ConfluenceAuthenticator are broken in Confluence 3.5

Build and release 3.5.1

column3:
h2. Symptom

User cannot log in:

In the atlassian-confluence.log file the following is reported:

{noformat}
java.lang.NullPointerException
at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.CrowdServiceImpl.isUserMemberOfGroup(CrowdServiceImpl.java:265)
at com.atlassian.confluence.user.ConfluenceGroupJoiningAuthenticator.addUserToGroup(ConfluenceGroupJoiningAuthenticator.java:59)
at com.atlassian.confluence.user.ConfluenceGroupJoiningAuthenticator$1.doInTransactionWithoutResult(ConfluenceGroupJoiningAuthenticator.java:48)
at org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionCallbackWithoutResult.doInTransaction(TransactionCallbackWithoutResult.java:33)
at org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionTemplate.execute(TransactionTemplate.java:127)
{noformat}

h2. Cause

This is can be due to several issues leading to failed upgrades to Confluence 3.5. For more information, refer to the Confluence log file. Some issues where we have seen this include:
* A user was matched that did not have a username attribute.
* The LDAP server had a limit on the maximum number of results it can return.

In all cases, the upgrade failure causes the internal directory to be in an inconsistent state, possibly missing the atlassian-user group, which can cause this error.

h2. Resolution

The error should be handled better and a more meaningful error message should be logged by ConfluenceGroupJoiningAuthenticator.
column4: Failed upgrades lead to NullPointerException in ConfluenceGroupJoiningAuthenticator

column3:
Under IE7, the new icon for editing labels (used to be a word "Edit") does not show up. It does appear in IE8, Chrome 10.0 and Firefox 3.6 therefore must be an IE7 thing. 

The only way for users to edit labels is to edit the page, which is not how it was in 3.4.7 which we had before.

Unfortunately our corporate SOE is IE7 so I can't just tell people to upgrade their browser. This makes it not possible for us to upgrade to Confluence 3.5.
column4: Edit labels icon doesn't show up in IE7

column3: Customers can specify custom hibernate configuration options in their confluence.cfg.xml, and we have validation code in the bootstrap system to check that these options result in a working hibernate environment. Unfortunately, the code in this validation layer is not using all the properties that a customer can specify in their config, meaning that some properties (like hibernate.connection.isolation) are not applied while validating the DB.\r\n\r\nWe need to make it so customer overrides of the transaction isolation level apply during bootstrap too. We also need to fix this so that we check all the properties on bootstrap, not just a handful.
column4: Transaction isolation override in confluence.cfg.xml does not apply to bootstrap checks

column3:
The default user search filter specified in 3.4 and earlier could find user accounts that don't contain username attributes. After upgrade, if the filter finds bad data, this will prevent any LDAP synchronisation from completing, and will make any upgrade attempt with this configuration fail.

We should automatically tighten the filter during the upgrade process to include the relevant username attribute by 'and'ing it with the one given by the user. E.g. for Active Directory, with the username attribute 'sAMAccountName', the user search filter could be given as '(objectCategory=person)', but we should be change it to '(&(objectCategory=Person)(sAMAccountName=\*))'. For LDAP, with the username attribute 'cn', the user search filter could be given as '(objectClass=inetorgperson)', but we should change it to '(&(objectClass=inetorgperson)(cn=\*))'. The same could be done for user attribute 'oid', and so forth.

While we're implementing this, we should validate that any given wildcard part of the search filter matches the user attribute - if they don't match, we'll never see any results we can use.

*Workaround*
Before upgrading, change atlassian-user.xml so it's got a filter for the username attribute in it. For example with Active Directory:
{code:xml}<userSearchFilter>(&(objectCategory=person)(sAMAccountName=*))</userSearchFilter>{code}
column4: LDAP: Automatically refine user search filter when upgrading to Confluence 3.5

column3:
The [Custom Query mappers|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Extending+the+V2+search+API] modules are not getting loaded once the server is restarted.

This is causing a [serious problem in Ad hoc Workflows|https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/APRV-392]. The workaround is [manually reloading the lucene-query-mapper modules|https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/APRV-392?focusedCommentId=40949&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-40949].

h3. Recreating the problem:
* When the plugin containing the {{lucene-query-mapper}} modules is installed, no problem, everything works
* When the server is restarted, trying to access the query causes an exception like this one:
{noformat}
com.atlassian.confluence.search.v2.lucene.LuceneMapperNotFoundException: A lucene mapper could not be found to map an object of type: com.atlassian.confluence.search.v2.SearchQuery and key: workflowassignee
        at com.atlassian.confluence.search.v2.lucene.DelegatingLuceneSearchMapper.convertToLuceneQuery(DelegatingLuceneSearchMapper.java:28)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.search.v2.lucene.mapper.BooleanQueryMapper.addSubQueries(BooleanQueryMapper.java:43)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.search.v2.lucene.mapper.BooleanQueryMapper.convertToLuceneQuery(BooleanQueryMapper.java:29)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.search.v2.lucene.DelegatingLuceneSearchMapper.convertToLuceneQuery(DelegatingLuceneSearchMapper.java:30)
        at com.comalatech.confluence.workflowreports.TwoPointNineWorkflowReportCreator.debugQuery(TwoPointNineWorkflowReportCreator.java:138)
        at com.comalatech.confluence.workflowreports.TwoPointNineWorkflowReportCreator.makeEntries(TwoPointNineWorkflowReportCreator.java:131)
        at com.comalatech.confluence.workflowreports.TwoPointNineWorkflowReportCreator.createDashboardReport(TwoPointNineWorkflowReportCreator.java:78)
{noformat}

*Please note that this is a confluence issue, which happens to have an effect in Ad hoc Workflows*
column4: lucene-query-mapper plugin modules are not getting loaded properly upon server restart

column3:
* Disabling the Did you mean feature via the general config admin and doesn't stop you running the did you mean job via the schedule job page and the content indexing page
* The Did You Mean Indexing job says it's been run before, and it has a history, but the Content Indexing page says it's never been built:

I'm assuming that disabling this job, doesn't disable the actual Quartz job, just that internally the job doesn't do anything - hence the difference in reporting of status/history in the different admin screens.

If this is the case, the did you mean jobs should use the ScheduleJobManager to enable/disable their jobs instead.
column4: Inconsistent status reporting for Did You Mean in Scheduled Job Admin screen and other screens that manage a job's status.

column3:
* Go to scheduled jobs page
* Force web-sudo timeout
* Click edit for a job

There is no indication that the user can't submit the job because web sudo has been dropped.  The only thing the user will see is that they can't click "save."  Clicking edit should engage the websudo login and take the user back to the edit dialog.
column4: Edit dialog doesn't show user that web sudo access has been revoked

column3:
This issue is also described in http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Unable+to+Start+Confluence+or+Some+Plugins+are+Disabled+upon+Startup

This issue can affect Confluence installed on SQL Server, Oracle, MySQL but most commonly affects SQL Server.

Confluence may fail to start up due to database deadlocks in the Bandana table caused by multi-threaded spring context initialisation.  What happens seems to be:

* The main plugin-thread looks up the general state of the plugin system in bandana, thereby locking the whole bandana table
* That thread spawns separate threads in separate transactions to initialise individual Spring contexts for plugins.
* Some plugins try to look up their own settings in the bandana table during that initialisation but must wait for the main plugin-thread to release the lock.
* Eventually the initalisation of the plugin times out like this:
{noformat}
2011-02-28 14:49:29,366 ERROR [Thread-1] [internal.util.concurrent.RunnableTimedExecution] execute Closing runnable for context NonValidatingOsgiBundleXmlApplicationContext(bundle=com.atlassian.confluence.extra.officeconnector, config=osgibundle:/META-INF/spring/*.xml) did not finish in 10000ms; consider taking a snapshot and then shutdown the VM in case the thread still hangs
{noformat}

This *can* result in Confluence failing to be usable at all, or can result in just those plugins not working.

h3. Patch
We strongly recommend upgrading to Confluence 3.5.9 or newer, which contains a proper fix for this issue. This unsupported patch has only been tested against Confluence 3.3 but should work for other versions up to 3.5.7 as well. If upgrading is not an option, you may follow these steps to patch your version of Confluence:

First, shut down Confluence.

Then, alter the Bandana table to do the following:
* Remove duplicate rows.
* Remove or update any rows with a null bandanacontext value
* Remove or update any rows with a null bandanakey value
* Alter the bandanacontext and bandanakey columns and set them to not null
* Add a unique constraint to the bandana table on the bandanacontext and bandanakey columns
* Drop the band_key_idx index
* Create a new index called band_cont_key_idx on the bandanacontext and bandanakey columns

If running PostgreSQL, you may run the following:
{code:sql}
-- Find duplicate rows, keep only one of each
SELECT b1.* 
FROM BANDANA b1, BANDANA b2 
WHERE b1.BANDANAID <> b2.BANDANAID AND 
b1.BANDANACONTEXT = b2.BANDANACONTEXT AND 
b1.BANDANAKEY = b2.BANDANAKEY 
ORDER BY b1.BANDANACONTEXT, b1.BANDANAKEY, b1.BANDANAID DESC
-- Remove null values
update BANDANA set BANDANACONTEXT = 'CONF22428-NULL-BACKUP' where BANDANACONTEXT is null;
update BANDANA set BANDANAKEY = 'CONF22428-NULL-BACKUP' where BANDANAKEY is null;
-- Add not null constraints
alter table BANDANA alter column BANDANACONTEXT set not null;
alter table BANDANA alter column BANDANAKEY set not null;
-- Add unique constraint
alter table BANDANA add constraint bandana_unique_key unique (BANDANACONTEXT, BANDANAKEY);
-- Optimise indexes
drop index band_key_idx;
create index band_cont_key_idx on BANDANA (BANDANACONTEXT, BANDANAKEY);
{code}

{panel:title=Warning}
After altering the bandana table as mentioned above, you may have problems upgrading to Confluence 3.5.9 and 3.5.11. We recommend you upgrade to 3.5.12 or above instead.
{panel}

Next, extract the attached patch zip file to your confluence/WEB-INF/classes directory. Ensure that the following files are created:
* com/atlassian/confluence/setup/bandana/persistence/dao/hibernate/HibernateConfluenceBandanaRecordDao$3.class
* com/atlassian/confluence/setup/bandana/persistence/dao/hibernate/HibernateConfluenceBandanaRecordDao$2.class
* com/atlassian/confluence/setup/bandana/persistence/dao/hibernate/HibernateConfluenceBandanaRecordDao.class
* com/atlassian/confluence/setup/bandana/persistence/dao/hibernate/HibernateConfluenceBandanaRecordDao$1.class
* com/atlassian/confluence/setup/bandana/ConfluenceCachingBandanaPersister.class
* com/atlassian/confluence/setup/bandana/ConfluenceBandanaRecord.hbm.xml
* com/atlassian/confluence/setup/bandana/ConfluenceCachingBandanaPersister$EmptyCachePlaceholder.class

The patch is now applied and you can start Confluence again.

h3. Known workaround for SQL Server
Setting the isolation level of the database as follows is known to fix the issue:
{noformat}
ALTER DATABASE <database name>
   SET READ_COMMITTED_SNAPSHOT ON
   WITH ROLLBACK IMMEDIATE;
{noformat}

It's possible there is another fix, such as making the plugin system close its transaction at some stage, or [adding an index to the bandana table|CONF-21985] (since [a lack of appropriate indices in sql server has given us similar issues before|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-13668?focusedCommentId=137662&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-137662].

column3:
Monitor your web browser traffic with Fiddler2 from Microsoft. Install it while your browsers are closed.
Configure it to not hide the image requests. (in the rules menu)
Make sure that your browser uses Fiddler as its proxy. (tools/monitor with Fiddler for FF or tools/fiddler2 for IE)

Open a page
Edit it
Click on EDIT Restrictions (you may need to be admin)
Fiddler shows the missing file image and shows a 404. (see attachment)

All the 404 are alerts that I need to investigate to see where the error comes from.
There should be none.

2.9.3 has these resources
images\icons\view_16.png
images\icons\view_20.png
images\icons\view_20.gif

3.4.3 has these ones
images\icons\view_16-ie6.png
images\icons\view_20.png
images\icons\view_20.gif

So obviously the image cannot be found. As you can see on the attached image, the edit icon is present but not the view one.

Testing for missing resources should be standard.
You could have your testers and developers making sure with Fiddler like I do that no web request results in a 404 or similar error.
column4: 404 on a missing resource /images/icons/view_16.png on the edit restrictions page

column3:
Just take the windows standalone version.
Create a set of favourite pages for the current user.
Turn off JavaScript (and reload)

See image

The link to remove the favourite pages are dead. (right)

Other bad links are:
- the remove this space from your favourites list (left)
- add page (top)
- add blog post (top)

My immediate concern is the favourites one at right.

As a governmental organization (and we are not the only ones), we have to support disabled users and things not working without JavaScript, especially trivial ones, are blocking issues.

Here the solution you should adopt is to do progressive enhancement everywhere.
- make your link href working without JavaScript
- use jQuery to do something more fancy if JavaScript is present

Progressive enhancement should be the default way to code.
And this is the first page that the user can see...

Current fix that I will have to implement:
- parse the output of the macro
- find the page id of each favourite page
- replace the href="#" used to remove by something working without JavaScript
- if I want the old behaviour for JavaScript, add some jQuery code to put back the links to normal
This is not fun.
column4: The macro favpages used on the dashboard generates code which does not work without JavaScript to remove the page from the favourites list, this is a usability issue

column3:
Take the standalone space.
Your user creates his personal space where other confluence users have no permissions at all on the attachments. (update the permissions)
The same user create a page with attachments (any type).

Log in as the other user and go the the previous page.
Look at the attachments.
Click on the "edit" link to get access to the properties.

All the fields (see attachment screen shot) looks like editable.
Moreover if you click on save without any change you have an error message.

You cannot add or remove attachments based on permission so this screen should be read only. This is misleading for the users that we support.
column4: The properties of an attachment look like editable while you have no permission to change them. They should show up read only.

column3:
Have space where a given user can view the pages of space and add them.
However he has no permission for attachments either as an individual user or as a confluence-user. I have explicitly removed the permissions.

have another user with attachment permissions adding a word attachment to a page. Test that editing in office is OK and that you can modify the document attachment.

Switch back to the first user and go to the same page.
There is a the link on the left to open the document in R/O, fine.
There is also a link at right to edit in office the same document.
Use it.

Now try to save, an error reported in word when he saves (see attachment with error popup from word), this is MISLEADING to show this edit in office link in the first place. Do not show it if the user has the add permission for the attachments otherwise it is doomed to fail.
The stack trace of the error on the server is in a comment below. The server does its job properly but the link should not be shown in the first place.

If you use the view link to Htmlized the office document, you also have an EDIT button which should be removed.

2011/01/12 update
I raise it from minor to major.
My testers complain, and they are totally right, that the system lets them do something which fails at the end (saving from Word).
It should not happen in the first place so show the link or the button.
I think that it is really a 30 minutes job to fix the two screens based on the permissions.
column4: Attachments: The "edit in office" link or "Edit document" button should not be shown if the user has no permission to add or remove attachments in this space

column3:
To reproduce:

* Go to exportspacexml.action
* Click 'Deselect All' and check the box for a single page
* Click Export button
* After the space export has completed, download it

It will contain all pages in the space, not just the selected page.

h2. Workaround

h3. Server-side Permanent Workaround

Edit the {{confluence/importexport/includes/export-spacetree-checkboxes.vm}} file and change the following line from:
{code:html}
<input class="radio centered" type="radio"  id="contentOptionVisible" name="contentOption" value="all" checked="checked">
{code}
to this:
{code:html}
<input class="radio centered" type="radio"  id="contentOptionVisible" name="contentOption" value="visible" checked="checked">
{code}

h3. Client-side Temporary Workaround

Using a tool like [Firebug|http://getfirebug.com/], right-click on the "Visible to you" radio button on the export as XML page and clickon "Inspect Element". Edit the "value" attribute's value and set it to "visible":

{code:html}
<input type="radio" checked="checked" value="visible" name="contentOption" id="contentOptionVisible" class="radio centered">
{code}
column4: Selection of pages is not working for XML space export

Nevertheless, both parameters turns out to work pretty similarly.

column3: The recent performance fix (in 3.4) to the spaces macro has broken it on some databases when there are too many spaces.  Specifically, if there are more spaces than are allowed in an "IN" clause in the database then the macro will not work.  This macro appears on the dashboard and is in the bundled confluence-dashboard-macros plug-in.\r\n\r\nThe bug occurs while calculating the appropriate list of Team Labels to show, based on which labels appear in spaces the current user can see.
column4: Space macro broken on instances with large number of spaces and some databases

column3:
h5. Problem Description
'Edit in Office' feature using Office 2010 will change attachment's Mime Type to Text/XML - causing attachment download problem with the following error: [^error.png]


h5. How to replicate
# Install Office 2010.
# Attach an attachment: Excel or Doc or PPT. Note down the attachment Properties.
# Edit in Office and save.
# Notice the attachment properties has changed to Text/XML regardless what it was previously.
# Try to download the attachment and the browser will refuse and show you an [error|^error.png].

\
h5. Work around
Change attachment properties to what they were originally:
- XLS: application/vnd.ms-excel
- XLSX: application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.spreadsheetml.sheet
- DOC: application/msword
- DOCX: application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.wordprocessingml.document
- PPT: application/vnd.ms-powerpoint
- PPTX: application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.presentationml.presentation
column4: Edit in Office using Office 2010 will change Mime Type to Text/XML - causing attachment download problem

column3:
When you edit the space details, the '*Home Page*' is not set to the current setting.  It is set to:
# "Home" if the space has a page called "Home" OR
# blank otheriws. (The empty line is selected in the dropdown list.) 
This happens even if you have previously set a home page.

If you then change the space name or description but don't set the space home page, it's very confusing. By default, Confluence will now show the "Pages" view (Recently Updated, Alphabetical or Tree View) whenever anyone goes to the space, rather than the home page.

Instead, the '*Home Page*' dropdown should retain the value as previously set.
column4: Setting of space home page is not retained, causing home page to be set to blank when you edit space details

In Confluence 3.4, we added support for the {expand} user macro and made the code available for administrators to add to their wikis.

column3:
Changes which are made in the Rich Text Editor Full-screen mode are lost unless you Exit full screen mode to save.

How to reproduce:

1. Edit a page in the rich text editor
2. Make some changes Before going to full-screen mode
3. Enter full screen mode and make some more changes
4. Save the page using the Shortcut  (Control-S or Cmd-S) Without leaving full screen mode

Note that the changes from Step 2 will be applied,  but NOT the changes from Step 3.
column4: RTE changes are lost when using the Save shortcut (Control-S) in Full Screen mode

column3:
Current confluence hard codes the version of package scanner to 0.7.7 in the top level pom.xml.

The version tested and built with for the plugin framework is currently 0.9.4. The build should be updated (if possible) just to use the version required by the plugin framework rather than overriding it at the top level.

Note that upgrading to the newer version of this package will likely increase the number of INFO / WARN log messages coming from this library (due to some packages being exported from more than one jar). We may need to either reduce the default logging, or fix the underlying export issues.
column4: Confluence is including an old version of package-scanner, rather than the version required/built/tested with the plugin framework.

column3: Ideally, we would invoke Authenticator.getUser precisely once per request, and cache and reuse that result after that. Right now, we are invoking it over a dozen times per request. Several of these calls are made even when the thread local cached copy of the user information is available and in scope. Most of the rest could be modified to use this cached copy as well.\r\n\r\nReducing the number of times we invoke this Authenticator will speed up our performance on LDAP, and resolve any account lockout issues we may be triggering on systems that restrict (and automatically enforce) the number of failed login attempts.
column4: Authenticator.getUser is invoked too many times per request

column3: Lots of comments on EAC are +1's or some variant. In the Recent Activity macro, below the post title and right of the author information, some text from the post or comment is displayed. However, plus symbols are filtered out of the text in the Recent Activity macro, so it just displays a user's +1 comment as "1" plus whatever the author writes after that. It would be nice if the comment displayed correctly in the macro.

column3:
As shown by CONF-20318, an upgrade task can throw an exception, but the upgrade will still complete "successfully".

In this case, the error made the instance unusable.

Instead of ignoring upgrade task errors, they should be reported to the end user. The text should report that problems were encountered during the upgrade, and the user should restore a back up and try again, and contact support if they get the same result.
column4: Upgrades: Errors thrown by upgrade tasks should be reported to the end user, not ignored

column3:
Customers with some of the [unsupported single sign-on solutions|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DEV/Single+Sign-on+Integration+with+JIRA+and+Confluence] can't easily upgrade to Confluence 3.3 because WebSudo doesn't handle external SSO solutions.

See this example: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+Secure+Administrator+Sessions?focusedCommentId=221446417#comment-221446417

Users can't get into the admin console to disable web sudo

The workaround for this is to start [Confluence in Development Mode|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Enabling+Developer+Mode], disable web sudo, then restart confluence in a normal mode.
column4: Enable Web Sudo to work with other single-sign-on solutions

column3:
Steps to reproduce:
 - Create three pages: testpageA, testpage1, testpage2.
 - Add the dynamic tasklist macro to testpage1, and add a task containing a link to [testpageA] (it is a proper link; if you click on it you go to testpageA.)
 - Also add a link to testpageA on testpage2 (control).
 - Rename testpageA to testpageB.
Result: The link on testpage2 now links to testpageB as expected, but the link on testpage1 still links to a now non-existing testpageA.

Additional info:
If, before renaming testpageA, you select "tools"->"info", you will see that confluence has only registered the incoming link from testpage2 -- not the link in the tasklist on testpage1. So, it seems that the Confluence linking system does even register links within the dynamic tasklist macro (I don't know is this is also true for other macros -- but it should definitely be corrected. Broken links are such a nuisance.)

Why is this important:
We use Confluence to handle projects, and we usually create a central project-page which includes links to the work-items in this project. It would be ideal to use the dynamic tasklist for listing the project's work-items, as this gives a clear visual overview of the project's progress. However, if links within the tasklist gets broken on page rename, we have to abandon the otherwise appealing tasklist and just use a standard bullet-list or similar. :-(
column4: Dynamic Tasklist links does not get updated

column3:
On the page:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Upgrading+Confluence+Standalone+Distribution

Under "Before you start", step 8, the link to the "Confluence Extension space" is an old link (to http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/Home) as this has been migrated by Atlassian, and should link to the Confluence area on the Plugins Exchange (https://plugins.atlassian.com/search/by/confluence)

Not sure where this ticket should actually go, since its a documentation issue, not a confluence product issue.
column4: Link error in Confluence 3.2.1 upgrade guide on confluence.atlassian.com

- When trying to click on the padlock to remove this permission two things can happen:

column4: Removing a page permission triggers a page delete operation

column3: Reported by https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-45178\r\n\r\nEach item in the {plugins-supported} listing, some got hyper link and some none. There should have explanation about this macro.
column4: There is not enough information regarding to  {plugins-supported} macro in Confluence Repository Client plugin

column3:
Confluence will throw a NullPointerException below when it receives a Null value instead of a Group / User name when checking for Group / User permission.
{noformat}
2010-03-24 16:11:01,478 ERROR [http-8080-6] [atlassian.confluence.servlet.ConfluenceServletDispatcher] sendError Could not execute action
 -- url: /pages/getpagepermissions.action | userName: clan | referer: http://localhost:8080/display/permission/Clan%27s+restricted+page
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.confluence.user.PermittedUserFinder.checkGroupExplicitlyPermitted(PermittedUserFinder.java:51)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.user.PermittedUserFinder.makeResult(PermittedUserFinder.java:43)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.actions.GetPagePermissionsAction.execute(GetPagePermissionsAction.java:84)
	at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invoke(DefaultActionInvocation.java:168)
	at com.opensymphony.xwork.interceptor.AroundInterceptor.intercept(AroundInterceptor.java:35)
	at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invoke(DefaultActionInvocation.java:165)
	at com.opensymphony.xwork.interceptor.DefaultWorkflowInterceptor.intercept(DefaultWorkflowInterceptor.java:55)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.core.ConfluenceWorkflowInterceptor.intercept(ConfluenceWorkflowInterceptor.java:35)
{noformat}

This can happen when an LDAP group / User was given a permission (eg. view, edit) in Confluence and then was deleted from the LDAP server.

This problem will cause the specific user who created the permission in the first place to not able adding anymore permission to the space. 

Clicking on padlock or trying to edit Restrictions will result in the stack trace above in the log file. 

No error is visible from the browser.

h4. Workaround

If you hit into this bug and not sure which group to remove from the permission list, the attached patch will help you to identify which groups are causing the problem.

*To install:*
# Unzip the [zip file|^pages.zip] into {{<confluence install>\confluence\WEB-INF\classes\com\atlassian\confluence}}
The patch {{GetPagePermissionsAction.class}} should reside at {{<confluence install>\confluence\WEB-INF\classes\com\atlassian\confluence\pages\actions\}}. If you don't have {{\pages\actions\}} directories under {{<confluence install>\confluence\WEB-INF\classes\com\atlassian\confluence}}, create them.
# Add an extra line in *<confluence install>\confluence\WEB-INF\classes\log4j.properties* file:
{code}
log4j.logger.com.atlassian.confluence.pages.actions.GetPagePermissionsAction=DEBUG
{code}
# Restart Confluence

*To use the patch:*
# Visit the problematic page
# Click on padlock
# Check <confluence data>/logs/atlassian-confluence.log for something like below:
{noformat}
010-03-25 11:23:13,212 DEBUG [http-8080-1] [confluence.pages.actions.GetPagePermissionsAction] execute Fetching group object for group name: ldap-group1. Fetched result is: null
2010-03-25 11:23:13,228 DEBUG [http-8080-1] [confluence.pages.actions.GetPagePermissionsAction] execute Fetching group object for group name: confluence-administrators. Fetched result is: confluence-administrators
2010-03-25 11:23:13,228 DEBUG [http-8080-1] [confluence.pages.actions.GetPagePermissionsAction] execute Fetching group object for group name: ldap-group2. Fetched result is: ldap-group2
2010-03-25 11:23:13,228 DEBUG [http-8080-1] [confluence.pages.actions.GetPagePermissionsAction] execute Fetching group object for group name: ldap-group3. Fetched result is: ldap-group3

In the above there are two LDAP groups that no longer exist (ldap-group1 and ldap-group4) and the Fetched result is null.

column3:
I'm trying, and failing, to include images that appear as attachment to blog posts.


I've ported an old blogger blog into my personal confluence installation.  Some blog posts have images (Confluence will allow me to more easily add even more) attached.

I'm creating Confluence page's with central themes, eg. a trip to Brasil, that I have several tagged blog posts about.
On this page I want to include *all* images from these blog posts according to my tags.

I see this exact functionality does not exist according to the documentation
However, I am supposed to be able to add images that appear on a page.

Blog posts apparently are not "pages", so I can't do this.  Or, I just don't know how to name a specific blog post so that it can work as I want.  I've tried:
No pictures: a blog posts' title, YYYY/MM/DD/Title
Pictures: a page name


I (probably?) replicated the problem in the sandbox, http://sandbox.onconfluence.com/display/ds/gallery+macro+include+blog+attachment+images+bug+test

column3:
This is the new hierarchy for attachments in the file system:
!http://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/179442774/attachmentstorage.png?version=4&modificationDate=1234484336367!

As you can see there are 9 levels including the 'ver003' folder. I found that if you are missing level 8 and 9 in the file system, Confluence can still move the page without any complain. If you are missing level 7 (content id) then it will complain and throw you a stack trace, also failing the move operation:
{noformat}
Cause

com.atlassian.confluence.pages.persistence.dao.UpdateAttachmentsOnFileSystemException: Failed to move the attachment data
at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.persistence.dao.UpdateAttachmentsOnFilesystemOnPageMoveListener.moveAttachments(UpdateAttachmentsOnFilesystemOnPageMoveListener.java:94)

caused by: java.io.FileNotFoundException: Source 'C:\confluencedata_mysql\attachments\ver003\187\36\786437\118\221\721118' does not exist
at org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils.moveDirectory(FileUtils.java:1733)
Stack Trace:[hide]

com.atlassian.confluence.pages.persistence.dao.UpdateAttachmentsOnFileSystemException: Failed to move the attachment data
at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.persistence.dao.UpdateAttachmentsOnFilesystemOnPageMoveListener.moveAttachments(UpdateAttachmentsOnFilesystemOnPageMoveListener.java:94)
at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.persistence.dao.UpdateAttachmentsOnFilesystemOnPageMoveListener.handleEvent(UpdateAttachmentsOnFilesystemOnPageMoveListener.java:67)
at com.atlassian.event.DefaultEventManager$2.run(DefaultEventManager.java:202)
{noformat}

In the above, *721118* is the contentid.

The message is a bit rude and it can be improved perhaps by informing the users that the attachments are not there and/or Confluence should ask whether they want to proceed with the move operation or not.
column4: Missing attachments causes Confluence page move to other space to fail

column3:
Since version 2.8 of the Left Navigation theme, the theme now displays the logo for the page (the space logo for spaces or the user profile image for a user's home).  See attached screenshots for examples.

The issue seems to be in this file:
{{confluence-leftnavigation-theme-2.8.jar/templates/leftnavigation/main.vmd}}

The old main.vmd wrapped the code for showing the logo in the heading/pagetitle with "{{#if(!$showNavigation)}}".  The new code no longer does this, and so it always shows the logo.

This is the relevant section in main.vmd for version 2.8 of the theme (lines 74-79):
{noformat}
#if ($sitemeshPage.getProperty("page.username"))
    #set ($tildeUsername = "~$username")
    #logoBlock($tildeUsername)
#else
    #logoBlock($spaceKey)
#end
{noformat}

I inserted some code before and after, and now it looks like this (now lines 74-81):
{noformat}
#if (!$showNavigation) 
    #if ($sitemeshPage.getProperty("page.username"))
        #set ($tildeUsername = "~$username")
        #logoBlock($tildeUsername)
    #else
        #logoBlock($spaceKey)
    #end
#end
{noformat}

That seemed to fix the problem for us.
column4: Space logo/profile image appears twice in Left Navigation theme

You should check network connections between cluster nodes, especially multicast traffic.

column3:
h3. Original Description 
Long words are being cut off in a PDF export.
Please review the screenshot for more details.

h3. Atlassian Status

This issue has been fixed in version 1.12 of the Confluence PDF Export plugin.


*Note:* In order to break long words in the PDF export a selector containing the {{word-wrap}} property with a value of {{break-word}} has to be added to the PDF stylesheet:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Editing+the+PDF+Stylesheet

For example:
{code}
div {  
    word-wrap: break-word
column4:
}
{code}
column5: Long words fail to wrap in PDF exports

column3:
After I upgraded our Confluence to 3.0.1, the Comments view broke in IE7. It shows just fine in IE8 and Firefox 3.5. I imagine it's a CSS problem? I tried to look for similar issues on the Confluence forums, in Jira, and with a Google search. Found nothing similar.

Edit: Apparently it is the *fancybox web resources* macro of the Advanced Macros plugin that causes this issue. Disabling this macro fixes the problem so that you can view all comments correctly. However, you lose the functionality of collapsing/expanding a single comment. The gallery plugin also seems to rely on this macro, since thumbnails generated by it don't open a lightbox effect anymore, but instead just link to the image.

I hope this issue is fixed quickly as the gallery plugin is widely used in our Confluence instance!

Cheers.
column4: Comments view breaks in IE7 after Confluence 3.0.1 upgrade

column3: Axis is set to use multirefs in its SOAP encoding. While this is sometimes good, often it simply results in SOAP bloat. To make things worse Axis only uses it sometimes. However the main problem is for clients; most do NOT support this. The Sharepoint Connector will not function correctly with this enabled as ASP.NET does not support multirefs. Multirefs should be disabled by default.
column4: Axis MultiRef should be disabled

column3:
All the following comments are regarding the notation help ( http://..../renderer/notationhelp.action ) 

Under "Advanced Formatting" in the comment section:
* the first line reads "Makes a preformatted block of code with syntax highlighting. All the optional parameters of "panel" macro....." but should read "....of the "panel" macro" since it's referring to a specific macro in context to another one.  (note that I had to remove the curly braces from "panel" in this bugreport)
*Also, in the second comment box, "axes.The" should be "axes. The" (missing a space). 
*In the same comment box, at the bullet "Axis customization parameters", the paragraph ends in "paramters" which should be "parameters".
*In the paragraph above the date formatting guidelines "theyre" should be "they're"
*In the paragraph below the date formatting guildelines, which starts "For parsing with the...", "isnt" should be "isn't"
*In the Graphviz section, a shape is called "ellise", but I assume it should be "ellipse"
*In the "pagetree" section, "hierachal" should be "hierarchal"
*In the "blog-posts" section, 10:th line from the bottom in the comments box, "type.By" should be "type. By" (missing a space) [this is also in "recently-updated" and "contentbylabel"]
*In the "contributors-summary" comment box, 3:rd line from the bottom, "decentants" should be "descendants". [the same goes for "decentants" in the 7:th line from the bottom of the comment box for "contributors"]
*In the "usage" section, fifth line from the bottom of the comment box, "popularilty" should be "popularity"
*In the "plugin-compatibility-matrix" section, "compatibile" should be "compatible"

In "Text Effects", quoteable should be quotable (in two instances)

In "Links", in the second comment box, second line, "apear" should be "appear", and in the sixth line from the bottom in the same comment box, "doublequotes" should be "double quotes"

In "Images", fifth comment box, first line, "pagesthat" should be "pages that"

In the "Macros" chapter for the "Vote" section, the following needs to be amended:

Parameter  |  Required | Default | Description....
(blank)        |  true           |               |  This is the.....paramter     <--- blank should be "vote" and "paramter" should be "parameter"
voters          |  false         |    ....       |  This is a comma seperated ....    <-- "seperated" should be "separated"
viewers      |   false        |    ....         |     (same as above)

In the "survey" section:
* there are three instances of "seperate(d)" which should be "separate(d)"
* "overriden" in cell C4R5 should be "overridden"
* "Dont" in cell C4R7 should be "Don't"

Global for the document:
*In four instances, "preformatted" should really be "pre-formatted".
*In six instances, "dont" should be "don't"
column4: Spelling errors and missing information in the online documentation (i.e. the notation guide)

column3:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-15403].
  {panel}

*issue:*
We have serveral thousands page per space. If I want to move a page from a specified location (node) to another, i have to wait a _long_ time (a few minutes).  I can't move a page, before the complete tree (all viewable nodes) was loaded.

I think there are two reasons for this problem.

*1. You load all pages (content entity objects) at once.*

- Can it be reasonable, if you don't load all entities at once? (using AJAX for "lazy"-loading?)

*2. The complete creation process consists of three steps!*
 * Firstly, you load all pages.
 * Secondly, you check the permission for each page.
 * Finally, you sort the list of remaining pages by title. (Collections.sort() + overriden equals method)

 - Is there any chance to combine this actions in only one hql statement? (join with permission table and order by?)
column4: Low performance on loading the hierarchical view

column3:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14262].
  {panel}

It would be extremely useful is it was possible to change the creator of an page (and other content) via the GUI.
As the creator is often considered as responsible for the content this might lead to misconceptions or unnecessary questions
for example in cases when the original creator might have left the company long time ago.

This is even more valid if pages were created by some innocent intern 
who might not have a single clue about the content he transfered into the system ;-D

I would envision functions for a individual change (as a right which can be granted to users) 
as well as batch transitions (change every bit of content from EmployeeA to EmployeeB as an administrative option) 

---

A slightly different approach might be to establish some sort of responsibility list for each item that can be edited,
although this would not prevent people from falling back to ask the creator forever and ever.
column4: Deliberate change of Content Creator

column3: If Confluence source code is customized and extra css is added to the war, Confluence returns text/html mimetype for all these css files. The patch is attached.
column4: PATCH: Confluence sets incorrect content type for css files bundled in war

column3:
*What and why:* At our Confluence site we use WEBSEC_CONFLUENCE_USERS as the general group for users, since this is a requirement of our User Directory (LDAP). If a user logs in and creates his personal space, the other users still don't have access, even if he checks the "[x] registered users" question at personal space creation time.

At personal space creation the question appears...
{code}Choose who can view and comment on content:
[x] Me
[x] Registered users - anyone logged into Confluence
{code}
But who is "registered users"? It's the standard group "confluence-users" that is entered into his space permissions to read and/or write.

*So the improvement would be:* The Confluence Admin should be allowed to set which group is meant by "registered users".
column4: Let Confluence Admin globally chose what user group is meant by "registered users" when a user creates his personal space.

column3:
After "Backdate blog entries" (CONF-1711) was created, a lot of people mentioned the possibility to create blog posts in the future.

Considering we have many problems with the "calendar plugin", which does not allow easy SQL parsing or reporting plugin interoperability, we'd like to use the blog posts from a certain space as an agenda for events, thus allowing to report all events between some date ranges and display them as we like, and get rid of the calendar plugin.

We really need this to get a proper rendering of a calendar.
column4: Blog entries in the future => best replacement for badly integrated "calendar plugin" ?

column3:
This is an umbrella issue for a number of changes I've made to diffing for a 20% project. In short:

* Add optional diff section to notification emails
* Refactor diff code to produce POJOs, not hardcoded HTML
* Add context to diff results so that unnecessary context can be snipped / add JS to toggle context on page.
* More intelligent word diffing - changes to a line should be detected as different to line removals/additions. This should allow for insertions with concurrent line changes.
* Roll out new diff to email/view-changes/RSS/page-merge areas & deprecate old DiffUtils class
* tests for all levels of diff
column4: Refactor page diffing and reinstate diffs in watch emails

This is causing us major problems.

column3:
The {{ConfluenceCachingCaptchaStore}} class has no explicit cache configuration in the {{confluence-coherence-cache-config-clustered.xml}} meaning that it will by default use a replicated cache.

It seems that our current version of jcaptcha has a bug which can mean deserialization fails  in certain circumstances and by using a distributed cache we can fall victim to this defect. See http://forge.octo.com/jcaptcha/jira/browse/FWK-80

We can avoid this problem by not using a distributed cache, but also there is probably no need to be caching captcha's across all nodes in the cluster. With session affinity the captcha doesn't need to be cached beyond the node it was generated on.

We should probably just add something like -
{noformat}
        <cache-mapping>
            <cache-name>com.atlassian.confluence.cache.jcaptcha.ConfluenceCachingCaptchaStore</cache-name>
            <scheme-name>local:default</scheme-name>
        </cache-mapping>
{noformat}

This is raised from the support case https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-20815
column4: Don't use distrbuted cache for storing Captcha's in a cluster

column3:
The MySQL MyISAM storage engine does not support foreign key constraints or transactions. This may cause data corruption and is not recommended for use.

Since its the default storage engine for MySQL Confluence is often installed using it without any warning given to the user.  Confluence will work perfectly until the lack of foreign keys and proper transaction isolation causes data corruption, at which point creating backups or upgrading can be very difficult.

It would be great to detect this storage type during Confluence boot and provide an appropriate message on the user interface and/or in the system logs.
column4: Detect MySQL MyISAM Storage Type and report as Error

column3: When using Confluence, and Tomcat 5.5.26 or Tomcat 6 some users may find that their logins are not remembered.  This is because of a bug in Tomcat's cookie handling.  This is logged against the Atlassian Seraph library used by Confluence as SER-117. SER-117 has been fixed, so we "just" need to use a later version of Seraph.\r\n\r\nNote that this only affects Tomcat users; Resin and Orion are not appear to be affected.
column4: Some users' logins are not remembered using Tomcat

I'm currently writing a Perl module abstraction layer for the Confluence SOAP API.

When using the spacekey "sandbox" and pagetitle "Home" with: 
my $pagetest = $self->{client}->getPage($self->{token}, $spacekey, $pagetitle);
I don't get any result. $pagetest seems to be empty. 

Whereas with getPage($self->{token}, $pageid); using the id of the sandbox Home.. it gets me a correct Page result.

What's wrong? Looks to me as if getPage is broken using spacekey and pagetitle in the request.
A possible workaround would now be to use the search function ... but that's too borked.
column4: getPage(String token, String spaceKey, String pageTitle) seems broken

column3:
One of the build failures we occassionally see is on resin and gives strange and seemingly irrelevant XML parsing errors, typically from parsing the hibernate configs. A typical error is -

{noformat}
org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: The string "--" is not permitted within comments.
{noformat}

It turns out this is due to the way Xerces is parsing XML resource being read via the resin classloader. Roughly, the XML resource is being supplied in chunks and Xerces seems to think it can sensibly parse incomplete chunks. 

Without a greater understanding of the exact problem, it would seem that potentially any changes to XML files within the confluence.jar could cause seemingly random XML parse errors in Resin.

A quick test with xerces 2.9.0 showed that this problem no longer occurs, so we should make sure the rest of the system is happy with this change and upgrade as soon as possible.
column4: Upgrade xerces to latest to resolve resin XML parsing problem

column3:
See http://developer.atlassian.com/jira/browse/CPDK-1

The maven2 plugin executes the plugin upload, and needs to determine success or failure at a minimum.  Since the current xwork action redirects (302) upon success, and a login failure is redirected (302) by the container based on invalid credentials, there is no possible way to determine success or failure.

{code:xml}<action name="uploadplugin" class="com.atlassian.confluence.admin.actions.plugins.UploadPluginAction">
            <result name="input" type="velocity">/admin/plugins.vm</result>
            <result name="error" type="velocity">/admin/plugins.vm</result>
            <result name="success" type="redirect">/admin/plugins.action?pluginKey=${pluginKey}</result>
        </action>{code}

If this action is utilized by any pages, I would suggest an additional, dedicated xwork action to create a response that indicates success, failure, or even more information by an automated client.  I would assume that recognizing the 302 as a login failure is the best way to handle that issue, so no deeper or intrusive changes are necessary on the container.
column4: XWork action "uploadplugin" must return a response that distinguishes success or failure (NOT a redirect)

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-10618].
  {panel}

Hello,
 
I am trying to create a restricted calnedar on our team wiki site. The current command I am using for a tab named 'R1 Schedule' is
 
{calendar:id=R1Schedule\|title=CCIE Rack 1 Schedule}
 
I would like to have the same exact layout and options except for one slight difference. When one adds an event, I would like the time frame to be limited. Normal users are to only be able to add an event from the current day, up to a maximum of 14 days
 
For example. If I come to add an event, I can only add an event for today, and not a future day. Also, there would be a drop down box that allows me to select the numbers of days I would be scheduling the event for.  ie. 1, 2, 3, ..., 6, 7     and possibly have the drop down box up to 14 days.
 
An example of some code I have viewed from a website I have seen is:

<select name="daysneeded" onChange="addDays(this.options[this.options.selectedIndex].value)">
					<option value="initial">initial</option>
				</select>

This creates a drop down box with preset values; the values I need are from 1 up to 14 days. The header above that drop down box is "Days Needed"

Lastly, I also need to allow an administrator to be able to add events at any time, current or future. This is for reservation purposes.
 
I appreciate your time and help.
column4: Restrictions to adding Calendar Events

column3:
Confluence will now log to the confluence.home directory by default. See CONF-6582.

As far as I can find, only one documentation update is required.

1) In http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Installing+the+Confluence+EAR-WAR+edition.
Step 4 contains two identical XML configuration snippets. Both of these snippets should be simplified to 
{noformat}
<Context path="/confluence" docBase="c:/applications/confluence-2.1.3/confluence" debug="0" reloadable="false"/>
{noformat}

The release note for 2.7 should mention the change to logging behaviour.
Previously standalone releases would log to <tomcat location>/logs/atlassian-confluence.log.
EAR/WAR releases would log to the console.

This has now been changed. Both editions follow the same default logging behaviour -
Logging will be to the console until Confluence has completed it's initial bootstrap. Then all logging will be to <confluence.home>/logs/atlassian-confluence.log. It should be noted that any logging that went to the console will be repeated into the confluence.home log.

Of course, as always customers are encouraged to think about and configure logging to their own requirements.
column4: Update documentation for logging to home directory feature

column3:
This is actually a change to Crowd documentation but is triggered by changes in Confluence.

----
For the forthcoming 2.5.x release and for 2.6, the documentation for integrating with Crowd needs some small changes.
I guess this change should also apply to 1.0 Crowd documentation.

In the descriptions below I'm referring to the documentation at -
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CROWD/3.2.3+Integrating+Crowd+with+Atlassian+Confluence

Step 1 in section 2.1 asks you to copy jar files to {{.../WEB-INF/lib}}.
An additional jar is required if you are using Confluence 2.6 or Confluence 2.5.6 or later.
This jar is called {{crowd-integration-bamboo-1.1.1.jar}} and is available from the link -
{{http://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/198785/crowd-integration-bamboo-1.1.1.jar?version=1}}


Step 1 in section 2.2 asks you to uncomment a repository setting. This should be changed to document adding a new entry of -

{noformat}
<crowd key="crowd" name="Crowd Repository"/> 
{noformat}

Just to re-iterate, this change is only applicable for Confluence 2.6 and 2.5.6. For older versions the instructions are unchanged.

(This was introduced by {{http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/USER-165}} which now bundles atlassian-user-1.5 with Confluence 2.6 and Confluence 2.5.6.)
column4: Changes to Crowd and Confluence integration instructions

column4:
nested exception is java.sql.BatchUpdateException: Data truncation: Data too long for column 'SPACEKEY' at row 1
 at org.springframework.jdbc.support.SQLStateSQLExceptionTranslator.translate(SQLStateSQLExceptionTranslator.java:99)
caused by: java.sql.BatchUpdateException: Data truncation: Data too long for column 'SPACEKEY' at row 1

column3:
Support for "Shared mode" was dropped in v2.5.3, but the updater doesn't turn the mode off when upgrading to this version.

If the shared mode was on before the update, Confluence still runs in the shared mode after the update and there is no obvious way how to turn this mode off because the gui in admin console is gone.

Confluence should check during the installation if the shared mode is on, and if it is, it should turn if off - ideally creating a log about this as well.

The main side effect of this is that while the shared mode is on, confluence suffers from bug: http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-7908 which now makes it impossible to create new spaces
column4: Updater doesn't turn the "shared mode" off when upgrading to a version that doesn't expose shared mode setting via admin console

column3:
The input from "Add Labels" text box is not properly validated. There are two major flaws:
1) the string length is not validated - if string is longer than 255 characters an error message is displayed: "[41a] Error connecting to the server. The labels have not been updated."

2) the input is not properly escaped and lets html pass through - "<" and ">" are allowed characters (why?!?!?) and are not even being properly escaped - this makes is super easy to modify the DOM structure and modify the look of the site. See http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TEST/Label+Validation+Problem for examples. Only the fact that ":" and "(" are not allowed characters makes it difficult to use this hole for an XSS exploit - but the possibility of finding a way to create a XSS exploit using this hole still exists.

Suggested fix:
1) add length validation
2) there are two ways how to fix the second issue
   a) add "<" and ">" as well as "" and  "/" among forbidden characters
   b) encode the string using html entities (http://www.w3schools.com/tags/ref_entities.asp)
column4: Input for Labels is not properly validated

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7945].
  {panel}

Users appear to be manually adding anonymous comment spam to public Confluence instances such as http://confluence.atlassian.com

If captcha is bypassed, it would be useful to allow logged-in users the option of flagging comments or pages as spam. 

At the bottom of each page should be a 'Report Spam' option for logged-in users only. Clicking this link adds the label 'spam' to the page. If the page already has the label 'spam', the link should read 'Remove Spam Flag'

Administrators can then monitor an RSS feed or watch for pages marked as spam.
column4: Add 'Report Spam' Option For Logged In Users

column3:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-7526].
  {panel}

When editing a page, if a user accidentally clicks cancel, the draft is immediately discarded without method of recovery. Since cancelling destroys data permanently, a confirmation dialogue box should pop-up to provide users with an opportunity to avoid losing their change.

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 10 December 2014 |borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
UPDATE 12 Jan 2015: We have resolved this issue, though using a slightly different approach: 
In Edit Mode: "Cancel" has been renamed to "Close" and will NOT discard your work. Drafts are auto-saved and recoverable. 
In Preview Mode: "Cancel"/"Close" has been disabled! Click "Edit" to go back to the editor. 
In Comment Editor: "Cancel" will show a confirmation dialog to warn that comments will be lost. 

This will be available in the upcoming Confluence release (5.7) - within a couple of months and will also be available to Cloud (previously OnDemand) customers within a few weeks. Stay tuned. 
----

Thank you for your suggestions and feedback on this issue. We acknowledge this issue is causing pain & inconvenience. We are currently looking into this and will update this issue when we've make progress on it.

Henk Kleynhans
Senior Product Manager - Confluence
{panel}
column4: Add cancel confirmation dialog to edit page

column3:
Currently, PluginEvent subclasses only contain the human-readable name of the plugin. They should contain the plugin key instead, for two reasons:

1) The plugin key is what is used to retrieve individual plugins in the PluginManager and are guaranteed to be unique.
2) The name is intended to be human-readable and is not supposed to be used programatically. It's also not guaranteed to be unique.

The upshot of this is that when receiving plugin events, the only information you are given is basically useless. If it's a PluginInstallEvent or a PluginEnableEvent you can trawl through the whole list of installed plugins and check the name manually, but you are not guaranteed that the real source of the event was another plugin with the same name.

However, if it's a PluginUninstallEvent or a PluginDisableEvent, you can't even do that, since the plugin no longer shows up in the list!

This is most annoying and renders the events practically useless. Please fix!
column4: PluginEvents do not contain the plugin key the event is associated with.

column3:
Confluence allows you to configure groups and individual users just about anyway you like at the space level.  However, the "Restrict View" and "Restrict Edit" options at the page level are, well, too restrictive.  

You can only select 1 user or group for page level access.  This forces the creation of "artificial" groups.  For example, I have a group for my developers wilth r/w access to a space and a group for my client with read access to the same space.  We've a situation where 1 individual in the client organization needs r/w access to a few pages in the aforementioned space.  It appears that the only way to accomplish this is to create a new group (my developers + the one individual).  

This is further exacerbaed by the user/group handling.  There's no way to 'copy' an existing group to a new one,si
column4: Better page level permissions handling

column3:
Referring to https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-3887

The following doc needs to be updated accordingly:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+a+MySQL+Datasource+in+Tomcat

The syntax as of Tomcat 5.5 is (quoting the above mentioned support request):

<Resource name="jdbc/intradb" auth="Container" type="javax.sql.DataSource"
        username="confluence_int_u"
        password="******"
        driverClassName="com.mysql.jdbc.Driver"
        url="jdbc:mysql://localhost/confluence_intra_utf8?autoReconnect=true&amp
;useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=UTF8"
        validationQuery="Select 1" />

Thanks to Kalle Hallivuori for pointing that out.
column4: Documentation needs updating - setting up a MySQL Datasource is different in the Tomcat 5.5 (shipped with Confluence 2.2)

column3:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-6054].
  {panel}

When editing a page, the top half of the page springs up fairly quickly...then pauses, then the edit window shows up a several seconds later.

The HTML can be upwards of 150Kb, even with only 30 characters of actual content.

The reason seems to be the newSpaceKey drop-down which on a large site can have hundreds, or in our enterprise installation, *thousands* of spacekeys and descriptions - totally some 90kb.

I find that users less frequently move pages *between* spaces, so this seems like a great place for a bit of Ajax magic to speed things up. Also, a drop-down of 1,750 spaces is almost impossible to use, so I'd like the option of just displaying the *favorite spaces* and/or the ability to type a spacekey to search for the spaces.

If you have a large or rapidly growing Confluence site, and plan to have many public spaces, you might want to vote for this issue. :-)


Timo
column4: Location newSpaceKey drop-down slows edit page on large sites

column3:
We have created a DITA to Confluence converter that allows us to export our document set to Confluence. Though far from perfect, the converter has allowed us to export our entire document set to Confluence. We can work outside of Confluence to update and maintain our doc set and we can then export these changes to Confluence. One stumbling block we would like discussed is the unique page name per space limitation.

Basically, our doc set is currently divided into several documents with children pages. Because of our DITA environment, we have setup several common pages that are referenced across all documents (for instance, we have a common copyright page that is used across all of the documents). This works fine when the information in the referenced page is the same across all documents, but this does not work when we have pages that are specific to just one document or set of documents. For instance, we'll have an introduction page for a Windows-related document that is not compatible with the Unix-related document. Currently, the first uploaded introduction page is the one that is used across all document sets so we end up say having the Windows introduction page in the Unix document.

Our current proposed workaround is to have a convoluted page naming system (Introduction to Windows, Introduction to UNIX, etc), though, because of the size of our documentation set, we already see maintenance issues not to mention the creation of pedantic system that would have no benefit to our users (think Confluence Dewey decimal system for page names). Also, because we want to be able to order the pages in a logical order, we will have to add numbers to each page name as it seems the page ordering is still not possible in Confluence (see http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-1031).

Perhaps another workaround would be to have each document be a separate space? However, this will defeat our efforts at having one "documentation space." We can add unique page ids to each page outside of Confluence so that this can be cancelled at the beginning of DITA to confluence conversion process, however, our hands our tied if we can't have multiple versions of the same page name in the same space. Is there any way to enforce or add unique page id metadata that would allow us to create a workaround?

Note: I have looked at several other Page-related issues and other Confluence issues, so hopefully I'm no duplicating this issue.
column4: Unique page names in space limitation
